, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Emaciated<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Suffers from disorders\nof the sense organs.-<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ojas is diminished by\nunder eating, overeating, eating when previous food has not yet been digested,\nconsumption of poor quality food that results in the blocking of the channels,\nconsumption of stale foods, canned foods, fermented foods like cheese, meat,\nirregular diet, excessive exercise, fasting, negative emotional stressors such\nas anxiety, anger, sadness, grief, hatred, jealousy, long held resentment,\nfear, grief, consumption of alcohol, smoking,&nbsp;\nlack of sleep, excessive discharge of mucus, blood, semen and other\nexcreta, with age and injury by other organisms, undue exposure to wind and\nsun, excessive sexual activity. Since Ojas is the result of the quality of food\nwe eat, its proper digestion and efficient metabolism and the sensory\nimpressions we imbibe in our daily life, in order to protect ojas it is vital\nto protect the mind and heart from emotional strain and stress and to adopt a\nhealthy balanced diet.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Nourish your physical\nhealth by eating meals in a pleasant environment in the company of people that\nyou enjoy.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Eat at a moderate pace.\nDon\u2019t eat in a hurry, while walking or driving.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Don\u2019t eat when you are\nemotional, angry, upset etc.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Don\u2019t eat if the\nprevious meal still hasn\u2019t been digested as that will lead to the production of\nama/toxins. The accumulation&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; of ama\nin the bodily tissues leads to disease.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Eat a balance\nmeal.&nbsp; In Ayurveda, a balanced meal\nconsists of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; all the 6 major tastes\nin moderation: sweet, salty, sour, bitter,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nastringent, and pungent.&nbsp; People\nof&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; pitta constitutions should\nminimize or avoid hot, pungent, spicy foods as&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; that will further aggravate the pitta\n(internal fire) which could further&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nburn out the ojas.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Nourish your mind\nthrough regular meditation<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Positive thinking<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>What is Tejas?<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Tejas is responsible\nfor inner radiance, glow or aura, luster in one\u2019s eyes, clarity, fearlessness,\ncourage, intelligence, and understanding and comprehension at the cellular\nlevel.&nbsp; It is the subtle and positive essence\nor counterpart of pitta or fire element in the body and is responsible for the\ndigestion and metabolism of everything we take in. Tejas can be compared to\nhormones and amino acids that regulate cellular metabolism.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hence tejas is needed\nfor metabolism.&nbsp; If tejas in a person is\ntoo high it burns out the ojas (just as fire evaporates water), as in the case\nwith multiple sclerosis.&nbsp; The myelin\nsheaths which are composed of ojas (water element) are burned by high tejas (fire\nelement).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Negative thinking\ndamages ojas, tejas, prana, immune system, the spleen, the function of the\nlymphatic system.&nbsp; The thymus gland is\nlocated very close to the heart which is the seat of emotions.&nbsp; Hence any negative emotional disturbance will\naffect the thymus. Gently tapping the sternum stimulates the thymus gland which\nin turn stimulates the immune system.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Tejas gets diminished\nby:<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Excessive talking<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Psychological\n/emotional imbalances<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Negative thinking<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>For a healthy balance\nof tejas one should:<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Enforce positive\nthinking.&nbsp; Positive thinking strengthens\nojas, tejas and prana and the thymus gland, which is responsible for a\nhealthy&nbsp; immune system and good health.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Meditate<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Chant mantras<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Try sitting in the\nmeditation position, in a lotus pose as that helps open up the heart chakra,\ncalms the breath and balances ojas, tejas and prana.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Practice awareness in\nthought, words and action<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</i></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Avoid gossip, excessive\ntalking, negative talk etc.</i><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/rGakMycKnOs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/rGakMycKnOs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">The prostate is a small\ngland located between a man's penis and his bladder. Its main function is to\nproduce a thick white fluid that is mixed with the sperm produced by the\ntesticles, to create semen.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">&nbsp;A healthy young man's body is still going to\nproduce semen. And this semen needs to be regularly flushed from his body. If a\nman has a sick gland, it undoubtedly benefit from increased blood flow.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gland itself\nrequires some muscular contraction and/or massage to keep the blood flowing\nproperly through it and flush out toxins . This is how it gets cleaned. It is\nbecause it is such a fine filter for the liquid that becomes semen that it\ncollects so many toxins and becomes so susceptible to cancers.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">If sperm is regularly\ncleaned out to allow new cells to develop, it helps stop the build-up of old\ncells that might be more likely to turn cancerous.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are yogic asanas which can do this job\nwithout ejaculation</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">or else you increase\nyour risk of prostate cancer ( which Vivekananda had- so balls to his veerya\nand ojas )</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. APARIGRAHA is renunciation\nof unnecessary possessions.Aparigraha is the ability to see the problems caused\nby acquisition, preservation, and destruction of things, since these provoke\nattachment and injury. Possessions produce samskaras which activate in the\nfuture to cause distress if we can\u2019t acquire items desired by us or losing the\nitems that we possess. Yogis are advised to acquire only what is required for\nbasic maintenance and give up all else. Parigraha is covetousness or greed.\nAparigraha is a mental state in which the sensual craving is dead. Parigraha\nleads to anxiety to preserve, fear of loss, hatred, anger, untruthfulness,\nstealing, etc. Aparigraha puts an end to all these and bestows peace and\ncontentment. It removes at one stroke fear, attachment, disappointment,\nanxiety, jealousy, anger, lust and depression. Aparigraha is indeed an aid to\nthe practice of ahimsa, satya and asteya. When the craving is not satisfied you\nbecome angry, you hate the person who stands in your way of attaining things.\nYou harm him in different ways, speak untruth and begin to steal things.\nAparigraha removes all these. It is the foundation of all yogas, just as dhyana\nor meditation is the meeting point of all yogas. Neutralizing the desire to\nacquire and hoard wealth . The yamas are the moral virtues which, if attended\nto, purify human nature and contribute to health and happiness of society. Yoga\nis rooted in the notion of developing a positive personality. Therefore ethical\ndiscipline or the practice of correct conduct is necessary for success in yoga.\nThis is the basis of yama and niyama, the two moral backbones of yoga. They\ndefine the attributes to be practised in everyday life by a spiritual aspirant.\nYama is the first limb of Patanjali\u2019s ashtanga yoga and means \u2018taking a vow\u2019\nwhile niyama is the second limb and means \u2018rule of conduct\u2019. Yama and niyama\nare inter-dependent. Niyama strengthens and safeguards yama. For example, if\none is contented, one will not steal, hurt others or tell lies and will find it\neasy to practise non-covetousness.&nbsp; When\none is sufficiently advanced in the practices of yamas and niyamas, one can\nface every temptation by calling in the aid of pure and restraining thoughts.\nWhen the mind becomes pure it attains the state of steadiness and becomes\none-pointed. If these positive qualities are not cultivated, the mind cannot be\nled to steadiness. One needs to be well established in yama-niyama to attain\nperfection in yoga. When one is perfectly established in them, samadhi will\ncome by itself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.31\u2014 jatideshakalasamayanavachchhinnah\nsarvabhauma mahavratam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Yamas are the great,\nmighty, universal vows, unconditioned by place, time and class. </i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this sutra Patanjali\nemphasizes&nbsp; that the five yamas are\nabsolute, non-negotiable and universal for yogis and cannot be exempted under\nany circumstance such as class, place, time, or circumstance. The five\ncomponents of yama are called 'mighty universal vows', because they are not\ntrammeled to class, place, time or notion of duty. They must be followed\nunconditionally by everyone, and by students of yoga particularly, irrespective\nof origin and situation, with a reservation concerning cultural phenomena like\nreligious ceremonies, vows and vocations of certain people. They form the\nskeleton of rules on which society is grounded. It is however of the belief\nthat this universal approach should be applied to all the other component\nstages of yoga, without discrimination of time, place or circumstances, to lay\ndown the principles of a universal culture. For full-time, dedicated yogis,\nthese vows (of yamas) are not be broken under any circumstance limited by time,\nplace, purpose, social or caste rules, winter, summer, morning, evening etc.\nFor yogis not committed to their yogic goals, these vows can be modified\naccording to their position in life. There are exceptions to yamas.&nbsp; A fisherman due to his occupation needs to\ninflict violence only on fish but nowhere else. Kshatriyas, the warrior class, &nbsp;are allowed violence for protecting the watan\nfrom evil invaders who want to loot, rape women and make people slaves.&nbsp; We Indians were slaves for 800 years , first\nto invading Muslims and then to the white Christian.&nbsp; Jew Rothschild had his agent Gandhi telling\nus to ghumao charka while the white invader robbed Bharatmata blind and\nconverted India from the riches &nbsp;to the\npoorest in 250 years flat.. Gandhi cheated Bharatmata. &nbsp;As per Patanjali, if a Kshatriya wishes to be\na yogi, he must abandon violence altogether even though it may be condoned\nbased on some sacred scriptures. In the Karma-yoga section of Bhagavad Gita,\nKrishna exhorts Arjuna to do his duty as a Kshatriya and engage in violent\nwarfare and kill his near and dear . This may be acceptable in a socio-civic\ncontext, but must be renounced in an ascetic path of yoga. It may be argued\nthat once avidya (ignorance) has been removed, one can act from a position of\nenlightenment and may engage in violence in certain circumstances (war, for\nexample); however, Patanjali makes it clear that no such exception can be made\nfor one on the path to enlightenment. Patanjali would like to make it clear\nthat even though one\u2019s dharma may dictate violating one or more of these yamas,\nfor a yogi they must be treated as great vows, never to be violated. Yamas, and\nits complement, Niyamas, represent a series of \"right living\" or\nethical rules.&nbsp; They are a form of moral\nimperatives, commandments, rules or goals. The Yamas are the \"don't do\nthese\" list of self-restraints, typically representing commitments that\naffect one's relations with others and self. The complementary Niyamas\nrepresent the \"do these\" list of observances, and together Yamas and\nNiyamas are personal obligations to live well. The earliest mention of the word\nYamas is in the 7000 year old Rigveda. The Yamas apply broadly and include\nself-restraints in one's actions, words and thoughts. Yama is the very\nfoundation of Yoga, without which the superstructure of Yoga cannot be built.\nPractice of Yama is really the practice of Sadachara (right conduct). Manu\nsays: Ahimsa satyasteyam sauchamindriya nigraha - harmlessness, truth speaking,\nrefraining from theft, control of senses; this is the essence of Dharma. Great\nemphasis is given in every chapter of the Gita on the practice of Yama. The ten\nyamas listed by \u015a\u0101\u1e47\u1e0dilya Upanishad, are:--Ahi\u1e43s\u0101 (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0939\u093f\u0902\u0938\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">):\nNonviolence,Satya (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0924\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">): truthfulness,Asteya\n(</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0938\u094d\u0924\u0947\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">):\nnot stealing,Brahmacharya (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092c\u094d\u0930\u0939\u094d\u092e\u091a\u0930\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">): chastity,marital\nfidelity or sexual restraint,K\u1e63am\u0101 (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u094d\u0937\u092e\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">):\nforgiveness,Dh\u1e5bti (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0927\u0943\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">): fortitude, Day\u0101 (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0926\u092f\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">):\ncompassion,\u0100rjava (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0906\u0930\u094d\u091c\u0935</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">): non-hypocrisy,\nsincerity,Mit\u0101h\u0101ra (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u093f\u0924\u0939\u093e\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">): measured diet, \u015aauca\n(</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u094c\u091a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">):\npurity, cleanliness<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">I WAS\nA VERY SUCCESSFUL &nbsp;\u201cCHANGE MANAGER \u201c &nbsp;AT SEA.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; Shiva ( COSMIC ALLEGORY ) laughed and said that she will not be able to find one man with all these 5 qualities-- instead she shall marry five men who shall possess each of her mentioned qualities.<br Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/steroid-pumped-muscles-do-not-provide.html?showComment=1513899174704#c236000836569887077\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">December 22, 2017 at 5:02 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_175MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\nDRAUPADI IS YAJNASENI -- BORN OUT OF HOMAM FIRE-- AN ALLEGORY..( HEAT OF KUNDALINI )<br />\n<br />\nAnd, 'auspicious, eye-ravishing, large-black-eyed Panchali rose from the yajna altar, Dark-skinned Panchali Lotus-eyed lady,wavy-haired Panchali, Hair like dark blue clouds, Shining coppery carved nails, Soft eye-lashes, Swelling breasts Shapely thighs. A girl like goddess born to humans. 'There was none on earth to match her loveliness. Gods, anti-gods, and yakshas yearned for such celestial beauty.' (169:45-47, Adi Parva, Mahabharata)<br />\n<br />\nDraupadi\u2019s biological parents were Agni and Swaha . She was adopted by Drupad, King of Panchala, which is why her name was changed from Agni Jyotsna to Princess of Panchala to Drupad Kanya to Draupadi. The sages called her Yajna Seni as she was born from the sacrificial fire.<br />\n<br />\nShe was a fully grown woman, dressed in the best of sSilk, unusually rare jewelry. A dark complexioned maiden, so dark, that when her hair brushed over her face, the black raven like hair, looked golden brown, so dark was her complexion.<br />\n<br />\nVoluptuous with a slender waist. She had a naturally aromatic odor that could be sensed a \u2018yojana\u2019 away (a measurement for distance).<br />\n<br />\nDraupadi as Kundalini has five human chakras she has to cross before she finds refuge in the topmost Sahasrara chakra ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE BASTARD WHITE INVADER MADE DRAUPADI A DAUGHTER (NALAYANI ) OF NALA AND DAMAYANTI IN HER PREVIOUS BIRTH .. WE IN INDIA NEVER HEARD OF NALA AND DAMAYANTI TILL THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA.<br />\n<br />\nRAHU AND KETU WERE WOVEN INTO THE \"BHAKTI MOVEMENT \" BULLSHIT STORY .. ROTHSCHILD GOT THIS FAKE STORY ADAPTED INTO KERALA KATHAKALI..<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHITE BASTARDS WROTE A BULLSHIT BOOK ON COOKERY ( PAKADARPANAM-- WITH BEEF ) AND TOLD THAT NALA , AN EXCELLENT COOK WROTE IT. ROTHSCHILD GOT THE CRYPTO JEW KARALA PRINCE RAVI VARMA TO PAINT NALA AND DAMAYANTI.<br />\n<br />\nTHE BHAKTi MOVEMENT AND ITS HEROES WERE CREATED AND BACKDATED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD.. IN HINDUSIM WE HAVE ONLY SHRADDHA \u2013NEVER BHAKTI..<br />\n<br />\nEVERY DASA OF THE BHAKTI MOVEMENT IS FAKE AND BACKDATED<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/kalidasa-did-not-exist-jainism-is.html<br />\n<br />\nIN FUTURE IF ANTI-HINDUS AND JNU COMMIES MAKE FUN OF DRAUPADI--WE SHALL THROW THEM INTO JAIL<br />\n<br />\nENOUGH IS ENOUGH!<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_175B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; text-decoration: none;\">July 21, 2016 at 5:20 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_109MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSir, Salutes. I wish to know the scientific truth behind our practice in India. We used to preserve and put a segment of umbilical cord in a tiny silver box and tie it with black or red rope and wear it around the waist of our child. We use it with the lactating mothers milk and give that to the child whenever the child gets sick. Is it our stem cell banking system of medicine and we practiced it as our way of life. Kindly tell me. I am searching the answer for it for a long time. I am from Tamil Nadu. I did that for my son too. Your blog gave me a vast knowledge about us. Thank you...</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_109BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; display: inline-block; font-size: 16px;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_108TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_108TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_109b+seedILnfD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_108B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5748865916522614514\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_108M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/09/ethics-of-human-cloning-decided-6000.html?showComment=1469075056309#c5748865916522614514\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 21, 2016 at 9:54 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_108MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi ps,<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/ethics-of-human-cloning-decided-6000.html</span><br />\n<br />\n6000 years ago, Lord Krishna\u2019s unmentioned task on planet earth was to decimate all 100 Kaurava test tube babies.<br />\n<br />\nStem cell therapy is mentioned in 6200 year old Ayurveda texts \u201c Sthayeendhatus (stem cells ) from bone marrow and umblical cord are those which have power to give rise to the entire human body.<br />\n<br />\nThe dhatus form the basic matter of the body \u2013 tissues. These are of two categories \u2013Sthayee &amp; Asthayee and generic types of these dhatus are of seven types.<br />\n<br />\nThe presence of Sthayeedhatus control the architecting of Asthayeedhatus throughout the life from the available nutrients in the human systems with the help of Agni, the transporting mechanisms.<br />\n<br />\nIf due to deficiency of any nutrition or in any chronic disease condition any kinds of dhatu get depleted then with the help of Rasayanatherapy (stem cell extract of cytokines and growth factors) the process of formation of that particular dhatu/ dhatus is stimulated.<br />\nAdult human bodies contain relatively few stem cells, mostly concentrated in the bone marrow. The cloning procedure works by combining a patient's body cell with an unfertilized egg cell from a donor.<br />\n<br />\nThe patient's skin cell is inserted into the outer membrane of the egg cell and chemically induced to begin developing into a blastocyst.<br />\n<br />\nIn the blastocyst, embryonic cells divide, producing a mass of stem cells.<br />\n<br />\nThe stem cells can be induced to differentiate into different types of cells as needed (heart, nerve, muscle, etc.). These cells are genetically identical to the patient's own cells (that is, they are cloned).<br />\n<br />\nIn the future, the cloned cells could be transplanted into the patient to replace damaged cells.<br />\nToday stem cells are used in hip replacement therapy.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/avascular-necrosis-and-stem-cell.html</span><br />\n<br />\nMODERN MEDICINE HAS LIFTED WHOLESALE FROM ANCIENT AYURVEDA. MOST MEDICAL DISCOVERIES ARE MERE INNOVATIONS .<br />\n<br />\nI saw a BBC programme where some white people were discussing ancient knowledge. In between one woman asked why all Greek knowledge dried up after Pythagoras, Plato and party . &nbsp; &nbsp; Another fat woman interjected with a laugh <span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>\u201dTHEY FOUND IT IN WATER \u201c</b></span><br />\n<br />\nTHE TRUTH IS EVERY ANCIENT GREEK KNOWLEDGE WAS STOLEN FROM INDIA AND PATENTED IN OWN NAME. PLATO AND PYTHGORAS STUDIES IN KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY , THE OLDEST ON THE PLANET.<br />\n<br />\nWE SOLD TRANSLATED INTO ARABIC KNOWLEDGE TO ARABS .<br />\n<br />\nTILL THE WHITE MAN INVADED INDIA, HE HAS ZERO INVENTIONS AND DISCOVERIES TO HIS NAME. ALL OF A SUDDEN THEY GOT SPONTANEOUS KNOWLEDGE .<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_109b+seedILnfD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_109b+seedILnfD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-8tIAIhIhEVA/V5BTkS6t0jI/AAAAAAABLGk/SX2JyhspJ-AO58ixeW4lxibYYwOvGZLlACLcB/s1600/downlFFoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-8tIAIhIhEVA/V5BTkS6t0jI/AAAAAAABLGk/SX2JyhspJ-AO58ixeW4lxibYYwOvGZLlACLcB/s400/downlFFoad.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_42B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8881224265995739516\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_42M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; text-decoration: none;\">July 21, 2016 at 9:43 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_42MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nHappy guru pournima sir...you are too modest sir...not just you definitely maa'm is also something :) (I feel so)......God directed us to your blog :)...which retired ship captain writes the sort of things that you write sir...your posts show the brilliance of something un perceivable (some divine handiwork)</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_42MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1161391448\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_42BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_42B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_43B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; border-bottom-width: 0px; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3026895839357738733\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_43M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_18.html?showComment=1469075945014#c3026895839357738733\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 21, 2016 at 10:09 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_43MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi sv,<br />\n<br />\nTHERE IS NOTHING DIVINE IN ME-- NOR AM I A GURU.<br />\n<br />\nSPIRITUALITY HAD FEW TAKERS -BECAUSE OF THE EFFECT OF THE NEW WORLD ORDER.<br />\n<br />\nNOT ANY MORE!<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS WHY I STARTED THIS BLOGSITE.<br />\n<br />\nI WAS AN ATHEIST MYSELF TILL I HAD A UNIQUE EXPERIENCE AT SEA.<br />\n<br />\nTHAT FORCED ME TO LEARN QUANTUM PHYSICS. &nbsp;AND SUDDENLY I NOTICED THAT OUR VEDAS ARE THE VERY FOUNDATION OF MODERN QUANTUM PHYSICS.<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/super-typhoon-bart-perfect-storm-capt.html</span><br />\nPEOPLE JUDGE VEDAS BY TRYING TO FIGURE OUT PART ONE ( SAMHITA ) OUT OF FOUR-- .<br />\n<br />\nPART ONE IS SANSKRIT MANTRAS AND VERSES -- PICKED OFF BY SEERS FROM AKASHA.<br />\n<br />\nTHEY CONTAIN SONIC MAGIC POWER . &nbsp; &nbsp;THE WORDS ARE JUST TO PUT YOU INTO IN A GRATEFUL STATE. &nbsp; &nbsp;THE PROSE SRUTI SECTIONS ARE PARTS 2, 3 AND 4 ( BRAHMANAS, ARANYAKAS , UPANISHADS ) WHICH WOWED THE PLANET.<br />\n<br />\nI ASK MY READERS WHOSE PARENTS ARE ON THE DEATH BED -- WHISPER INTO THEIR EARS \" I AM GRATEFUL TO YOU\"-- .<br />\n<br />\nHUMPED COW FILLED US WITH GRATITUDE .<br />\n<br />\nIT GAVE US MILK . IT TILLED OUR LAND. ITS URINE HAD NANO GOLD WHICH COULD BREACH THE BLOOD BRAIN BARRIER AND CURE DEADLY DISEASES .<br />\n<br />\nNEXT TIME YOU SEE A HUMPED COW-- HUG IT-- GENTEY PASS YOUR PALMS OVER ITS HUMP AND RUB IT IN A ROTARY MANNER --MAKE A WISH WITH \"INTENT\"<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/vedic-quantum-intention-experiment.html</span><br />\n<br />\nARE HINDUS IDIOTS TO BUST COCONUTS IN TEMPLES ?<br />\n<br />\nOK , IN KERALA WE HAD PLENTY OF IT. WHAT ABOUT NORTH INDIA WHERE THEY HAD NONE ?<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sadhana means practice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In Sadhana Pada, he also elucidates the\nconcept of Kriya Yoga. Kriya meaning action and Kriya Yoga, the yoga of action,\nhas three tiers, namely tapas, svadhyaya and Isvarapranidhana. Tapas means\nburning desire, Savadhyaya means self study and Isvarapranidhana that means\nsurrender to God. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Sadhana Pada,\nPatanjali also explains the causes of sufferings and the process to minimize\nit. He then explains the eightfold path of Yoga to achieve freedom for common\nman. This eight fold path is known as Astanga Yoga and it is suitable for all.\nThe eight steps of Astanga Yoga are yama, niyama, asana, pranayama, pratyahara,\ndharna, dhyana and samadhi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yamas are social moral\nconduct; Niyamas are to be followed strictly for self-development; Asana is a\nrelaxed, steady and peaceful posture to make the physical body strong and ready\nfor inward journey; Pranayama is the controlling of bio-energy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first four steps\nare external supports and are called Bahiranga and last three are internal aid\ncalled Antaranga. Pratyahara is the association between external and internal.\nIt consists of controlling of five sense organs. In the Sadhana Pada chapter,\nPatanjali explains the journey from yama to pratyahara.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yama means restraint or\nself-control. There are five yamas: ahimsa (non-violence or non-injury), satya\n(truthfulness), asteya (non-stealing), brahmacarya (continence) and aparigraha\n(freedom from avarice or non-covetousness). They are to be practiced\nindividually and collectively irrespective of lineage, place, time, condition\nor career.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The yamas are mighty universal vows. Niyama\nmeans practice or observance. The five niyamas are to be followed not merely as\nindividual, but also as spiritual, disciplines. They are santosa (contentment),\nsauca (clealiness or purity), tapas (religious fervour), svadhyaya (study of\nthe sacred scriptures and of one's own self) and Isvara pranidhana (surrender\nof the self to God). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 55 shlokas in\nthe Sadhana pada where Patanjali explains how a Sadhak can begin his sadhana.<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/08/ashtanga-vinyasa-yoga-vagus-nerve.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/08/ashtanga-vinyasa-yoga-vagus-nerve.html</a><span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div>\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.01--- &nbsp;tapahsvadhyayeshvarapranidhanani kriyayogah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The practice of yoga is\nthe 'yoga of action', kriyayoga', comprising tapas, self-discipline, svadhyaya,\nself-study and Isvara pranidhana, surrender to God.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tapas is the blinding\ndesire to burn away the impurities of body, senses and mind. Svadhyaya is the\nreiteration of sacred mantras and the study of spiritual sacred texts, in order\nto comprehend one's own self. Isvara prani-dhana is surrendering of one's body,\nmind and soul to God through love for Him. The disciplines of cleansing man's\nthree constituents - body, speech and mind constitute kriyayoga - the path to\nperfection. Human bodies are purified by self-discipline (tapas), words by\nSelf-study (svadhyaya) and minds by love and surrendering to Him (Isvara\npranidhana). This sutra symbolises the three great paths - karma, jnana and\nbhaka. The path of action (karma-marga) is the discipline (tapas) of body,\nsenses and mind. The path of knowledge (jnana-marga) is the study of the self\n(svadhyaya) from the skin to the core and back again. The path of love of God\n(bhakti-marga) is surrendering (pranidhana) of everything to God. Sadhana pada\ndistinguishes the source of all these paths. The first symbolises life, the\nsecond wisdom. The third, through the surrender of ego, brings the humbleness\nthat leads to the effulgent, sorrowless light of Isvara, God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.02-- samadhibhavanarthah\nkleshatanookaranarthashch</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">This discipline is\npractised for the purpose of acquiring fixity of mind on the Lord, free from\nall impurities and agitations, or on One's Own Reality, and for attenuating the\nafflictions.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of us make our\nminds like spoiled children, allowing them to do whatever they want. Therefore\nit is necessary that there should be constant practice of the previous mortifications,\nin order to gain control of the mind, and bring it into subjection. The\nobstructions to Yoga arise from lack of this control, and cause us pain. They\ncan only be removed by denying the mind, and holding it in check, through these\nvarious means. Deep peace is the side effects of this experience of \u201cno-thing\u201d\nor \u201cno-thought.\u201d&nbsp; It is the realization\nthat you are more than your thoughts.&nbsp;\nSomething is there beyond your mind.&nbsp;\nNegative thoughts&nbsp; create negative\nfeelings and hence stress and illness.&nbsp;\nOur inner voice evaluates, judges, compares and worries.&nbsp;&nbsp; Most people live with such a tormentor in\ntheir head draining them of energy. It is an awful burden not to be able to\nstop thinking.&nbsp; Up to 90 % of most\npeople\u2019s thoughts are meaningless playbacks of old broken \u201crecords\u201d. Silencing\nthe body is easy, but silencing the mind is difficult in this modern age.&nbsp; Silencing is about grace, harmony and\ntranquility. Exhaustion or being drugged out of your mind is NOT tranquility. In\nthe modern age people get stressed, and they need to still the mind--the\nchattering monkey, which remains entangled in the past and the imagined future,\nbut never in the present.&nbsp; A person stops\nthinking either when he is dead or when he has realised.&nbsp; When your ego powered mind is chattering like\na monkey or the angry sea, you miss the truth.&nbsp;\nTruth can be communicated only in silence. For this deep silence you\nneed to have harmony between the mind, body and spirit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.03-- avidyasmitaragadveshabhiniveshah\nkleshaah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The five afflictions\nwhich disturb the equilibrium of consciousness are - ignorance or lack of\nwisdom, ego, pride of the ego or the sense of 'I', attach ment to pleasure,\naversion to pain, fear of death and clinging to life.</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ignorance is the field or\nsource for the four Klesas, viz., Asmita, Raga, Dvesha and Abhinivesa. All\nthese five disorders ruffle the mind like physical malady. Therefore they are\ngreat impediments to meditation. They raise Vrittis and bring about\nfructification of Karmas by coming to depend upon one another for mutual\nsupport. If you eradicate Abhinivesa, Raga and Dvesha currents will die. If you\nremove egoism, these two currents, like and dislike will vanish. The root for\negoism, Raga, Dvesha and Abhinivesa is ignorance. If ignorance is destroyed by\ngetting knowledge of Purusha through Samadhi, the other four Klesas will die by\nthemselves. The Karmas are supported by afflictions and the afflictions are\nsupported by Karmas. This is mutual support. This is a Chakrika or cycle like\nthe analogy of the seed and the tree (Bija-Vriksha Nyaya). These Klesas develop\nthe Mahat Tattva, egoism and Tanmatras. These are the five ties that bind a man\nto the wheel of birth and death \u2013 the impediment to moksha. The most important\nknot is ignorance (Hridaya Granthi). This is the fundamental cause. The other\nfour Klesas are the effects of ignorance. Pain and sin are ignorance only.\nThese manifest in those who have forgotten the true all-blissful and eternally\npure nature of Purusha. Afflictions are of three levels - intellectual,\nemotional and intuitive. Avidya and asmita belong to the arena of intelligence;\nhere lack of spiritual knowledge combined with pride or arrogance billows the\nego, inducing arrogance and the loss of one's sense of balance. Raga and dvesa\nbelong to emotions and feelings. Raga is desire and attachment, dvesa is hatred\nand aversion. Succumbing to exuberant desires and attachments or allowing\noneself to be carried away by expressions of hatred, creates dissonance between\nbody and mind, which may lead to psychosomatic disorders. Abhinivesa is intuitive\n- the desire to prolong one's life, and concern for one's own survival.\nCohering to life makes one apprehensive in dealings with others, and causes one\nto become selfish and self-centred. The root causes of these five afflictions\nare the behavioural functions and thoughts of the various spheres of brain.\nAvidya and asmita are connected with the conscious frontal brain, and the top\nbrain is considered the seat of the 'T' consciousness. Raga and dvesa are\nconnected with the base of the brain, the hypothalamus. Abhinivesa is connected\nwith the 'old' brain or back brain which is also known as the unconscious\nbrain, because it retains past subliminal impressions, samskaras. The sadhaka\nmust learn to locate the sources of afflictions, in order to be able to clip\nthem in the bud through his yogic principles and disciplines. Discrimination\nremains shaky as long as false knowledge has not been completely removed. Egoism\nis the root cause for Raga (attachment to pleasures ). Asmita happens when you\nidentify with the parts of yourself that change\u2014everything from your mind to\nyour body, appearance, or job title\u2014instead of with the quiet place within you\nthat does not change. &nbsp;&nbsp;Road rage has to\ndo with reptilian instincts ,the amygdala is involved. The amygdala can\nmistakenly misfire messages of danger creating a chronic state of anxiety and\npanic. The amygdalae react to negative events in many ways, including\nactivation of your sympathetic nervous system. The results cause you gut\nwrenching turmoil. Because the amygdala helped the ancient cave man survive, it\nremained as the brain grew and evolved. Today, it\u2019s rare that we face an\nextreme emergency that requires the amygdale to spring into action, but it does\nso nevertheless.&nbsp; It is the classic\n\u201cfight or flight response.\u201d A feeling of revenge and retribution , \u201cto teach a\nlesson\u201d&nbsp; to a guy who has \u201ccut you off \u201c\nis always involved in road rage .&nbsp; Some\ndelusional ones even feel that they have been chosen to \u201cbell this bad cat\u201d. Road-rage\nincidents stem from the stimulation of the reptilian mind -- a driver\nexperiencing road rage feels threatened and responds aggressively to ensure his\n\u201csurvival\u201d.&nbsp;&nbsp; The reptilian brain is\ninflexible, compulsive, ritualistic and incapable of learning from previous\nscrew-ups. Territoriality - like many animals, human beings react negatively\nwhen we feel our space is threatened by someone else. A mature man does not\nengage in self-destructive behavior. Maturity is the ability to bear an\ninjustice without wanting to get evenand act within the framework of\ndignity.&nbsp;&nbsp; When you are consumed by rage\nyou hyperventilate , there is an increase in your heart rate, BP and a rush of\nadrenaline, cortisol and other stress-induced hormones. Breathing deeply from\nyour diaphragm is essential to calming and relaxing you. There is nothing\nmystical about the power that breathing has to prevent panic. As you control\nthe rate of your breathing, it sends a subconscious message to the amygdala\nthat there is no need to be stressed.&nbsp;\nJust breathe deep and slow until you feel any butterflies start to\nsettle down. Yoga has NOTHING to do with hyperventilation ( &nbsp;patented &nbsp;SO HUM&nbsp;\n) taught by Sri Sri Ravishankar. There are many low IQ drivers on the\nroad\u2014remember this.&nbsp; He is NOT busting\nyour balls.&nbsp; He is just trying to reach\nhis destinations using his limited cerebral faculty. You do NOT get angry with\nstationary trees which have&nbsp; popped up on\nyour path, right? Rage is a complete blackout of the thoughts.&nbsp; Rage only sees its own\n\"rightness\".&nbsp; Rage does not\ncare if it hurts others, in fact it aches to hurt somebody.&nbsp; Rage feels justified in hurting others. Rage\ndetracts from the quality of your life, driving away the people who love you\nand can help you. According to yoga philosophy, this unchanging part of you is\nknown as the \u201cseer\u201d\u2014the cit, drasta (drg), or purusa\u2014that which experiences or\n\u201csees\u201d the world through the lens of the mind. As Patanjali explains in the\nYoga Sutra, the mind\u2014which includes your thoughts, emotions, and even the\nsensory input you receive from your body\u2014is the instrument of perception\nthrough which the seer engages with the world around you. Asmita, or false\nidentification, is common to everyone because our external qualities inevitably\ninfluence how we see ourselves. The nature of the Soul is eternal bliss. What\ncan make it sorrowful except ignorance, hallucination, delusion;&nbsp; all this pain of the soul is simply delusion. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">For destroying the\nfollowing evil Vrittis, raise the opposite good Vrittis given against each: - Lust\n(Kama).. Brahmacharya, Mumukshutva.---Anger (Krodha)...Love, Kshama\n(forgiveness), Daya (Mercy), Maitri (friendship), Santi, Dhriti (patience),\nAhimsa.---Pride (Mada)... Humility (Namrata or Vinaya).---Greed\n(Lobha)...Honesty, disinterestedness, generosity, Santosha (contentment),\nAparigraha (non-covetousness).---Jealousy (Irshya)...Nobility (Udarata),\nmagnanimity, Mudita (complacency).---Delusion (Moha)...Viveka (discrimination).---Vanity,\nHypocrisy (Dambha)...Simplicity.---Darpa (arrogance)... Politeness, Hri\n(Modesty).---Cunningness... Arjava (crookedness) (straightforwardness).---Harshness...\nMildness.---Attachment (Raga)...Vairagya.---Insincerity (Asraddha)...Sraddha\n(faith).---Chanchalatvam (Fickleness)... Determination (Nischaya Vritti).</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.04- - avidya kshetram\nuttareshan prasuptatanuvichchhinnodaranam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Lack of true knowledge\nis the source of all pains and sorrows - whether dormant, attenuated,\ninterrupted or fully active.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali explains\navidya as the fostering-ground of all affliction, whatever its nature. To fully\ndismantle avidya is the deep goal of yoga, and it demands a radical shift of\nconsciousness. In the Bhagavad Gita it is noted that all sufferings and\nlimitations imposed by the ego come from avidya; consequently man has to seek\nknowledge, with which hatred, injury and greed are incompatible. Avidya is not\nlack of information, &nbsp;but a \"more\ndeep seated misperception of reality\". Avidya means more than ignorance\u2014it\nis lack of wisdom The term includes not only ignorance out of darkness, but\nalso obscuration, misconceptions, mistaking illusion to be reality or\nimpermanent to be permanent or suffering to be bliss or non-self to be self\n(delusions). &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Avidya includes confusing\nthe mundane reality to be the only reality, and it as a permanent though it is\never changing. &nbsp;&nbsp;Avidya is a deep habit\nof consciousness, but it\u2019s a habit that we can shift\u2014with intention, practice,\nand a lot of help from the universe. &nbsp;Avidya\n- spiritual ignorance, is the source of all the other obstacles - arrogance,\ndesire , aversion etc.. These afflictions, whether dormant, weakened or\nalternating between hidden and fully active, are obstacles to\nself-enlightenment. Ignorance causes Vipareetha Bhavana (perverted understanding),\nand the man is rendered blind by passion and various sorts of Raga. He is under\nintoxication. Ignorance clouds understanding. An ignorant man is a dead man\nwhile living. &nbsp;&nbsp;He is a living buried\nsoul, despite his wealth, possession and university knowledge. To take a thing\nfor what is not, is ignorance. It is not a privation of knowledge. It is a\nBhava Vastu. It does not mean absence of knowledge. You mistake this perishable\nbody of five elements and various impurities as the pure Self. You think that\nyou are the body only and you have forgotten the real nature of Purusha. This\nis delusion. The effect of avidya is to suppress the real nature of things and\npresent something else in its place. In effect it is not different from Maya &nbsp;or illusion. Avidya relates to the individual\nSelf (atman), while Maya is an adjunct of the cosmic Self (Brahman). &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adi Shankaracharya says in his Introduction\nto his commentary on the Brahma Sutras, \"Owing to an absence of\ndiscrimination, there continues a natural human behaviour in the form of 'I am\nthis' or 'This is mine'; this is avidya. It is a superimposition of the\nattributes of one thing on another. The ascertainment of the nature of the real\nentity by separating the superimposed thing from it is vidya (knowledge,\nillumination)\". In Shankara's philosophy avidya cannot be categorized\neither as 'absolutely existent' or as 'absolutely non-existent'. Avidya is a\nfundamental blindness about reality. The core ignorance we call avidya isn\u2019t a\nlack of information, but the inability to experience your deep connection to\nothers, to the source of being, and to your true Self. Avidya in action is in\nthe habit of thinking that you need someone\u2019s approval to feel good about\nyourself. &nbsp;&nbsp;Patanjali\u2019s sutra on avidya\nis not just a description of the problem of ignorance. It\u2019s also the key to the\nsolution. When you pull back and question the things you think are eternal and\npermanent, you begin to recognize the wondrous flux that is your life. When you\nask, \u201cWhat\u2019s the real source of happiness?\u201d you extend your focus beyond the\nexternal trigger to the feeling of happiness itself. And when you seek to know\nthe difference between the false self and the true one, that\u2019s when the veil\nmight come off altogether and show you that you\u2019re not just who you take\nyourself to be, but something much brighter, much vaster, and much more free. Avidya\nis to mistake the impermanent for the eternal, the impure for the pure, sorrow\nfor happiness, and the not-Self for the true Self. Just as the mirror is\nrendered dim by a layer of dirt attaching to it, so also Knowledge is veiled by\nAvidya. Dismantling avidya is a multilayered process, which is why one\nbreakthrough is usually not enough. Since different types of practice unpick\ndifferent aspects of avidya, there are different types of yoga for each\none\u2014devotional practice for the ignorance of the heart, selfless action for the\ntendency to attach to outcomes, meditation for a wandering mind. The good news\nis that any level you choose to work with is going to make a difference. On a\nday-to-day, moment-to-moment level, you burn off a few layers of avidya every\ntime you turn your awareness inward and reflect on the subtle meaning of a\nfeeling or a physical reaction. Avidya, in all its subtle forms, works within\nus constantly to root us in our habitual ways and make improvement difficult or\nimpossible. The more we indulge Avidya, the stronger it becomes. Eventually, we\nfeel that we are no longer the doer of these things; they simply happen to us. For\nmost of us, Avidya will remain to some extent throughout our lives. However,\nthe more we can live from the true spirit within, the Purusa, the more\nauthentically we live our lives. We relate to others better, make better\ndecisions, and the hold of ignorance upon our lives gradually diminishes. We\nbecome the best person we can possibly be and thereby benefit the world.&nbsp; Avidya &nbsp;is the antithesis of Vidya, or true knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.05\u2014 anityashuchiduhkhanatmasu&nbsp; nityashuchisukhatmakhyatiravidya</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></span><i style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Ignorance is taking the\nnon-eternal for the eternal, the impure for the pure, evil for good and\nnon-self as self.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vidya is not mere\nintellectual knowledge, for the Vedas demand understanding. Its root is Vid which\nmeans - to reason upon, knower, finding, knowing, acquiring or understanding. In\nHindu philosophy, Vidya refers to the knowledge of the soul or spiritual\nknowledge. It is NOT mundane \u201cCapital of Iran is Teheran \u201c \u2013type knowledge . It\nis but ordinary that one will make mistakes. But when, through want of\nunderstanding, one fails to reappraise or reflect, error turns a habit. As the\nprocesses of thought and action have existed from the beginning of civilization,\nso has trial and error been used in the quest for knowledge. But when all\ndoubts have been settled in the pursuit of sadhana, the discriminative power of\nintelligence comes to an end and pure wisdom alone resides, where perception\nand action are concurrent. Experimental and experiential knowledge correspond.\nObjective knowledge and subjective knowledge become one. This is pure vidya-\nthe highest knowledge. All these various sorts of impression have one source: ignorance.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;We have first to learn what ignorance\nis. All of us think that \u201cI am the body,\u201d and not the Self, the pure, the effulgent,\nthe ever blissful, and that is ignorance. We think ofman, and see man as body.\nThis is the great delusion. The word, Vidya, in the Brahmana portions of the\nYajurveda and in the Upanishads. In Hinduism, , leaving aside Vishnu avatars ,\ngods &nbsp;are cosmic forces , personifications\nof the deepest level of power and energy. The concept of Shakti, in its most\nabstract terms, relates to the energetic principle of Ultimate Reality, the\ndynamic aspect of the divine. This concept surfaces in the Kena Upanishad as\nGoddess Um\u0101 bestowing Brahma-vidya on Indra; when linked with shakti and maya,\nshe embodies the power of illusion (maya), encompassing ignorance (avidya) and\nknowledge (vidy\u0101) and thereby presented with a dual personality. The Upanishads\nteach us that the knowledge of difference is avidy\u0101 or ignorance, and the\nknowledge of identity is true knowledge or vidy\u0101 or valid knowledge, which\nleads to life eternal. Sankara accepted perception, inference, scriptural\ntestimony, comparison, presumption and non-apprehension as the six sources of\nknowledge and concluded that the knowledge which corresponds with the real\nnature of its object is valid. The Atman is the reality in the empirical self\nas the ever present foundational subject-objectless universal consciousness\nwhich sustains the empirical self. All forms of contemplation have only one\naim: to lead to the Supreme Knowledge and hence they are termed as vidyas;\nthrough vidya, which is amrta, one attains immortality (Shvetashvatara\nUpanishad Verse V.1). In ancient India , we had gurukuls where students stayed\nwith the Guru ( mentor ) .&nbsp; The students\nwere clay,&nbsp; to be moulded by the Guru. The\nancient Indian Guru as a mentor retains a magic control over the pupil even after\nhe walks out of the ashram after his studies.&nbsp;\nThe usual modern teacher&nbsp; treats\nthe mind as a vessel to be filled up, while the Guru ignited the mind in\npeaceful environments , next to a water body or a waterfall supercharges with\nnegative ions . If the environment is not OK , the dialogue between minds\ncannot happen.&nbsp; &nbsp;The Guru does NOT bid the shishya to enter the\nglorious house of his own wisdom&nbsp; --\nrather he leads him gently into the threshold of his own mind.&nbsp; The Guru is a prober and never an interrogator.\nHe does NOT play the power game .&nbsp; Nididhyasana\nhappens in a gurukul-- &nbsp;the practice of\natma-vichara, self-enquiry, self-investigation, self-scrutiny or\nself-attentiveness.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.06\u2014 drigdarshanashaktyorekatmatevasmita</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Egoism is the\nidentification of the seer with the instrumental power of seeing.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the five Kleshas\nor hindrances in Yogic philosophy is Asmita, or egoism. The word Klesha is\nderived from the sanskrit root Klish which means \u201cto suffer, torment or\ndistress- to cause trouble\u201d. The Kleshas are the Hindrances. They are the five\nfactors that lead us into suffering. (Avidya-Non-seeing, &nbsp;Asmita-Egoism, &nbsp;Raga- Attachment, &nbsp;Dvesha- Aversion, Abhinivesa- Fear of Death).&nbsp; Asmita is the \u201cI\u201d maker. &nbsp;We need our ego to organize our mind and\nnavigate through life, but to over identify with and cling to these labels\nultimately brings suffering.&nbsp;&nbsp; Even\nthough we may know intellectually that our sense organs are simply acting as\ninstruments for the \u2018self\u2019 , we still say \u2018I see\u2019 or \u2018I hear\u2019 etc giving the\nfalse indication that seeing and hearing are done by the self. Asmita differs\nfrom our traditional conception of egoism in a few important ways.&nbsp; When we think of ego, we generally think of\nconceit or holding a high opinion of oneself, but this is only a small part in\nthe Yogic view.&nbsp;&nbsp; Patanjali defines\negoism as mistaking the transient aspects of ourselves \u2013 the physical,\nemotional, and mental \u2013 for the true self, which according to the Yogis is the\nunchanging, ever-peaceful observer behind those characteristics. Distinguishing\nthe instruments of cognition - the senses of perception, intelligence and ego\nor the sense of the individual self - with the pure seer is egoism, or the conception\nof individuality. When we start to think of ourselves in terms of the\nincomplete view provided by limited aspects of our being, we begin a process of\nalienation from both ourselves and the world.&nbsp;\nThis alienation becomes more striking when we realize those partial\nelements are also transient. Though the body and the eternal Self are\ndissimilar entities, lack of knowledge makes one believe that they are one.\nTaking pride in the body as the Self is also avidya. Though there is a\ndissimilarity between the seer (atma) and the seen, during the act of\nperceiving the seen (the mind itself) looks as if the pure seer. This\nappearance of merging or 'oneness' is because of asmita. One must be aware of\nthe difference between the seer (atma) and the instrument that sees (buddhi).\nIf they coalesce and work together, that experience is reality. But if the mind\nand senses - the seer's agents, take it upon themselves to identify with the\ntrue seer, as though the seer were manifest or apparent, then polarities are\ncreated and seer and seen become separated or split. Asmita is the\nidentification of consciousness with the vehicle through which the power of\ncognition is being expressed. Asmita literally means I-am-ness or awareness of\nSelf-existence. When, however, it identifies with one of its vehicles, it is no\nmore pure and is bound by the limitations of Avidya. The identification of\nconsciousness with matter proceeds progressively from subtle to grosser\nelements. In that process, the veil of avidya gets thicker. &nbsp;Thoughts, opinions, prejudices etc are much\nharder to deal with from the point of view of \u2018asmita\u2019. Ego is to consider the\nnature of the seer and the nature of the instrumental power of seeing to be the\nsame thing. Asmita, is the misidentification of buddhi, the instrumental power\nof \u2018darshana\u2019, with the soul (purusha). Asmita, in this sense, is also known as\n\u2018ego\u2019 that is responsible for imagining the body and mind, which are mere\ninstruments, to be the self. &nbsp;Ego is at\nthe root of all suffering. &nbsp;&nbsp;Ego drags us\ninto the past or the future as it doesn\u2019t feel comfortable in the present\nmoment. We can only feel peaceful and stress-free when we are in the present\nmoment. The moment we step into the past or the future and try to dwell there,\nstress and unhappiness creeps in.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">2.07\u2014 sukhanushayi\nraagah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Attachment is that\nmagnetic pattern which clusters in pleasure and pulls one towards such\nexperience.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Raga is attachment /affinity\nfor something, implying a desire for that.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;This can be emotional\n(instinctual) or intellectual. It may range from simple liking or preference to\nintense desire and attraction.&nbsp; Raga is\nthe attraction towards any person or object. Affinity for booze or drugs is a\nraga. Attraction in this manner happens because the soul in bondage, having\nlost its inner source of bliss (ananda), gropes for happiness in the external\nworld. &nbsp;&nbsp;Any object that provides such an\nexperience becomes dear to it. Raga is &nbsp;that modification which follows remembrance of\npleasure.&nbsp; An experience of pleasure\nresults in a latent impression which subsequently can lead to desire or craving\nfor the same experience. In attachment, desire and senses are drawn\ninvoluntarily towards objects. When desire deepens into greed, the sense of\nright and wrong becomes neglected. By this the self gets linked up with the\nsenses. The detached self, in this case, appears to be bound with the latent\nimpressions of pleasure.&nbsp; Raga is craving\nfor pleasure by one who remembers past experience of pleasure. Ego is the root\nof attachment just as ignorance is the root of ego. Ignorance and ego cause the\ndeluded mind to associate the self with the latent impressions of past\nexperience of pleasure. Residing on pleasurable experiences inflames desire and\na sense of attraction, which induces attachment.
