It magnifies man and\ngives him a destiny to fulfill.<o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.37- - vitaragavishayan\nva chittam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Or the mind taking as\nan object of concentration those sages who are freed of compulsion.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the sadhaka ponders\non the serene, pure state of such divine souls and follows their practices, he\nearns confidence, achieves firmness and develops a desireless state of mind. Similarly,\none can also contemplate each stage of an asana or each movement of breath in\norder to bring the citta to a state of desirelessness. If consciousness is kept\nfree from desire, it becomes chaste. Mere withdrawal from the world does not in\nitself achieve this aim. The body of the \u201crealized man\u201d or Jivan Mukt&nbsp; like Adi Shankaracharya continues to exist\nuntil his karmas and prarabdhas ( greater responsibility ) has worked itself\nout,&nbsp; and then his mortal coil falls away\non his own free will , and he attains Moksha.&nbsp;\nA Jivanmukt saint who has burnt his&nbsp;\nEGO is NOT cremated in Hinduism. He is buried in a sitting meditative\npose. You cannot be deemed a Jivanmukta unless you have the noble qualities for\nit. Such people have sterling virtues like conscience, lack of ego,&nbsp; gratitude , lack of desires- selfishness-\ngreed- jealousy- anger- and fear, unlimited compassion,&nbsp; respect for universal laws,&nbsp; raised consciousness and humility. He who is\nthe same in honour and disgrace and the same to friends and foes, who has given\nup all undertakings, he is said to having gone beyond all modes. (Bhagavat Gita\n14, 22-25.). A Jivanmukta has reached the imperishable Turiya state.&nbsp; It means&nbsp;\n\u201cconsciousness minus thinking\u201d . It represents supreme consciousness\nfree from material influence . . In Turiya there is the absolute awareness. It\nis the experience of ultimate reality and truth.&nbsp; In Turiya, the self does not think, feel, or\ndo, but rather observes thought, emotion, and action capable of truly\nunderstanding the totality of the universe. Turiya has no limits and no\nendpoint. It is infinitely transcendent, which means its potential is forever\nexpanding.&nbsp; You are now a unique\nindividual and you are a vital part of a larger universal life force that transcends\neverything on earth.. Reality and truth become more clearly defined, allowing\nyou to perceive that which lies above, below, and beyond the human experience. This\nutterly quiet, peaceful and blissful state is the ultimate aim of all spiritual\nactivity this highest state is not affected by Maya The Waker, The Dreamer, The\nDeep Sleeper and The Observer. You experience detachment and joy .&nbsp; Turiya Consciousness&nbsp; is the ultimate goal of spirituality for here\nyou know what freedom is all about. Turiya is regarded as synonymous with\nvidehamukti, liberation without a body A saint is a very ordinary guy.. A sage\nis the extraordinary being. A sage does not dream, because he has no polarity.\nHe\u2019s just a witness. In Hindusim your physical body is just like clothes or a\nsnake skin.&nbsp; On death you just change\nyour body to another one.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Jivanmukta is a sage\nwho is liberated from bondage even while living with a body.&nbsp; . He has delight in the Self, he sports in\nthe Self, he has company with the Self, he has bliss in the Self.&nbsp; He is autonomous. He has unlimited freedom. The\nJivanmukta does not feel the necessity for abiding by what brings pleasure to\nthe physical body. The palm of the hand is his bowl, the earth is his bed, the\nsky is his clothing.&nbsp; He has reached the\nclimax of perfection and the whole universe is a part of his body. The forces\nof the universe are his friends, not his enemies . The sage does not care for\npublic criticism. He keeps a cool mind even when he is abused or assaulted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.38- - svapnanidrajnanalambanan\nva</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Or depending on the\nknowledge of dreams and sleep.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Four stages of\nconsciousness : consciousness plus thinking is waking,&nbsp; consciousness minus thinking is turiya,\nunconsciousness plus thinking is dreaming,&nbsp;\nunconsciousness minus thinking is sleep.&nbsp;\nThe semi-circle of OM symbolizes Maya and separates the dot from the\nother three curves. It is the illusion of Maya that prevents us from the\nrealization of this highest state of bliss. The semi-circle is open at the top\nand does not touch the dot. This means that this highest state is not affected\nby Maya. Maya only affects the manifested phenomenon.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nTuriya thoughts subside and one becomes increasingly more awake; the mind\nsettles down and consciousness itself becomes primary.&nbsp; Mediators describe this as pure consciousness\nor unbounded awareness. One sees the entire world and all things within it as\npart of oneself, and oneself part of all. Turiya&nbsp; is a state of transcendence, the result of\narduous meditation.&nbsp; There can be no\nconsciousness without passage through intense pain. The Upanishads equates this\nexperience with enlightenment.&nbsp; We\nordinary people lack contact with our fourth state of consciousness, and so we\nfail to live up to our potential as human beings. This utterly quiet, peaceful\nand blissful state is the ultimate aim of all spiritual activity this highest\nstate is not affected by Maya The Waker, The Dreamer, The Deep Sleeper and The\nObserver.&nbsp; Turiya is freedom from the\nlimitation of the other states . You experience detachment and joy .&nbsp; Turiya Consciousness&nbsp; is the ultimate goal of spirituality for here\nyou know what freedom is all about.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.39- - yathabhimatadhyanad\nva</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Or, by meditating on\nany desired object conducive to steadiness of consciousness.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The purpose of\nmeditation in modern times is to destress, to stop the destructive mind\nchatter, for some time in a day,--&nbsp; to\nSTILL the mind.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">he brain must not be allowed to pump in\ndestructive F&amp;F ( fight &amp; flight ) chemicals into your body, which will\nshorten your life. The reason why people remain mired in negativity is because\nof the beliefs they have inherited over time. Beliefs are subconscious . We can\nuse our conscious mind to observe ,to introspect and dip into the subconscious\nwhere our beliefs are embedded , in order to eliminate it. You can meditate, to\nrewrite these negative programmes that cause you misery. During meditation\nthinking is separated from perceiving, so that the individual can stand apart\nfrom the emotional self.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indians use meditation to purify the\nmind and gain insight.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is self observation and\nintrospection ( which animals cannot do ). This does not mean any wicked\nsubject, but anything good that you like, any place that you like best, any\nscenery that you like best, any idea that you like best, anything that will concentrate\nthe mind.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ultimate method is to choose an object\nbeneficial to meditation, not one which is externally pleasing, but auspicious\nand spiritually enriching. By practising this simple method of one-pointed\nattention, the sadhaka gradually develops the act of contemplation.. Patanjali\nadvises followers to trace the seed of that core, the living spirit that\ninterpenetrates everything from the most infinitesimal particle to the\ninfinitely greatest. This is the most difficult subject to meditate upon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.40- - paramanu\nparamamahattvantosya vashikarah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The mastery of one in\nUnion extends from the finest atomic particle to the greatest infinity.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The level of\nconsciousness in you depends on the amount of energy it is capable of storing.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By\nprojecting your intention and changing your brain vibration &gt; 40 Hz Gamma\nthrough altering the state of your consciousness , you can develop psychic\npowers. When you use psychic power you tap into the level of the universe,\nwhere individuality does not exist. At this level each of us is a part of a\nuniversal and cosmic consciousness where we are connected as though held\ntogether by invisible threads.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This interconnectedness means that\nevery thing we do or think affects everything and everyone else. All atoms in\nthe entire universe are capable of mind reading and communicating with other\natoms. There is a consciousness in every molecule of matter.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most\npeople never raise their consciousness much above that of the animal and the\nspark of divinity within them remains dormant the whole of their lives. Animals\nexpress consciousness through instinct. Self awareness or reflective thought is\nthe difference between animals and humans.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our consciousness is\nexpressed energetically through coherence and interactions of electromagnetic\nfields. Consciousness is a form of electromagnetic energy which with focused\nthought and intent can achieve extraordinary things.The sadhaka is not only\nliberated from all disturbances of the mind; he has also repressed his\nconsciousness and mastered his passions. His consciousness reaches a height of\ntransparency in which it develops the power of interpenetrating objects from\nthe minutest atoms to the impressive cosmos. This sutra describes how the\nordinary mind is metamorphosed into a super-mind, is able to imbue the\nlimitless regions of space, and the deepest regions within. The mind, by this\npractice, easily contemplates the most minute thing, as well as the biggest\nthing.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.41\u2014</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">ksheennavritterabhijatasyev\nmanergrahitrigrahannagrahyeshu tatsthatadangjanatasamapattih</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">When the agitations of\nthe mind are under control, the mind becomes like a transparent crystal and has\nthe power of becoming whatever form is presented- knower, act of knowing, or\nwhat is known.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whenever a yogi\nmeditates he can keep out all other thought; he becomes identified with that on\nwhich he mediates; when he meditates he is like a piece of crystal; before\nflowers the crystal becomes almost identified with flowers. If the flower is\nred, the crystal looks red, or if the&nbsp;\nflower is blue , the crystal looks blue. With refinement, the\nconsciousness becomes exceedingly sensitive, choiceless, untainted and chaste.\nThe perceiver, the instrument of perception and the Perceived object, evidently\nreflected, are nothing but the seer. Like an object reflected immaculately on a\nclean mirror, the perceiver, the perceived and the instrument are reflected as\none. This transparent reflecting quality of consciousness is termed samapatti,\nwhich means assumption of the original form of the seer. Patanjali's\ndescription of samapatti emphasises the subtle distinction between yoga,\nsamadhi and samapatti. Yoga is the utilisation of the means to attain samadhi.\nSamadhi is profound meditation and total absorption. Samapatti is the\nequilibrised state of mind of the seer who, having attained samadhi, radiates\nhis own pure state. Yoga and samadhi, in other words, can be looked upon as\npractices; samapatti stands for the state towards which they lead. When all the\nfluctuations of mind's sattvic, rajasic and tamasic nature reaches a culmination,\nmind quits to gather and convey information, and cilia is like the placid,\nclear water of a calm lake. It transforms itself to the level of the seer, and\nreflects its transparency without refraction. Like a transparent jewel, it\nbecomes at once the knower, the instrument of knowing and the object known.\nThus the sadhaka experiences the true state of the soul. Samapatti is enshrined\nin abhijatamani, which means faultless jewel. Citta is now a faultless jewel. By\nyogic discipline and contemplation, the sadhaka develops these intuitive\nqualities of transparency and honesty and realises the faultless quality of\nconsciousness. Through it, he becomes the seer and emanates rays of wisdom\nthrough his words, thoughts and actions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.42\u2014 tatra\nshabdarthajnanavikalpaih sankeerna savitarka samapattih</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">At this stage, called\nsavitarka samapatti, the word, meaning and content are blended, and become\nspecial knowledge.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sampathi is similar to Samadhi\n.&nbsp; Sam\u0101patti stands for correct (samyag)\nacquisition (\u0101patti) of Truth. It is a form of alaukika-pratyak\u1e63a (extraordinary\nperception) forming thus a legitimate part of the perceptual (pratyak\u1e63a]]\ninstruments of adequate knowledge (pram\u0101\u1e47a). In the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali,\nsamapatti is discussed as the universal form of the Yoga called\nsampraj\u00f1\u0101ta-samadhi, or savikalpa samadhi, followed by asampraj\u00f1\u0101ta-samadhi, or\nnirvikalpa samadhi. &nbsp;&nbsp;It has as its\nprerequisite the annihilation of all (non-sattvic) modifications (v\u1e5btti) of\nconsciousness (citta). Savitarka meditation relates to concentration on a gross\nobject while still accompanied with other activities of the mind. It involves\nthe co-mingling of three things: the object itself, the word or name we give to\nthe object, and knowledge related to the object. There are many different gross\nobjects on which one might meditate at the Savitarka level. In the refined\nstate of consciousness, words and their meanings are simultaneously and\ntunefully coalesced with understanding, so that consciousness becomes enwrapped\nin a new kind of knowledge. This is savitarka samapatti. &nbsp;&nbsp;When you contemplate the whole universe as if\nit is in space and time, it is the lowest samadhi \u2013 savitarka. When you are\nstruggling to obviate the interference of space and time and attack the\nuniverse as it is in itself, without any kind of association of space and time,\nthat is nirvitarka samadhi, a higher state. Sound here means vibration;\nmeaning, the nerve currents which conduct it; and knowledge, reaction. All the\nvarious meditations we have had so far, Patanjali calls Savitarka (meditations\nwith reasoning). Later on he will give us higher and higher Dhyanas. In these\nthat are called \u201cwith reasoning,\u201d we keep the duality of subject and object,\nwhich results from the mixture of word, meaning, and knowledge. There is first the\nexternal vibration, the word; this, carried inward by the sense currents, is\nthe meaning. After that there comes areactionary wave in the Chitta, which is\nknowledge, but the mixture of these three makeup what we call knowledge. In all\nthe meditations up to this we get this mixture as object of meditation. The\nnext Samadhi is higher.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.43\u2014 smritiparishuddhau\nsvaroopashoonyevarthamatranirbhasa nirvitarka</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In nirvitarka\nsamapatti, the difference between memory and intellectual illumination is disclosed;\nmemory is cleansed and consciousness shines without reflection.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirvitarka is\nconcentration on a gross object in which there are no longer any extraneous\ngross level activities in the mind because of the memory having been purified. &nbsp;Notice that with Savitarka, there was not only\nmeditation on the object, but also there were the other thought streams in the\nmind, though these were not distracting due to vairagya (non-attachment). Here,\nin Nirvitarka, these thought patterns have subsided.&nbsp; When memory is completely purged and\npurified, mind too is purified. Both discontinue to function as distinct\nentities; a no-mind state is experienced, and consciousness alone expresses\nitself, shining untarnished without reflection of external objects. &nbsp;Memory is the recapitulation of past thoughts\nand experiences. It is the storehouse of past impressions. Its knowledge is\nreflected knowledge. The sadhaka should be aware that memory has incredible\nimpact on intelligence. By tenacity in yoga practices and persistent\nself-discipline, new experiences come to light. These new experiences,\nliberated from the memories of the past, are fresh, direct and subjective; they\nwipe out what is remembered. Then memory ceases to function as a separate\nentity. It either unites with consciousness or takes a secondary position,\ngiving prevalence to new experiences and bringing precision in intelligence.\nFor an average person memory is a past mind. For the enlightened man, memory is\na present mind. As memory is purged, intelligence becomes illuminative and\nmoves closer to the seer, losing its identity.Even for the unripened mind,\nthere is a right and a wrong use of memory. It is not for recapitulating bliss,\nbut for establishing a support of experience as a source for further accurate\naction and perception. In asana, for instance, one commences with trial and\nerror. The fruits of these experiments are graded by the discriminating\nintelligence and stored in the memory. As one progresses, trial and error\ndecreases, and correct perception increases. So memory provides foresight\nagainst error. Awareness, with discrimination and memory, breaks down bad\nhabits, which are reiterated actions based on incorrect perception, and\nreplaces them with their opposite. In this process the brain must be ingenious,\nnot mechanical. The mechanical brain questions only the external occurrences,\nbringing objective knowledge. The creative brain questions the inner and outer,\nbringing subjective and spiritual knowledge. When awareness is associated with\nintelligence, honesty comes into being; when brain and body proceed in harmony,\nintegrity prevails. In all this lengthy process of tapas, memory supports the\nbuilding-up process. When memory works perfectly, it becomes one with the\nintelligence. When the sound comes, the senses vibrate, and the wave rises in\nreaction; they follow so closely upon one another that there is no discerning\none from the other; when this meditation has been practiced for a long time, memory,\nthe receptacle of all impressions, becomes purified, and wwe are able clearly\nto distinguish them from one another. This is called \u201cNirvitarka,\u201d\nconcentration without reasoning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.44\u2014 etayaiva\nsavichara nirvichara cha sookshmavishaya vyakhyata</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The contemplation of\nsubtle aspects is similarly explained as deliberate (savicara samapatti) or\nnon-deliberate (nirvicara samapatti).</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beyond both Savitarka\nand Nirvitarka is Savichara. With Savichara, the gross thoughts (Vitarkas) have\nsubsided, but there are still subtle thought patterns, which are called\nVichara. Savitarka Samapatti and Savichara Samapatti are similar processes,\nthough one is on gross thoughts, while the other relates to subtle thoughts.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirvichara\nis concentration in which there are no longer any extraneous gross or subtle\nactivities in the mind. This purity of mind comes through the processes of\nmeditation and non-attachment. In Nirvichara Samapatti, the engrossed mind\ncompletely takes on the coloring of the subtle object of meditation, much like\na pure crystal will take on the coloring of whatever color it is near. With\nincreasing mastery of Nirvichara, the eternal Self begins to shine for the\naspirant.&nbsp; Transformation of the\nconsciousness by contemplation on subtle objects like the ego (ahamkara),\nintelligence (buddhi) or the equivalent of the elements (sound, touch, sight,\ntaste and smell), or the qualities of luminosity, vibrancy and dormancy of\nnature, conditioned by space, time and causation, is savicara samapatti.\nWithout these reflections it becomes nirvicara samapatti. &nbsp;In nirvicara samapatti, the sadhaka\nexperiences a state without verbal deliberation. All the subtle objects\nreflected in savicara are eliminated. He is free from memory, free from past\nexperiences, devoid of all past impressions. This new state of contemplation is\nwithout cause and effect, place or time. The inexpressible states of pure bliss\n(ananda) and pure self (sasmita) rise to the surface and are experienced by the\nsadhaka.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.45\u2014 sookshmavishayatvan\nchalinggaparyavasanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The subtlest level of\nnature (prakrti) is consciousness. When consciousness dissolves in nature, it\nloses all marks and becomes pure.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gross objects are\nonly the elements, and everything manufactured out of them. The fine objects begin\nwith the Tanmatras or fine particles. The organs, the mind, egoism, the\nmind-stuff (the cause of all manifestion) the equilibrium state of Sattva,\nRajas and Tamas materials\u2014called Pradhana (chief), Prakrti (nature), or Avyakta\n(unmanifest), are all included within the category of fine objects. The Purusa\n(the&nbsp; Soul) alone is excepted from this\ndefinition. By exploring the understated particles of nature, the consciousness\nattains its destination. It is a state of complete termination of the\nfluctuations of the mind. That is the subtle, infinitesimal intelligence\n(mahat) of nature (prakrti). Prakrti and pradhana original or natural form of\nanything, nature; alihga, un-manifested form . . .. .Prakrti Pradhana primary\nor original matter, the first evolved source of the material world, that which\nis placed or set before, chief or principal thing (these are all liable to\nchange, while the soul (purusa) is changeless) . &nbsp;&nbsp;The subtlest of the infinitesimal principles\nof nature is the cosmic intelligence (mahat), which in an individual is\ntransformed as the 'I' in a forceful, minute form, called asmita or the small\nself. Though the Self does not change, the small self brings about changes in a\nhuman being due to the influence of nature's qualities. The body is made up of\nthe particles oi prakrti - from its outermost sheath, the body, to its\ninnermost core, the deep Self. When the individual self, the 'I' is quieted\ndown by yogic practices, prakrti has reached its end and unites with the Self.\nThis is subjective experience, or subjective knowledge. &nbsp;The sadhaka attains purity in buddki and\nahamkara, the infinitesimal source or summit of nature, mula-prakrti. Here, the\nsadhaka has reached the juncture of Self-Realisation.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.46\u2014 ta eva sabijah\nsamadhih</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">These constitute seeded\ncontemplations.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The states of samadhi\ndescribed in the previous sutras are dependent on a support or seed, and are\ntermed sabija. &nbsp;&nbsp;The savitarka,\nnirvitarka, savicara, nirvicara, sananda and sasmita satnadhis are known as\nsabija (seeded or with seed) satnadhis. &nbsp;&nbsp;Beyond both Savitarka and Nirvitarka is\nSavichara. With Savichara, the gross thoughts (Vitarkas) have subsided, but\nthere are still subtle thought patterns, which are called Vichara. Savitarka\nSamapatti and Savichara Samapatti are similar processes, though one is on gross\nthoughts, while the other relates to subtle thoughts.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirvichara\nis concentration in which there are no longer any extraneous gross or subtle\nactivities in the mind. This purity of mind comes through the processes of\nmeditation and non-attachment. In Nirvichara Samapatti, the engrossed mind\ncompletely takes on the coloring of the subtle object of meditation, much like\na pure crystal will take on the coloring of whatever color it is near. With\nincreasing mastery of Nirvichara, the eternal Self begins to shine for the\naspirant. All the states of samapatti described in 1.17-19 and 1.42-45 are\nseeded satnadhis. &nbsp;All these satnadhis\nare dependent on an object which includes the intelligence (buddhi) and the I\nprinciple (asmita). Their seed is the nucleus of the being, the only seedless\nseat in individuals. Asmita is a very fine level of individuality or ego,\nmeaning the way thought impressions become colored by I-am-ness, so as to\nmistakenly think that this thought pattern or memory is related to me. Meditation\non Asmita gradually reveals the individuality, standing alone, underneath all\nof the attractions, aversions, and fears. It is remarkable to note that the six\nsamapattis mentioned so far belong to the functions of the brain. The source of\nanalysis (savitarka) or absence of analysis (nirvitarka) is the frontal brain.\nFor investigation and examination (savicara) or absence of them (nirvicara),\nthe source is the back brain. The source of joy (ananda) is the base of the\nbrain, and of individuality (asmita), the top of the brain. &nbsp;Through the disciplines of yoga, the sadhaka\ntransforms his attention from the gross to the subtle. When he reaches the\nsummit of nature, the brain being a part of nature, he attains precision in\ncontrolling the modes of consciousness. He is able to stop all functions of the\nbrain, deliberate and non-deliberate, at will. That is why it is termed samadhi\nwith seed. &nbsp;Whatever is dependent on\nnature for contemplation is seeded samapatti. The contemplation of the seer,\nwho is the source of all seeds, is without support. Though both seer and nature\nare eternal, nature is changeable while the seer remains the same,\nirreversible, not dependent upon any support except his own self. That is why\ncontemplation of the seer is seedless or supportless (mrbija) samadhi. &nbsp;Similar to the petals of a lotus, which\nblossom forth as the sun rises, and closes as it sets, the petals of the brain\nretreat from the fringe to its source, its stem, or bud, and all its functions\nstop. This is commonly called asamprajnata samadhi. It is the threshold between\nsabija and mrbija samadhi. If the sadhaka remains on the threshold, he barely\nsubdues the elements. If he falls back, he is caught in pleasures and pains. If\nhe crosses over, he achieves freedom and beatitude.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.47\u2014 nirvicharavaisharadye\nadhyatmaprasadah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">From proficiency in\nnirvicara samapatti comes transparency. Sattva or luminosity flows undisturbed,\nkindling the spiritual light of the self.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the state of\nnirvichara where deliberate argumentation, analysis, etc. cease, the logical\nfunction of the mind comes to an end and there is no deduction or induction\nprocess any longer \u2013 there is only direct visualisation. Here, the peace of the\nSelf manifests itself. Where does it manifest itself? In the luminous condition\nattained through the meditation known as nirvichara. Prasadah is peace,\nserenity, tranquillity \u2013 complete self-absorption free from all distractions\nand rajasic agitation. The concentration \u201cwithout reasoning\u201d being purified,\nthe Chitta becomes firmly fixed. When intelligence and consciousness, the\nsubstance of man, remains non-reflective, profound and unconditioned, the\nvehicles of the soul - the anatomical body, the organs of action, the senses of\nperception, the mind, intelligence and consciousness - are illuminated.\nKnowledge and understanding of the real state of the soul manifest in\nluminosity. Present is the reality. The past is finished, and the future\ndoesn\u2019t exist. When the Kundalini rises she elongates those thoughts and\nestablishes in the center where there is complete thoughtless awareness. And\nspiritually you grow in that thoughtless awareness which &nbsp;we call as Nirvichara Samadhi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.48\u2014 rtanbhara tatr\nprajna</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Therein is the faculty\nof supreme wisdom.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.49\u2014 shrutanumanaprajnabhyam\nanyavishayaa vishesharthatvat</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The wisdom obtained in\nthe higher states of consciousness is different from that obtained by inference\nand testimony as it refers to particulars.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Truth-bearing knowledge\nis first-hand, intuitive knowledge. &nbsp;This\nwisdom is acquired by the means of insight. It is an exceptional, direct\nknowledge arising from the soul, not from the perception of the senses or from\nthe ordinary understanding. Hence, it has an unusual property of its own. The\nknowledge that springs from one's inner self is intuitive knowledge. It is also\nknown as 'listening to the inner voice'. &nbsp;The sadhaka may be judged to be of a mature\nand cultured mind; his perceptions have an independent soundness requiring no\nverification from other sources. An ordinary man possesses free will in the\nsense that he experiences choice and must find his way by discrimination. The\nenlightened sadhaka, having left duality behind him, experiences only his own\nwill, which surpasses the vacillations of choice. This is the intelligence of\nsattva in sattva. The idea is that we have to get our knowledge of ordinary objects\nby direct perception, and by inference therefrom, and from testimony of people\nwho are competent. By \u201cpeople who are competent,\u201d the Yogis always mean the\nRishis, or the Seers of the thoughts recorded in the Scriptures\u2014the Vedas. According\nto them, the only proof of the Scriptures is that they were the testimony of\ncompetent persons, yet they say the Scriptures cannot take us to realisation.\nWe can read all the Vedas, and yet will not realise anything, but when we practise\ntheir teachings, then we attain to that state which realises what the\nScriptures say, which penetrates where reason cannot go, and where the\ntestimony of others cannot avail. This is what is meant by this aphorism, that realization\nis real religion, and all the rest is only preparation\u2014hearing lectures, or\nreading books, or reasoning, is merely preparing the ground; it is not\nreligion. Intellectual assent, and intellectual dissent are not religion. The\ncentral idea of the Yogis is that just as we come in direct contact with the\nobjects of the senses, so religion can be directly perceived in a far more\nintense sense. The truths of religion, as God and Soul, cannot be perceived by\nthe external senses. I cannot see God with my eyes, nor can I touch Him with my\nhands, and we also know that neither can we reason beyond the senses. The whole\nscope of realisation, is beyond Newtonic sense perception. The Yogis say that\nman can go beyond his direct sense perception, and beyond his reason also. Man\nhas in him the faculty, the power, of transcending his intellect even, and that\npower is in every being, every creature. By the practice of Yoga that power is\naroused, and then man transcends the ordinary limits of reason, and directly\nperceives things which are beyond all reason. In Indian yoga, intuition is the\nsingle greatest tool .Intuition is soul guidance or the inner voice.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intuition\nhelps you stay in the present, like what is advocated in the Bhagavat Gita. It\nhas little to do with predicting the future.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the human\nsenses are channels for intuition and every cell can be an antenna to receive\ninformation. Intuition is a gift of crisis--- It tells you the right thing to\ndo when you don't have time to figure it all out. Intuits are able to see\npossibilities and alternatives that aren\u2019t immediately apparent. Your inner\nknowing comes from first your instincts, second your intellect, and third from\nyour intuition.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intuition is not pseudo-science . It is\nan essential psychological function like thinking, feeling and sensing. The\ndivining power of intuition comes from our inner self. It arises from very\nrapid processing of bits of information that are stored in our subconscious.\nIntuition thinks in terms of metaphor, feelings, pictures, and the spatial\nwhole and doesn't fit neatly into the cause-and-effect model. Your intuition\nwill not force you to do things that are truly wrong for yourself or other\npeople in contradiction with the laws of the universe. Intuition is listening\nto the inner voice or heeding the promptings from within. Intuition is a\nability to cut through the thickness of surface reality.&nbsp; Your sub-conscious which operates a dozen\ntimes faster than your conscious mind has picked up on signals that your\nconscious mind has not yet processed. We function through partial information,\nand intuition gives us an overview, a whole sense of things.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ndivining power of intuition comes from our inner self-- very rapid processing\nof bits of information that are stored in our subconscious. We cannot command\nour gut feeling to use it at will. It just surfaces spontaneously when certain\ncircumstances are present. Intuitive insights suddenly appear as ideas or\nfeelings.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intuitive decisions are NOT guesswork . Intuition\nhas an important role to play in decision making . Intuition is not limited to\nopinions but can encompass the ability to know valid solutions to problems. Intuition\nusually shows up in the areas where you have passion and talent. By logic that\nwe prove, by intuition we discover. Intuition is a sudden and inexplicable\nknowing. It lies at the roots of spontaneity, humor, creativity, inspiration,\nand even genius.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intuition has its own unique language\nfor communicating with you through touch, sight, taste, sound, and smell. As\nyou pay attention to your senses, you\u2019ll begin to understand the \u201cvocabulary\u201d\nof your intuition. Mental static and EGO can get in the way of tapping into\nintuition.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intuition bubbles up from within and can be\noverwhelmed by old mental or emotional \"tapes\" . Intuition gone wild\nbecomes \u201cjumping to conclusions\u201d. By going too far out on a limb , you risk\nmisinterpreting the situation and start harming others. Intuition should not be\noverused.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So what exactly is intuition? It is the messages\nfrom your unconscious mind making contact with your consciousness. . The\nuncanny ability to detect patterns in the world around us, and to extrapolate\nlarger truths . Use it always, never ignore it.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By listening to\nwhat our heart and soul tells us to do - and then doing it - we can take\nourselves anywhere we have ever dreamed of going. Your consciousness only uses\na tiny proportion of your brainpower and your intuition accesses the residual\npower and communicates to your consciousness the bank of wisdom and knowledge\nit has available. This is done subtly through thoughts, feelings, sensations,\nimages, sounds or any combination of them. Just as animals have a natural\nsurvival instinct so humans are born with the natural ability to be intuitive;\nyour human instinct.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intuitive insights motivate us to grow\ncloser to the creative source, thereby igniting our own creative spark and\nexpression, which is the essence of our true self. When you feel excited about\nsomething, that's a hint about what to pursue.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Decisions are\nmade in the mind\u2014choices are made in the gut.&nbsp;\nChoices come from your essence and attunement to your higher self.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.50\u2014 tajjah sanskaro\nnyasanskarapratibandhi</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">A new life begins with\nthis truth-bearing light. Previous impressions are left behind and new ones are\nprevented.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the power of the\nintellect springs from passionate insight, that insight neutralises all\nprevious residues of action, movement and impression. Vritti (whirlpool,\nthought-wave) arises in the mind-ocean. It operates for sometime. Then it sinks\nbelow the threshold of normal consciousness. From the surface of the conscious\nmind wherein it was uppermost for some time, it sinks down deep into the region\nof the subconscious mind (Chitta). There, it continues to be a subliminal\naction and becomes a Samskara (impression). A conscious action-whether\ncognitive, affective or conative-assumes a potential and hidden (Sukshma and\nAvyakta) form just below the threshold of consciousness. This is termed a\nSamskara.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Samskaras (impressions) are embedded in the subconscious\nmind or Chitta.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The past is preserved even to the\nminutest detail. Even a bit is never lost. When the fine Samskaras come up to\nthe surface of the conscious mind back again as a big wave, when the past\nVritti comes back to the surface of the conscious mind again by recollection,\nit is called memory or Smriti. No memory is possible without the help of\nSamskara. A Samskara of an experience is formed or developed in the Chitta at\nthe very moment that the mind is experiencing something. There is no gap\nbetween the present experience and the formation of a Samskara in the\nsubconscious mind. A specific experience leaves a specific Samskara. The memory\nof this specific experience springs from that particular Samskara only, which\nwas formed out of that particular experience. New samskaras may continue to come\nforth due to the vacillations of the mind, and this may obstruct real\nknowledge. These mental impressions must be supervened upon by the power of\ndiscrimination, and then all doubts fade away. When doubts are cleared, the\nsadhaka has to dispose off even this discriminative knowledge. The new\nilluminating wisdom is free from doubts and discriminations; it blazes forth, a\nshimmering beacon of knowledge. The only way of attaining to that\nsuper-consciousness is by concentration, and we have also seen that what hinder\nthe mind from concentration are the past Samskaras, impressions. Brain is not\ncapable of distinguishing between reality and memory\u2014the same neurons are\nsparked when we see something as when we merely remember it.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brain\ncannot distinguish between an image of experience and one of vivid imagination.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\na person is in coma , anastesia, narco serum, shock, seizure or sleeping\u2014the\nsubconscious minds are wide open. Anything that will be said in their presence\nwill be accepted by the spirit which will begin carrying it out. &nbsp;Any passing comment or trivial statements can\nhave a devastating effect on our subconscious mind because it is not\nargumentative or analytical. It accepts all statements directly on the face\nvalue. Even prayers and beliefs are positive signals which we give to our\nsubconscious mind as something acceptable and true. The subconscious mind\ncannot tell the difference between a real experience and one that you vividly\nimagine. You can fool it or condition it. The subconscious mind does not\nthink\u2014it is only a store house of our experience. It has no sense of time. It\ncannot differentiate between positive and negative input. It cannot tell the\ndifference between real and imagines experience. The conscious mind can be\nengaged 100% in talking or deep thinking while the subconscious keeps the car\non the road. The conscious and subconscious minds are connected through a\nfilter. So we cant read the contents of our subconscious mind. Subconscious,\nmental activities within an individual proceed without his awareness. Dreams\nand slips of the tongue are concealed examples of unconscious content too\nthreatening to be confronted directly. &nbsp;When\nthe situation demands we are able to use the subconscious memory to the full\nextent\u2014but only in relation to the specific problem. The conscious mind has\nlimited memory. The subconscious mind has unlimited memory. Subconscious mind\nnever sleeps even in a coma. the Subconscious has a tendency to accept what it\nimagines as real. &nbsp;Every experience we\nhave ever had is impressed somewhere in the electrochemical cells in our brain.\nThe brain records every thing\u2014every thing senses by our 5 senses\u2014and it is\nimprinted in the brain cells for ever. Whenever something reactivates those\ncells we get a mental picture duplicating the original experience. The picture\nin our mind has an impact on every cell in our bodies. Thinking is not an\naction of the mind , but an action of our entire body. Tell your subconscious\nwhat you want repeatedly and it will produce it. You can call this\nvisualization or intention. &nbsp;The\nsubconscious has a perfect memory. Every thing you have experienced using your\n5 senses is part of the permanent memory of the subconscious mind, which never\nsleeps The subconscious mind acts on old beliefs stored over a lifetime. Many\nof those beliefs you may have accepted without thinking. Or you may have\nabsorbed them when you were too young to exercise choice.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Subconscious\nmind has a memory of 100 trillion images, all our experiences, emotions and\nfeelings are stored as an image or a sound in a digitised manner . Data that\ncannot be recalled are retained in the subconscious. A person may be\nunconscious of ever having been locked in a closet as a child, yet under\nhypnosis he may recall the experience vividly. Negative suggestions with\ngrowing children gets rooted in their subconscious mind and is reflected later\nin their behavior. &nbsp;During hypnosis \u2013our\nconscious mind goes into a trance and suggestions are given directly to the\nsubconscious mind, which cannot argue but accepts the suggestion at its face\nvalue. We do self hypnosis unknowingly several times an a day while doing our\nday to day activities. This is how our body learns to relax otherwise we would\ndie of stress at a very early age. Any monotonous sequence of events make it\nboring for the brain and eventually it starts producing a hormone called\nSerotin which induces a drowsy state of mind.&nbsp;\nThere are samakaras of past life on the soul which causes phobias in\ncurrent life. &nbsp;They can be dissolved by\nmeditation .</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A child is born with his Samskaras. A child is born\nwith his past experiences transmuted into mental and moral tendencies and\npowers. By experiences, pleasant and painful, man gathers materials and builds\nthem into mental and moral faculties.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The aim of a Sadhaka is\nto fry out or burn or obliterate all these Samskaras through Nirbija Samadhi.\nSadhana consists in wiping out the Samskaras. Jnani is without Samskaras. They\nare fried out by Jnana. No doubt, the force of the Samskaras remains in the\nAntahkarana. But they are harmless. They will not bind the Jnani.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.51\u2014 tasyapi nirodhe\nsarvanirodhannirbijah samadhih</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">When that new light of\nwisdom is also relinquished, seedless samadhi dawns.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sadhaka must learn\nto hold back even this new impression of truth-bearing light. &nbsp;When both old and new impressions are dissolved,\na state of seedless enlightenment arises, in which all illusions and delusions\ncease. This is nirbija samadhi - the state of absolute identity with the seer. Even\nthis distinctive knowledge of insight (1.50) has to be checked, curbed and\nmoderated. Then, as &nbsp;rivers cease to have\ntheir individual existence on uniting with the sea, all volitions and\nimpressions of the unconscious, subconscious, conscious and super-conscious\nmind cease to exist. All these rivers of consciousness unify with the ocean of\nthe seer. Nirbija samadhi is the conquering of the citta where the root mind is\none with the seer. As all invading thoughts are brought to an end by practice\nand detachment, the soul is freed from the pinions of earthly vehicles - the\nbody, senses, mind, intelligence and consciousness. The seer is in the\namanaskatva state. When citta is dependent on an object, idea or symbol, the\nstate is called sabija samadhi. In nirbija samadhi, citta dissolves and no\ndeposit of impressions remain. All residual impressions, the thinking faculty\nand the feelings of 'T' are extinguished without trace and become universal.\nThe soul alone manifests and rages without form, in immaculate clarity. You\nremember that our goal is to perceive the Soul iself. We cannot perceive the\nSoul because it has got mingled up with nature, with the mind, with the body.\nThe most ignorant man thinks his body is the Soul. Samskaras cover the Soul.\nThe real nature of the Soul is not perceived until all the waves have subsided;\nso, first, Patanjali teaches us the meaning of these waves; secondly, the best\nway to repress them; and thirdly, how to make one wave so strong as to suppress\nall other waves, fire eating fire as it were.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Red Adiar put\nout large oil rig fires by using the same medium ( not water , it wont work )\n--- he produced a second HUGE fire which he could control by remote, it just\nate up the smaller oil rig fire-- and then he put it off by remote.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;T<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">he truths of life are congruent\ntill a laxman rekha--&nbsp; after that the\nreverse happens-- When only one wave remains, it will be easy to suppress that\nalso, and when that is gone, this Samadhi of concentration is called seedless;\nit leaves nothing, and the Soul is manifested just as It is, in Its own glory. Soul\ncannot be born, It cannot die, It is immortal, indestructible, the Ever-living\nEssence of intelligence. It is a part of the mother field of brahmAn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Sagnik D<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">December 13, 2017 at 11:59 AM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">From reading so many of your blogs I just realized that in Kaliyuga we are obsessed with using our brain to create tools through technology to do things for us. The whole cosmos is interconnected in this field and speed is NOT restricted to Einstein's SPEED OF LIGHT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Sri Yantra ( DIVINE GEOMETRY OF OM ) which follows the Fibonacci series and the Golden ratio ( lifted from 7000 year old Vedic Mathematics ) is the mystical 3D holographic construct of the Cosmos by 9 VIRTUAL SPIRALLING VORTEX CONES \u2014 4 pointing upwards and 5 pointing downwards, as a sort of ying-yang balance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The master cellular control system of the human body is holographic. Nothing we experience escapes being imprinted into our Cellular Hologram in the form of a cell memory. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/blockchain-bitcoin-big-brother-will.html?showComment=1513185259860#c4671100578196233665\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888;\">December 13, 2017 at 10:44 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_175MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nPhysicists in China and the US have built a 10-qubit superconducting quantum processor that could be scaled up to tackle problems not solvable by classical computers.<br />\n<br />\nQubits are the building blocks of quantum computing, capable of superposition \u2013 being in two states at the same time, rather than the computer bits of today, which are either a 1 or a 0 at any given moment.<br />\n<br />\nEntanglement is where quantum states can't be described independently, but only in relation to the others, making for a more solid system. The team used a measurement technique called quantum tomography to prove that they had indeed entangled their qubits<br />\n<br />\nThe phenomenon of entanglement in quantum physics, which has been observed in many experiments, implies that objects that are far removed in space (even across billions of miles) remain connected even though there is no mediating agency.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/quantum-entanglement-video-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\n<br />\nVedic philosophy tells us about the existence of another type of particle called the atma, the soul, the self, having different properties from those of ordinary particles.This is not unusual in physics, as is the case with antimatter particles.<br />\n<br />\nThe atma does not come into or out of existence, it is always present. It does not decay or degrade, it maintains its individuality always, it\u2019s infinitesimally small and it\u2019s not composed of more elementary particles. It\u2019s unchangeable, which along with the individuality property implies that it does not unite with other particles to create more complex structures, nor does it merge with others.<br />\n<br />\nThe atma does not interact directly with matter, but given that the atma is the source of consciousness and the life force in a living entity, any entity displaying them reveals the presence of an atma in it\u2014whether human, animal, plant, etc.<br />\n<br />\nVedanta wrote 7000 years ago-- The living entities are not made up of atmas; rather, they are these particles and are animating the material bodies that encase them. As soon as the atma leaves one body for another, the old body no longer exhibits consciousness or life symptoms, and begins to degrade.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/daltons-atomic-theory-sage-kashyapa-and.html</span><br />\n<br />\nMaharishi Kashyapa is also known as Kanada Muni. He called the atom Anu. He wrote that there are 108 such elements ...<br />\n<br />\nThe basic Vaisheshika concepts of matter, action, attribute, time and space are described. The 8500 year old Nyaya-Vaiseshika Sutra of Kanada Muni consists of 373 Sutras and is composed of 12 chapters.<br />\n<br />\nIt\u2019s main postulates are:--<br />\n<br />\nAll of the universe is composed of the 5 mahabhuttas and the 4 non physicals: that is Fluid, Atomic elements, fields/force, energy, ether and space, time, mind and soul.<br />\n<br />\nExcept ether, all of the physical elements are made of discreet and distinct paramanus or atoms<br />\n<br />\nSpace-time is a frame in which the physical universe exists<br />\n<br />\nThere are seven categories of experience, which are substance, quality, activity, generality, particularity, inherence, and nonexistence.<br />\n<br />\nEnergy and mass are equivalent.<br />\n<br />\nHere are some of the Sutras: ---<br />\n<br />\nForce is that which displaces, holds together or moves things apart.V.S 1.1.20<br />\nIn the absence of a force, a particle of matter experiences no change. V.S 1.1.6<br />\nThe forces to be considered are an external force, gravity, that with causes attraction of particles, that which causes repulsion of particles and the internal movements of them in matter.<br />\n<br />\nV.S 1.1.13 Action is opposed by an equivalent opposite reaction<br />\nV.S 5.1.1618 The diversities of the movement of an arrow are due to the consecutive changes in the components of the acting forces. The stored energy provides the propulsion to the arrow and this causes it move further to a high point. This component keeps reducing while that of gravity increases resulting in its fall.Once the work against gravity ceases then the body reaches an energyless state falling under gravity.<br />\nV.S 1.1.27 The force on a body is the resultant of gravity and the work done against it.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_175BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_175b+seedBBVAD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_173T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee;
