padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_175b+seedBBVAD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_173B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5923840167230626705\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_173M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_173MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nV.S 5.1.13 In the absence of all other forces (saMyogabindings) gravity exists.<br />\nV.S 5.1.7 The \u201cguna\u201d of forces (direction) prevents a magnitude from being obtained<br />\nV.S.1.1.20a The nature of physical changes in matter is the terms of work being done on the basic particles that constitute matter.<br />\nV.S 2.1.14 The particular nature of air is suggested by the mixing of gases that occurs on their collision. Despite of being made of atoms and occupying space air fails show orderly movement so its form cannot be perceived<br />\nV.S 4.1.8 Solids occupy space and assume form due to conglomeration of the constituent particles.<br />\nV.S 4.1.6 The (fluid\u2019s) particles possess energy. This causes them to possess the property of fluidity. The heat bearing rays provide the particles with energy to form a gas and rise. The heated particles of air impact the vapor and with this energy it mixes with it. Freezing and melting of a liquid as being a result of heat being taken up or given up by its particles.<br />\nV.S 5.2.9 Some apparently solid substances like ghee, lac and wax are in reality liquids, as their particles are naturally \u201cheat-conjoined\u201d or disorganized as in water. Other true solid substances such as tin, lead, iron, silver and gold need their atoms to be supplied with external heat to disorder them before they become a fluid.<br />\nV.S 2.1.67 Any body\u2019s mass needs to be wholly explained in terms of its constituent particles.<br />\nV.S 1.1.89 A substance can only emerge from another substance and not on its own eventhough its properties change from one to another.<br />\nV.S 9.1.9 Any fundamental particular entity can be a constituent multiple substances.<br />\nV.S 1.1.22 Any substance comprising of two or more primary particle types requires a chemical reaction to generate the conjoining and break up of preexisting molecules.<br />\nV.S 1.1.23 The \u201cmolecules\u201d are stated as emerging from combinations between the fundamental entities.<br />\nV.S 1.1.25 Forces are necessary to bring about combination and break up of molecules.<br />\nV.S 1.1.28 The combinations of particles to produce molecules result in substances with states very different from those of the original particles.<br />\n<br />\nKanada Muni\u2019s laws:<br />\n<br />\nIn the production or increment of karma (i.e. motion), the root cause is force. In other words, there is incremental or decremental change in motion.<br />\nThis law is a law of the measure of force. According to this, so long mechanical force works, there is change in motion i.e. there is momentum. To find its value, it is calculated how much work it produces in a unit time.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_173MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_173BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_173B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_174B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c466643263114631994\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_174M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_174MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2--<br />\n<br />\nMathematically, the rate of change in momentum i.e. the increment in work in unit time is proportional to the force in action. Also, this change is in the direction of the force. Suppose that the mass of an object is \u2018m\u2019 and in time interval \u2018t\u2019, the velocity of the object changes from \u2018u\u2019 to \u2018v\u2019 due to the force acting on it.<br />\n<br />\nThen, Initial momentum = m*u<br />\nFinal momentum = m*v<br />\nChange in momentum = m(v*u)<br />\nTherefore, the rate of change of momentum = m(v*u)/t<br />\nt = m*a (from Kanada\u2019s first law)<br />\n<br />\nFrom Kandas second law, force is proportional to the rate of change of momentum<br />\nOr, p = k*m*a (where k is a constant)<br />\nIf m=1 and a=1, then<br />\n1 = k*1*1 or k = 1<br />\nOr, p = m*a<br />\n<br />\nTherefore, unit force is the one that produces unit acceleration in an object of unit mass. The VS then goes to say that force is a result of work and is not a physical quantity which is superior to Newtons law that measures it as a physical quantity.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\n<br />\nThe sutras on energy:<br />\n<br />\nVaiseshika defines energy as being a radiant thing(i.e. energy is radiation) and energy is related totemperature and motion of a particle.<br />\n<br />\nVedic Indians understood the process of refraction and absorbtion of energy by \u201cmaterial obstructions\u201d and they understood heat, electricity and magnetism to be forms of energy. It is already understood by the elemental theory that light is also an energy and is composed of discreet units.<br />\n<br />\nThis was of course was not understood in modern times till Max Plank and Einstein in the 20th cetury devised quantum theory after the study of black body radiation and the photoelectric effect.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_175b+seedBBVAD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 54 , BELOW-</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_21.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_21.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-kE5_ytCP0Og/V45uRAz3XwI/AAAAAAABLFY/tnmM8UvWyMYQAEalCs_AzdF5LI-rWvLYwCLcB/s1600/20160718_205559.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-kE5_ytCP0Og/V45uRAz3XwI/AAAAAAABLFY/tnmM8UvWyMYQAEalCs_AzdF5LI-rWvLYwCLcB/s320/20160718_205559.jpg\" width=\"207\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">purusharthashoonyanan gunanan\npratiprasavahkaivalyan, svaroopapratishtha va chitishaktireti<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">YOGA IS THE PATH TO\nKAIVALYA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogi, who has\nattained kaivalya, as an entity who has gained independence from all bondages\nand achieved the absolute true consciousness or ritambhara prajna<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Kaivalya is the\nvery nature of the self, the supreme state (paramam padam). It is without parts\nand is stainless. It is the direct intuition of the Real-existence,\nintelligence and bliss. it is devoid of birth, existence, destruction,\nrecognition, and experience. This is called knowledge.\" <b>Yogatattva Upanishad (16-18) 5000 BC<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kaivalya is freedom\nfrom the mind and modifications of the mind<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kaivalya ( liberation)\ncomes when the Gunas (qualities), devoid of motive, become latent. &nbsp;&nbsp;Or the power of consciousness gets\nestablished in its own nature. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the soul realises\nthat it is absolutely independent and it does not depend on anything else in\nthis world, this highest knowledge, Kaivalya &nbsp;comes in. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The soul feels that it is ever free,\nunchanging, immortal, beginningless, endless, infinite, beyond time, space and\ncausation, full of bliss, peace and knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By attaining Kaivalya,\nthe yogi attains everything and nothing more remains.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>I NOW WRITE THE FOLLOWING BECAUSE THE WEST THINKS YOGA IS PHYSICAL EXERCISE. &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THEIR SHALLOW MINDS CANNOT FATHOM THE DEPTH OF YOGA.</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>EVANGLELISTS OF SINGLE HOLY BOOKS RECITE A VERSE AND THEN SPEAK RIDICULOUS BULLSHIT ( LOWEST CEREBRAL PLANE ) FOR HOURS --- THINGS WHICH HAS ABSOLUTELY NO CONNECTION WITH THE VERSE RECITED.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/V8KxXHibv6A/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/V8KxXHibv6A?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: purple;\">THESE ARE THE MENTAL MIDGETS WHO CALL ANCIENT INDIANS HEATHEN SAVAGES &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.01 atha yoganushasanam</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Now,\nan exposition of&nbsp; YOGA . </span><o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The disciplines of\nintegration are here. Patanjali analyses the components of consciousness <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.02 yogashchittavrittinirodhah</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Yoga restrains the mind-stuff (Chitta) from taking various forms (Vrttis).&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga is about\nrestraining the thought-streams natural to the mind. &nbsp;Yoga restrains fluctuations of the consciousness.\nYoga is the art and science of mental discipline , to make the mind cultured\nand mature. Chitta is the subtlest form of cosmic intelligence ( mahat ) .</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\neyes are only a secondary instrument, not the organ of vision. The organ of\nvision is in the nerve centre of the brain. Sometimes a man is asleep</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">with his eyes open. The light is there and\nthe picture is there, but a third thing is necessary; mind must be joined to\nthe organ. The mind takes the impression farther in, and presents it to the\ndeterminative faculty\u2014Buddhi\u2014which reacts. Along with this reaction flashes the\nidea of egoism. Then this mixture of action and reaction is presented to the\nPurusa, the real Soul, who perceives an object in this mixture. The organs\n(Indriyas), together with the mind (Manas), the determinative faculty (Buddhi)\nand egoism (Ahamkara), form the group called the Antahkarana (the internal\ninstrument). They are but various processes in the mind-stuff, called Chitta ( consciousness\n) . The waves of thought in the Chitta ( mindstuff ) </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">are called Vrtti ( the whirlpool). The bottom\nof the lake we cannot see, because its surface is covered with ripples. It is\nonly possible when the rippled have subsided, and the water is calm, for us to\ncatch a glimpse of the bottom. If the water is muddy, the bottom will not be\nseen; if the water is agitated all the time, the bottom will not be seen. If\nthe water is clear, and there are no waves, we shall see the bottom. That\nbottom of the lake is our own true Self; the lake is the Chitta, and the waves\nare the Vrttis. Again, this mind is in three states; one is darkness, which is\ncalled Tamas, just as in brutes and idiots; it only acts to injure others. No other\nidea comes into that state of mind. Then there is the active state of mind,\nRajas, whose chief motives are power and </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">njoyment. \u201cI will be powerful and rule\nothers.\u201d Then, at last, when the waves cease, and the water of the lake</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">becomes clear, there is the state called\nSattva, serenity, calmness. It is not inactive, but rather intensely active. It\nis the greatest manifestation of power to be calm. It is easy to be active. Let\nthe reins go, and the horses will drag you down. Anyone can do that, but he who\ncan stop the plunging horses is the strong man. Which requires the greater\nstrength, letting go, or restraining? The calm man is not the man who is dull. You\nmust not mistake Sattva for dullness, or laziness. The calm man is the one who\nhas restraint of these waves. Activity is the </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">anifestation of the lower strength, calmness\nof the superior strength. To restrain it, and to checkthis outward tendency </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">is the first step in Yoga, because only in\nthis way can the Chitta get into its proper course. Although this Chitta is in\nevery animal, from the lowest to the highest, it is only in the conscious human\nform that we find intellect, and until the mind-stuff can take the form of\nintellect it is not possible for it to return through all these steps, and\nliberate the soul. Immediate salvation is impossible for the non conscious\nanimal ( who cant pass the colour/ mirror test ) </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">although they have mind, because their Chitta\ncannot as yet take that form which we call intellect. Chitta manifests itself\nin all these different forms - scattering, darkening, weakening, and\nconcentrating. These are the four states in which the mind-stuff manifests\nitself. First a scattered form, is activity. Its tendency is to manifest in the\nform of pleasure or of pain. Then the dull form is darkness, the only tendency\nof which is to injure others. The commentator says the first form is natural to\nthe Devas, the angels, and the second is the demoniacal form. The Ekagra, the\nconcentrated form of the Chitta, is what brings us to Samadhi. The sadhaka\u2019s\naim is to bring consciousness to a state of purity and transclusence.\nAntakharana ( conscience ) unifies ahamkara ( ego ) and antaratma ( soul ) by a\ncommon thread. Yoga stops mind chatter ( fluctuating thought ). Stillness is\ndharana ( concentration ) and silence is dhyana ( meditaion ) Restraining the\nfluctuations of the mind is the goal ( samadhi ). Yoga is both the means and\nthe end.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.03 tada drashtuh svaroope avasthanam &nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Then the seer dwells in\nhis own true unmodified splendour.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As soon as the waves\nhave stopped, and the lake has become quiet, we see the ground below the lake.\nSo with the mind; when it is calm, we see what our own nature is. When the\nwaves of consciousness are stilled , they can longer distort the true\nexpressions of the soul. Revealed in his own nature , the radiant seer abides\nin his own grandeur. In this state wisdom dawns clear. The vision of the soul\nradiates without any activity on the part of chitta . Once realized , the soul\nabides in its own seat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.04 - vritti saroopyam\nitaratra</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">At other times the seer\nis identified with the fluctuating thoughtstreams&nbsp;</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When someone blames you\n, you go into a state of sorrow.&nbsp; This is\na modification, Vrtti, and you identify yourself with it - the result is\nmisery. &nbsp;Noone should be able to make you\nfeel guilty without your own consent.&nbsp; The\nnatural tendency of consciousness is to become involved with the object\nseen.&nbsp; No human cries ( sheds tears ) unless\nout of selfishness \u2013 the person identifies himself with the sorrow. When the\nsoul does not radiate its own glory it is a sign that the thinking faculty has manifested\nitself n place of the soul. Imprint of objects is transmitted to chitta through\nsenses of perception. Chitta absorbs these impressions and is modified by them\n. The soul is in fog. Chitta becomes murky and causes changes in behavior and\nmood as it identifies itself with objects seen.We are aware of the internal\nfacet of chitta only when it speaks with the voice of conscience. Yoga aims at\nrestraining the senses of ensnarement , cleansing the fogged lens of chitta , until\nit transmits only the light of the soul.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.05-&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">vrittayah pangchatayyah\nklishta aklishtah</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The thought-streams are\nfive-fold, &nbsp;cognizable or non-cognizable\n, painful or not painful.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pain may be hidden in\nthe non-painful state and vice versa. When consciousness take the lead the\nseeds of change is not in the seer. Cognizable pains are anhillated by\nyoga.&nbsp; Incognizable pains are prevented\nfrom rising to the state of cognition by freedom from vasanas ( desires ), non\nattachment ( vairagya ) and of course by yogic sadhana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.06-&nbsp; pramannaviparyayavikalpanidrasmritayah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">They are caused by\ncorrect knowledge , illusion , delusion, sleep and memory</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consciousness has five qualitative\ntypes of intelligence.- mudha ( stupid ), ksipta ( distracted ), viksipta (\nagitated ), ekagra ( focused ) and niruddha ( restrained ). Hence fluctuations\nare also classified in five categories. Wrong perception (viparyaya ) are\ngathered by the senses of perception and they influence the mind\u2014like the six\nblind men and the elephant . Fancyful knowledge ( vikalpya )causes the mind to\nlive in an imaginary state . Memory helps one recollect the right experiences\nat right time for right understanding. Consciousness is empty in sleep . In\nsleep we experience a quiet state of mind (manolaya ) Correct knowledge is\ndirect knowledge from the core of the being. It is intuitive , hence pure and\nbeyond the field of intellect.&nbsp; Direct\nknowledge leads man to a state of consciousness called amanaskatva (liberation\n).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.07-&nbsp; pratyakshanumanagamah pramanani</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Direct perception,\ninference, and competent evidence, are proofs.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Correct knowledge is\nbased on three kinds of evidence - direct perception, correct inference or\ndeduction, and testimony from authoritative sacred SRUTI scriptures or men of\ngreat ethos SMRITI. &nbsp;Initially,\nindividual perception should be ascertained by rational logic, and then checked\nto correspond to traditional or scriptural wisdom. This process necessitates\nthe enlightened intelligence, or buddhi. Intellect is subtler than mind.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It is concerned with the knowledge of acts\nand the analysing ability, and becomes noticeable only through its monolithic\nquality, intelligence, which is closer to consciousness rather than to the mind\nor thought process. The real guru is the pure intellect within. The purified\nand aspiring mind is the disciple. The quality of intelligence is inherent but\ninactive, so one's primary step must be to awaken it. The practice of asana\nbrings intelligence to the surface of the cellular body through stretching and\nto the physiological body by holding the pose. Once aroused, intelligence can\nunwrap its vibrant aspect, its ability to tell apart. &nbsp;When discrimination has been cultivated and\nintelligence is full and dazzling, ego retreats&nbsp;\n.&nbsp; But spiritual intelligence,\nwhich stands for true wisdom, gets through only when discrimination ends.\nWisdom does not function in dichotomy. It recognises only oneness. It does not\nabandon the wrong, it perceives only the right. &nbsp;Just as the totally pure citta, free from\nsensory entrapments, gravitates towards the atman, so, once intelligence has\naccomplished the highest knowledge of nature, it is attracted inwards towards\nthe soul Aptavakyam, is the direct perception of the Yogi, of those who have\nseen the truth. We are all of us struggling towards knowledge, but you and I\nhave to struggle hard, and come to knowledge through a long tedious process of\nreasoning, but the Yogi, the pure one, has gone beyond all this. &nbsp;Any new discovery of truth does not contradict\nthe past truth, but fits into it.&nbsp;&nbsp; Truth\nmust have a possibility of verification. If a man says \u201cI have seen a vision,\u201d\nand tells me that I have no right to see it, I believe him not. Everyone must have\nthe power to see it for himself. No one who patents and sells his spiritual\nknowledge is an Apta. &nbsp;An apta ( realized\nyogi ) is&nbsp; pure, and that he has no selfish\nmotive; that he has no thirst for gain or fame. Have you seen our modern FAKE\ngurus? They crave the limelight . Even if they donate a rupee these selfish\nevil men want to squeeze something out of it.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apta Vakyas \u2013 the words\nof seers and Yogis who have realised and have given their emphatic declaration\nin the Upanishads \u2013 Yo Vai Bhuma Tat Sukham; Na Alpe Sukham Asti- </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chandogya Upanishad 7.23.1 5000 BC (The\nInfinite is the satisfying happiness. In the finite no happiness). You can get\nthat Supreme Bliss only in that transcendental Bhuma which is not conditioned\nby time, space and causation. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">But man is\ndeluded into thinking that he can obtain bliss from the objects</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.08-&nbsp; viparyayo mithyajnanam\natadroopapratishtham</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Illusory or flawed\nknowledge is based on non-fact or the non-real. </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Illusory knowledge is based\non the misrepresentation of reality. Incorrect understanding and mistaken\nconceptions contaminates the consciousness. This blocks the sadhaka in his\nefforts to go through the seer, and may give rise to a dual or split personality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.09-</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">shabdajnaananupati vastushoonyo vikalpah</span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Verbal knowledge devoid\nof substance or reality is fancy or imagination.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is another class\nof Vrttis called Vikalpa. &nbsp;A word is uttered,\nand we do not wait to consider its meaning; we jump to a faalthu conclusion\nimmediately. It is the sign of weakness of the Chitta. &nbsp;&nbsp;The weaker the man the less he has of\nrestraint. .Vikalpa, a vague and uncertain knowledge have no substantial basis,\nand which does not correspond to reality. &nbsp;If vikalpa is brought down to the level of\nfactual knowledge by examination, trial, error, and discrimination, it can\narouse a craving for correct or true knowledge, and delusion can be transformed\ninto vision and discovery..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.10- abhavapratyayalambana\nvrittirnidra</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Deep sleep is the\nmodification of the mind which has for its substratum nothingness.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The next class of\nVrttis is called sleep and dream. Sleep is a state in which all activities of\nthought and feeling come to a close. During sleep, the senses of perception\nrepose in the mind - the mind in the consciousness and the consciousness in the\nbeing. Sleep constitutes three kinds&nbsp; . In\ndeep sleep, these four types of knowledge are absent - the senses of perception\ndiscontinue to function because their king, the mind, is at rest. This is\nabhava, a state of nihility, a feeling of emptiness. &nbsp;Sleep furnishes one a glimpse of the seer, but\nonly murkily, because the light of discrimination, viveka, is befogged. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Simulation of this state of sleep when one\nis awake and aware is named samadhi, in which the seer witnesses his own form. When\nyou meditate your brain goes from Beta 25 Hz to Alpha 12 Hz and then to Theta 7\nHz. Delta is the slowest of all 5 brain frequencies- others being , alpha,\nbeta, theta and gamma . Your brain goes into the delta range of 1 to 3 Hz range\nduring deep non REM dreamless sleep. You also go to this range when you are\nknocked unconscious in a boxing bout, or if you are given anesthesia in the\nhospital. Masters of meditation and the ancient Indian rishis could go into\nthis range easily ( Samadhi ) and still be conscious and aware . During this\ndelta range the brain is at the lowest frequency but at the highest amplitude.<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Theta brain waves are\nassociated with \" subconscious mind \" -- while delta is connected\nwith \" unconscious mind \".</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beginners of meditation can go only to alpha\nand theta.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lesser ancient\nVedic rishis took Soma , a potent drug stronger than LSD to go into the delta\nrange for terrific intuition . Maharishis with 12 strand dNA and a king sized\npineal gland did NOT need soma. They could tap into \" universal knowledge\n\" ( the mind beyond our own or the collective unconscious)</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.11- -anubhootavishayasanpramoshah\nsmritih</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Memory is not allowing\nmental impressions to escape.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Memory is a\nmodification of consciousness allowing one to recapitulate past experiences.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Memory is the\ncollection of the modulations and impressions of accurate knowledge, perverse\nknowledge, illusory knowledge and sleep. As perception changes, memory too may\nvary, but when correctly used, it enables one to recall experiences in their\ntrue, unspoiled state. This ability is the groundwork of the practice of\ndiscrimination. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The five properties of\nconsciousness can be equated with the five fluctuations of consciousness -\ndullness with nidra, negligence with viparyaya, agitation with vikalpa,\none-pointed ness with smrti and self-discipline or control with pramana. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dream is a form of ripple\nwhich in the waking state is called memory.</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.12 - -abhyasavairagyabhyan\ntannirodhah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Practice and detachment\nare the means to still the movements of consciousness.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mind, to have this\nnon-attachment, must be clear, good and rational. &nbsp;&nbsp;Each action is like the pulsations quivering\nover the surface of the lake. The vibration dies out, and what is left? The\nSamskaras, the impressions. When a large number of these impressions is left on\nthe mind they coalesce, and become a habit. It is said \u201chabit is second\nnature;\u201d it is first nature also, and the whole nature of man; everything that\nwe are, is the result of habit. The Samskara is left by these vibrations\npassing out of our mind, each one of them leaving its result. Our character is\nthe sum-total of these marks, and according as some particular wave prevails\none takes that tone. Our sould has impressions of the past life too, which\npresent itself as phobias All the bad habits that have left their impressions\nare to be controlled by good habits. Go on doing good, thinking holy thoughts continuously;\nthat is the only way to suppress base impressions. Never say any man is\nhopeless, because he only represents a character, a bundle of habits, and these\ncan be checked by new and better ones. Character is repeated habits,and\nrepeated habits alone can reform character. Mental strength must be garnered,\nto achieve detachment and freedom from desires. Abhyasa expresses the sense of\nmechanical repetition, while anusthana connotes devotion, dedication and a\nreligious attitude. Repeated effort made with an in-depth understanding of the\nart and philosophy of yoga and with perfect communion of body, mind and soul is\nnot a mechanical practice, but a religious and spiritual one. Practice is the\npath of evolution - detachment and renunciation the path of involution. Practice\nis demanded in all the eight limbs of yoga. Evolutionary practice is the\nforward march towards discovery of the Self, necessitating yama, niyama, asana\nand pranayama. The involutionary path of renunciation necessitates pratyahara,\ndharana, dhyana and samadhi. This inward journey disengages the consciousness\nfrom external objects. To be proficient in yoga, yama and niyama must be observed\ncarefully all through the yogic sadhana. This is abhyasa. The casting away of\nideas and actions which obstruct progress in sadhana is named vairagya. As it\nis known, consciousness becomes involved with the objects perceived, and\nidentifies with them, taking the seer with it. Then the seer becomes subordinate\nto the vacillating mind. . Vairagya is a practice through which the sadhaka\nlearns to be liberated from desires and passions and to encourage\nnon-attachment to things, which holds back his pursuit of union with the soul.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.13 - -tatra sthitau\nyatno abhyasah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Practice is the\nunfaltering effort to still these fluctuations.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Practice is the effort\nto quieten the fluctuations in the consciousness and then to move towards\nsilencing it - to accomplish a constant, balanced, tranquil state of mind. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to free the mind from fluctuations\nand vacillations and to reach a state of stability, the sadhaka is advised to\nintensely practise all the yogic principles, from yama to dhyana. These\nencompass every discipline - moral, ethical, physical, mental, intellectual and\nspiritual. Being in the zone is a state of mind\u2014where you are free of thinking\nand negative emotions. Such people are beyond the boundaries of human ego, and\nfeel that they are part of something larger, where the laws of the physical\nworld cease to exist, transcending the condition of being human. All trust\ntheir instincts and intuition to do the right thing at the right time, without\nreasoning or analysing. The game comes to you and not you going to the game. Arjun\nsaw only the eye of the fish, at Draupadi swayamvar \u2014at that time the activity\nin the neocortex ceases and there is no thinking. The cerebellum takes over at\nthat point. When the frontal lobe is activated you have focus, clarity,\ndecisiveness, concentration, pro activeness and individuality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.14 - -sa tu\ndirghakalanairantaryasatkarasevito dridha-bhoomih</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Long, uninterrupted,\nalert practice is the firm establishment for restraining the fluctuations.</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Restraint does not come\nin one day, but by long continued&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">practice.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insightful wisdom is\nacquired through unfaltering, dedicated, attentive practice, and non-attachment\nthrough applied restraint. However, success may bloat the sadhak's ego, and he\nshould be careful not to become a victim of intellectual pride, which may drag\nhim away from enlightenment. He must use his own discrimination, so that\nhumility replaces pride and spiritual wisdom dawns. Knowing how to be in the\nflow, gives athletes the winning edge. Sports psychology is all about knowing\nhow to trigger this state. You know what has to be done, and you are doing it.\nYou are engaged by the challenge , but NOT overwhelmed. You find a good match\nbetween the demands of the situation and your own innate ability.</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.15 - - drishtanushravikavishayavitrishnnasy\nvashikara samjna vairagyam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Desirelessness towards\nthe seen and the unseen gives the consciousness of mastery.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A bird cannot fly with\none wing. &nbsp;It requires two wings to fly. To reach the highest spiritual goal,\nthe two wings of yoga, abhyasa ( practice ) and vairagya (dispassion ) are\nmandatory. Non-attachment and detachment must be learned through willpower. They\nconsist of learning to be free from yearnings - not only for worldly, but also\nheavenly pleasures. Citta is taught to stay impassive towards thoughts of\ncraving and passion, and to remain in a state of pure consciousness, free of\nall objects and free even from the qualities of sattva, rajas and lamas. The\nmind is regarded by the sages as the 11th sense. The eyes, ears, nose, tongue\nand skin are the five senses of perception. Arms, legs, mouth, reproductive and\nexcretory organs are the five organs of action. These are the external senses;\nmind is an internal sense organ. There are five stages in vairagya - 1.Releasing\nthe senses from enjoyment of their objects, and controlling them, is yatamana.\nAs it is not possible to control all the senses at a time, one should endeavour\nto control them one by one to attain domination over them all. 2.By thoughtful\ncontrol, one burns away the desires which blocks citta's movement towards the\nsoul. This is vyatireka. 3.When the five senses of perception and five organs\nof action have been detached away from contact with objects, the faintest\ndesires remain in a causal state and are felt only in the mind - this is known\nas ekendriya. The mind wants to play a dual role - to satisfy the desires of\nthe senses, and also to experience Self-Realisation. Once the senses have been\nstilled, the mind moves with one-pointed effort towards Soul Realisation. 4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Vasikara is achieved when one has gotten\nover all hungrinesses, and has developed stolidity to all types of attachment,\nnon-attachment and detachment. All eleven senses have been subdued. 5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; From these develops paravairagya, the\nhighest form of renunciation - it is free from the qualities of sattva, rajas\nand lamas. On coming upon this state, the sadhaka ceases to be concerned with\nhimself, or with others who remain caught in the entanglement of pleasures. Often\none comes across renounced people who get caught in the pleasures and comforts\nof life and neglect their sadhana. One should learn from such examples and\nguard themselves, so that one develops firmness in one's own sadhana. We\nobserve that the mind runs toward the objects of its attachment, toward the\ndirection it has been habituated to running in the past. The elimination of\nattachment eradicates the unnecessary wanderings of the mind. The things that\nused to afford you delight before give you displeasure now. That is a sign of\nVairagya. As soon as Vairagya arises in the mind, it opens the gate of Divine\nWisdom. No true and lasting satisfaction comes from the enjoyment of worldly\npleasures. Yet, people rush headlong towards objects, even when they know full\nwell that the objects they are trying to seize are unreal and that the world in\nwhich they live is fraught with miseries of all sorts. This is Maya. When the\nmind rests in Atma then the only Nitya-Tripti, or eternal satisfaction comes. Attachment\nis the first child of Maya. The whole Lila of brahmAn Lord is being kept up by\nthe force of attachment only. Vairagya does not mean abandoning social duties\nand responsibilities of life. It does not mean detachment from the world. It\ndoes not mean a life in &nbsp;solitary caves. That\nman who has perfect mental detachment while remaining in the world is a hero\nindeed. A dispassionate man has a different mind altogether. He identifies\nhimself every moment of his life with the witnessing consciousness that is\npresent in pleasure and in pain, in joy and in sorrow, in censure and in\npraise, in honour and in dishonour, in all states of life. He stands adamantine\nas a peak amid a turbulent storm, as a spectator of this wonderful world show.\nHe is not a bit affected by these pleasant and painful experiences. He learns\nseveral valuable lessons from them. He has, in other words, no attraction for\npleasant objects and repulsion for painful ones. Nor is he afraid of pain. He\nknows quite well that pain helps a lot in his spiritual progress and evolution,\nin his long journey towards the Goal. He stands convinced that pain is the best\nteacher in the world. If you develop keen Vairagya, if you subdue your senses,\nand shun all enjoyments and pleasures of this worthless world, mixed as they\nare with pain, sin, fear, craving, miseries, disease, old age and death then\nnothing can really tempt you in this world. You will become proof against all\ntemptations. You will have eternal peace, and infinite joy. You have no use for\nlust. Abhy\u0101s means practice, or a concerted and persistent effort to change an\nold habit or develop a new one. The term vair\u0101gya appears three times in the\nBhagavad Gita (6.35, 13.8, 18.52) where it is recommended as a key means for\nbringing control to the restless mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u094d\u0930\u0940\u092d\u0917\u0935\u093e\u0928\u0941\u0935\u093e\u091a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n|<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0938\u0902\u0936\u092f\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u0939\u093e\u092c\u093e\u0939\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u0928\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0926\u0941\u0930\u094d\u0928\u093f\u0917\u094d\u0930\u0939\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091a\u0932\u092e\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n|<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u092d\u094d\u092f\u093e\u0938\u0947\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0941</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u094c\u0928\u094d\u0924\u0947\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u0948\u0930\u093e\u0917\u094d\u092f\u0947\u0923</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0917\u0943\u0939\u094d\u092f\u0924\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n|| 35||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u015bhr\u012b bhagav\u0101n uv\u0101cha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">asan\u015bhaya\u1e41 mah\u0101-b\u0101ho\nmano durnigraha\u1e41 chalam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">abhy\u0101sena tu kaunteya\nvair\u0101gye\u1e47a cha g\u1e5bihyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 6.35: Lord Krishna\nsaid: O mighty-armed son of Kunti, what you say is correct; the mind is indeed\nvery difficult to restrain. But by practice and detachment, it can be\ncontrolled.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.16--tatparan\npurushakhyatergunnavaitrishnyam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The ultimate\nrenunciation is when one transcends the qualities of nature and perceives the\nsoul.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole of nature consists\nof three qualities; one is called Tamas, another Rajas and the third Sattva.\nThese three qualities manifest themselves in the physical world as attraction /\ncreation, repulsion / destruction , and control/ mediation ( done by Brahma/\nVishnu/ Shiva ) . Everything that is in nature, all these manifestations, are\ncombinations and recombinations of these three forces. This is the bedrock of\nDvaita Vedanta\u2014dance of opposites controlled by a mediator ( preserver ) . If\nthrough abhyasa one can activate and purify one's energy, through vairagya one\ncan disinvolve oneself from involvement in even the subtlest manifestations of\nthe phenomenal world. The creation of energy alone, without control or\nrestraint, cannot lead to freedom. Here, one sees the unfolding of nature from\nits noumenal (alihga) state into the lihga state, through mahat; then from the\nnon-specific (aviiesa) phenomena, including ahamkara, ego or 'I-consciousness'\nto the manifest (visesa) expressions of nature, which forms the foundation of\none's experience of everyday reality. The reverse or involutionary process,\nwhich is the path of yoga, can be seen as the ascension of a ladder. Abhyasa\nfurnishes one the necessary impulse for the rise; by vairagya one draws up the\nladder behind them. When that mental desire has faded away, years later, the\nbody cells may spontaneously rekindle attachment. This sutra relates to the\nultimate freedom achieved through paravairagya - here phenomenal nature ceases\nto exist, as the gunas are transcended, drawn back into their noumenal root. By\ntranscending the gunas, one unlocks that which binds one to nature. When this\nis achieved in all the involvements, the soul is fully perceived. The\nconsciousness has now, by the power of wisdom, gained everything that had to be\nacquired, and tossed away everything that had to be discarded. The sadhaka is\nliberated from all bondage; there is no feeling of birth and death. Kaivalya is\naccomplished. This is the effect of the twin disciplines of abhyasa and\nvairagya, through which the sadhaka turns wise and free, untarnished by the\ninfluence of citta. Prasahkhyana, means 'highest knowledge', purusakhyati,\nmeans 'perception of the soul'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.17\u2014vitarkavicharanandasmitaroopanugamat\nSanprajnatah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Cognitive meditation is\naccompanied by reasoning, discrimination, bliss and the sense of 'I am.'</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Four types of awareness\ndevelop through practice and detachment.&nbsp;\nAbsorption of the consciousness, achieved through engrossment in\nconjecture, inference and analytical study; synthesis, consideration and\ndiscrimination; bliss or elation; and a state of pure being, make up\nsamprajnata samadhi. &nbsp;Samprajnata samadhi\nconsists of vitarka, engrossment in analysis, vicar - engrossment in reasoning,\nananda - experiencing a state of bliss, and asmita - experiencing the state of\n'I'. Vitarka is an act of involvement by calculated thinking and study, which\nleads to the ultimate point or root cause. It is an attempt to differentiate\nthe cause from the effect, a process of astute experimental research from the\ngross to the subtle. Intellectual analysis, vitarka samprajnataIt is further\ndivided into deliberation, savitarka and non-deliberation, nirvitarka. Vicara\nstands for differentiating knowledge. It is a process of investigation,\nreflection and consideration through which the straying conjectural brain is\nsilenced and the sadhaka develops mental depth, acuteness, refinement and\nsubtlety. Vicara too is sub-divided into reasoning, savicara and non-reasoning,\nnirvicara. As the growing body of experience conveys maturity, fulfilment is\nreached and a state of ecstasy, ananda, results, liberating the sadhaka from\nthe mechanism of study, investigation and fulfilment and leading him to dwell\nin the self alone. This state is called asmita riipa samprajnata samadhi.\nTherefore, all six gradations of sabija samadhi (samadhi with support or seed)\n- savitarka, nirvitarka, savicara, nirvicara, ananda and asmita - are\nexplained. There is a 7th stage of samadhi, virama pratyaya, so called\nasamprajhdta samadhi, and an 8th, called dharma megha or nirbija samadhi. As\nexternal objects are vulnerable to change, deliberation might not be pure. One\nshould go from the fringe to the source. Vicara is beyond vitarka, ananda is\nbeyond vitarka and vicara, and asmita is beyond vitarka, vicara and ananda.\nThis is the steady progress from the gross body towards the subtle mind, and\nfrom the subtle mind towards the source, the nucleus of being. Savitarka and\nnirvitarka samadhi belong to the function of the brain, and are achieved by\nrumination on gross elements and objects cognisable through the senses.\nSavicara and nirvicara samadhi belong to the territory of the mind and are\nachieved by contemplation of subtle elements, and ananda belongs to the\nterritory of mature intelligence. Ananda must be assigned not to the senses,\nbut to pure wisdom. Contemplation by the self of the self helps shed ego.. It\nis assumed that the front of the brain is the analytical part (savitarka),\nwhile the back of the brain is the old, reasoning area (savicara). The base of\nthe brain is the seat of ananda, and the crown of the head of the individual\nself, asmita. Sabija samadhi is accomplished by drawing these four facets of\nthe brain towards its stem. When this synchronisation has been attained, a\npassing state of quietness, manolaya, is experienced. Then, from the stem of\nthe brain, consciousness is made to fall towards the source mind, the seat of\nthe heart. Here it unites into a mindless, beginningless, endless state of\nbeing - amanas-katva, or nirbija samadhi (samadhi without seed or support). It\nis the conquest of the spirit. In between sabija and nirbija samadhis,\nPatanjali traces an intervening state, virama pratyaya, which others call\nasamprajnata samadhi. It is a spiritual plateau (manolaya), a passing state or\na resting place before one dives into nirbija samadhi. Through practice and\nrenunciation each and every part of human - the skin, the cells, the breath,\nthe motions of thought, intelligence and reason become acquainted with the\nself. This is known as samprajnata samadhi. The sadhaka's intelligence spreads\nequally within and around his body, similar to the surface of a lake without\nripples. Then he perceives things clearly. In this samprajnata samadhi or\ncontemplation, the disparity between the seer and the seen stays on. For\ninstance, the performance of an asana, or movements of breath pranayama at the\noutset, these are done at a physical level. As understanding intensifies, the\nbody is imbued internally, its movements are connected with the intelligence,\nand the asana is apprehended as a single unit for all directions - front to\nback, top to bottom, side to side. It is absorbed and withheld by the body's\nintelligence for the soul to perceive. One learns that one's body is the bow,\nthe asana is the arrow, and the target is the soul. When the asana is\nperfected, the target is hit - the field and the knower of the field are\nunified. The logic and reasoning of the asana are gratified, the sadhaka,\nhaving lost the consciousness of the asana and of his body, is one with\nhimself. His asana, his breath, his effort and his very being are one with the\nmillions of cells in his body. He has accomplished sasmita - the auspicious\nstate of asmita. Patanjali generally addresses at several levels at once,\ntherefore it is not unreasonable to explain vitarka, vicara, ananda and asmita\nin relation to asana. &nbsp;As one's asanas\nmature, he or she reaches a stage when skin-consciousness proceeds towards the\ncentre of being, and the centre radiates towards the fringe. Movement is both\ncentripetal and centrifugal. This integrity fetches bliss - ananda. Eventually,\nwhen the conscious mechanism by which one considers and performs asana comes to\nan end, the process reaches a resting point. The asana then rests only in the\ninner self which is in poise - the only support is asmita. This Samadhi is divided\ninto two varieties. One is called the&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samprajnata, and the\nother the Asamprajnata. The Samprajnata is of four varieites. In this Samadhi\ncome all the powers of controlling nature. The first variety is called the Savitarka,\nwhen the mind meditates upon an object again and again, by isolating it from\nother objects. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Knowledge is power, and\nas soon as we begin to know a thing we get power over it; so also, when the\nmind begins to meditate on the different elements it gains power over them.\nThat sort of meditation where the external gross elements are the objects is\ncalled Savitarka. Tarka means question, Savitarka with-question. , in the very\nsame meditation, when one struggles to take the elements out of time and space,\nand think of them as they are, it is called Nirvitarka, without-question. When the\nmeditation goes a step higher, and takes the Tanmatras as its object, and\nthinks of them as in time and space, it is called Savichara,\nwith-discrimination, and when the same meditation gets beyond time and space,\nand thinks of the fine elements as they are, it is called Nirvichara, without-discrimination.\nThe next step is when the elements are given up, either as gross or as fine,\nand the object of meditation is the interior organ, the thinking organ, and\nwhen the thinking organ is thought of as bereft of the qualities of activity,\nand of dullness, it is then called Sanandam, the blissful Samadhi. In that\nSamadhi, when we are thinking of the mind as the object of meditation, before\nwe have reached the state which takes us beyond the mind even, when it has become\nvery ripe and concentrated, when all ideas of the gross materials, or fine\nmaterials, have been given up, and the only object is the mind as it is, when\nthe Sattva state only of the Ego remains, but differentiated from all other\nobjects, this is called Asmita Samadhi, and the man who has attained to this\nhas attained to what is called in the Vedas \u201cbereft of body.\u201d He can think of\nhimself as without his gross body; but he will have to think of himself as with\na fine body.
