Those that in this state get merged in nature without attaining\nthe goal are called Prakrtilayas, but those who do not even stop at any enjoyments,\nreach the goal, which is freedom.The higher spiritual knowledge of super\nconsciousness is manifested by:\u2022</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Revelation, Recognition, Reflection, Realization. Samadhi is super\nconscious state - an eighth limb of Asthanga Yoga system of epistemology as the\nfinal destination- appears to have multiple stages in progression like:</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Savitarka,</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirvitarka,</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Savikalpa,</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirvikalpa and eventually Sahaja state. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Merging in Reality and remaining unaware of\nthe world is Nirvikalpa Samadhi ( Nirbija Samadhi).. (The mind is alive but\nmerged in light, like a bucket with rope lowered into a well that can be drawn\nout again).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Raja Yoga, nirvikalpa\nsamadhi is a synonym for Asamprajnata Samadhi, the highest stage of samadhi.\nNirvikalpa sam\u0101dhi, absorption without self-consciousness, is a mergence of the\nmental activity (cittav\u1e5btti) in the Self, to such a degree, or in such a way,\nthat the distinction (vikalpa) of knower, act of knowing, and object known\nbecomes dissolved \u2014 as waves vanish in water, and as foam vanishes into the\nsea.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without seeds or Samskaras -all\nthe seeds or impressions are burnt by the fire of knowledge--all the Samskaras\nand Vasanas which bring on rebirths are totally freed up. All Vrittis or mental\nmodifications that arise from the mind-lake come under restraint. The five\nafflictions, viz., Avidya (ignorance), Asmita (egoism), Raga-dvesha (love and\nhatred) and Abhinivesha (clinging to life) are destroyed and the bonds of Karma\nare annihilated . It gives Moksha (deliverance from the wheel of births and\ndeaths). With the advent of the knowledge of the Self, ignorance vanishes. With\nthe disappearance of the root-cause, viz., ignorance, egoism, etc., also\ndisappear. When you enter into nirvikalpa samadhi, the first thing you feel is\nthat your heart is larger than the universe itself. Ordinarily you see the\nworld around you, and the universe seems infinitely larger than you are. But\nthis is because the world and the universe are perceived by the limited mind.\nWhen you are in nirvikalpa samadhi, you see the universe as a tiny dot inside\nyour vast heart. In nirvikalpa samadhi there is infinite bliss. Nirvikalpa\nsamadhi is the highest samadhi . One cannot operate in the world while in that\nstate of consciousness. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirvikalpa\nSamadhi is the culmination of all practices that are Spiritual. Nirvikalpa\nSamadhi is the perfect flowering of a Human Being. After attaining the state of\nNirvikalpa Samadhi, one can disseminate the Cosmic wisdom to one and all. One\nbecomes the authorized representative of BrahmAn (the Creator) on Earth. Truth\nand only truth is what you hear from such a learned one. In the stage of\nNirvikalpa Samadhi one feels so nearer to God the Creator ... all else becomes\nsecondary and loses meaning. Some may be willing to part with whatever they\nhave ... All that for a darshan (glimpse) of brahmAn. Nirvikalpa means\n\"free from all sorts of modifications and imaginations.\" The mind\ncompletely melts in Brahman. In Nirvikalpa samadhi there is no thought, no\nidea, nothing whatsoever. All is tranquility, or you can say tranquillity\u2019s\nflood. Here nature\u2019s dance comes to an end. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It lasts a few days, and then one has to come\ndown. When one comes down,</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">one forgets\nhis own name ... Remaining in the primal, pure natural state without effort is\nSahaja Nirvikalpa Samadhi.( the mind is dead , resolved into the Self, like a\nriver discharged into the ocean - its identity lost - and which can never be\nre-directed from the ocean, once discharged into it). When Alexander the Great\ncame to India . his soldiers were totally psyched to see sages in deep states\nof Samadi, with cobras clambering all over them attracted by the vibes. The\nbattle was lost there itself.</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.18-- viramapratyayabhyasapoorvah\nsanskarashesho anyah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">There is another\nmeditation which is attained by the practice of alert mental suspension until\nonly subtle impressions remain.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali suggests\nanother state of samadhi in between sabija samadhi and nirbija samadhi, but\ndoes not name it. It is experienced with the termination of all functions of\nthe brain, leaving behind only the residual merits, or samskaras, of good\npractices. In this state one is liberated from passions, wants and appetites. The\nword used for this state is 'virama pratyaya'. In it, the sadhaka rests in a\nhighly evolved state in which the intelligence is silent. The moment one loses\nthe feeling of 'I', one is in this state of virama pratyaya, which is neither\nnegative nor positive. It is a state of suspended animation in the\nconsciousness. Patanjali refers to this state as a different type of samadhi\n(anyah). It is not deliberate but natural. In deliberate or samprajnata\nsamadhi, the intelligence dissolves, but the sense of self stays on. The\nsamskaras of good practices remain and all other fluctuations terminate. This\nstate becomes a plateau, from which the aspirer may climb further up the spiritual\nladder. As it is only a passing state, one must take care that stagnation does\nnot set in - it should not be taken as the ultimate. One should then, in fact,\nstep up one's sadhana to attain the state of the absolute, nirbija samadhi. Those\nwho remain in virama pratyaya not only conquer the elements of nature, but\nmerge in them, while others live without a physical body .You can remain in\nthat state for a long period without the awareness of their bodies, but emerged\nlater to reach nirbija samadhi. Such sadhakas are called prakrtilayas (laya =\nmerged in nature) or videhins (existing without a body). Virama pratyaya is a\nperilous state. It may bind the sadhaka forever, or it may uplift him.\nPatanjali advises in that those who have reached virama pratyaya should not\nstop there, but should escalate their efforts with faith and courage, memory\nand contemplative awareness. This is the perfect superconscious Asamprajnata\nSamadhi, the state which gives us freedom. It is very difficult to attain,\nalthough its method seems very easy. Its method is to hold the mind as the\nobject, and whenever through comes, to strike it down, allowing no thought to\ncome into the mind, thus making it an entire vacuum. When we can really do\nthis, in that moment we shall attain liberation. . When this state, Asamprajnata,\nsuper-consciousness, is reached, the Samadhi becomes seedlessIn that sort of concentration\nwhen there is consciousness, where the mind has succeeded only in quelling the\nwaves in the Chitta and holding them down, they are still there in the form of tendencies,\nand these tendencies (or seeds) will become waves again, when the time comes.\nBut when you have destroyed all these tendencies, almost destroyed the mind, then\nit has become seedless, there are no more seeds in the mind out of which to\nmanufacture again and again this plant of life, this ceaseless round of birth\nand death. Asamprajnata Samadhi brings Kaivalya (liberation )- the mind is&nbsp; perfectly steady. All Samskaras are fried up.\nThere is perfect awareness. This is a stage where a Yogi gets the highest\nknowledge. There is Prajna or pure consciousness. This is the state like ocean\nwithout waves. When there is Ekagrata, Samprajnata Samadhi is possible.\nAsamprajnata Samadhi is possible when there is perfect Nirodha of mind. Para\nVairagya brings complete rest to the mind. All Vrittis stop. In Samprajnata\nSamadhi there is only a partial inhibition of mental functions. Asamprajnata\nSamadhi destroys the impressions of all antecedent mental functions, and even\ngoes so far as to tide over even Prarabdha. A Yogi has no Prarabdha at all. The\nmind having no object to grasp, becomes as it were, non-existent. This is\nNirbija or Niralambana Samadhi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; line-height: 24px;\">1.19\u2014 bhavapratyayo videhaprakritilayanam</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><i>In this state, one may experience bodilessness, or become merged in unitive consciousness</i></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">In this samadhi, which is balanced between labija and nirbija samadhi, the sadhaka is liberated from all fluctuations, but subliminal impressions, samskaras, bounce to life the moment he comes out of that state. &nbsp;Some evolved entities become absorbed in the elements of nature. Caught in the mesh of bodiless feeling, or unifying in nature, they forget to climb to the topmost rung of the spiritual ladder, and fail to reach nirbija samadhi. The sadhaka, having reached a state of isolation but not emancipation, must come out of it if he does not wish to lose the path of kaivalya. One whose soul moves without a body is a videhin.. Levitation is NOT about the human body floating up, but an out of body flight experience. This experience is the conquering of the principles or tattvas of nature - prakrtijaya. The turiya consciousness is the transcendental Reality. It is not a form of Samadhi in the accurate sense of the term. When an individual soul establishes permanent and constant union with Supreme Being, we say that he is enjoying the Turiya consciousness. Here the seeker reaches the absolute height of evolution. The soul now has the highest frequency of brahmAn, the mother field. &nbsp;Patanjali defines sleep as a state in which all thoughts and feelings are temporarily suspended, and the senses, mind, intellect and consciousness rest in the being. In dreamless sleep, there is absence of everything. If an average person, when awake, recalls the state of dreamless sleep, he glimpses a non-physical state of existence (videha) and also the state of unifying with nature (prakrtilaya).. Sleep is a natural condition of consciousness; samadhi is a super-conscious state. In deep sleep one is dead to world but Samadhi one has added dimension of being awakened to Brahman while being metaphorically dead to world. If deep sleep is undifferentiated darkness then Samadhi is undifferentiated illumination. In sleep, everything is inert, tamasic; in samadhi everything is luminous, untainted by the gunas.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.20\u2014shraddhaviryasmritisamadhiprajnapoorvaka itaresham</span><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\">For others, clarity is preceded by faith, energy, memory and\ndiscrimination of the real.</span></i><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nHighly evolved souls have the power to differentiate between\nisolation and emancipation. They are neither elated by their conquest of the\nelements, nor delighted at their ability to move unreservedly without their\nbodies. Sraddha should not be understood just as faith. It also expresses\nmental and intellectual firmness. (The next word, virya, stands for gallantry\nand power, in the sense of physical and nervine strength.) Interestingly,\nPatanjali's first use of the word sraddha is unambiguous, in order to encourage\nthe sadhaka to step up his sadhana in order to reach the highest goal. The natural\ntrust of the aspirer is confirmed by revelation and transformed into the faith,\nwhich imbues the consciousness of practicians in any field of art, science and\nphilosophy. If trust is instinctive, faith is intuitional.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.21\u2014 tivrasanveganam\naasannah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Success is speeded for\nthe extremely energetic and intense in practice.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samadhi is within his\nbounds, who is honest and pure at heart, enthusiastic, intense and tremendously\nenergetic. He quickly reaches the highest goal of yoga, assisted also by his\nresidual compiled virtues. However, sometimes even an ardent aspirer may become\nmild or average, slow or moderate, in his practice. In the Siva Samhita,\nchapter v. 16, aspirers are categorised as feeble (mrdu), moderate (madhyama),\nsharp in understanding and vigorous (adhimatra), and possessing massive energy\nand supreme enthusiasm (adhimatratama). The last, the highest, is alone able to\ncross beyond the ocean of the manifest world<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.22\u2014</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">mridumadhyadhimatratvat\ntatopi visheshah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">There is further\ndistinction on account of the mild, moderate or intense means employed.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sadhakas are of\ndifferent levels of eagerness and intensity. For them, the goal is time-bound,\ndepending upon their level. These types can be further sub-divided. For\ninstance, a keen sadhaka can be feebly, moderately or intensely keen. Similar\nsubdivisions can be made of the average and faint kinds. The goal of yoga is\nnear or far, depending upon one's eagerness and one's efforts. There are nine\ntypes of yogis who are highly evolved and whose parameters of intelligence are\nfar beyond ordinary human standards. They are of an ascending order of\nintensity. Paravairagya (supreme detachment) is for those who are clear of head\nand pure of heart, valiant and extremely energetic (adhimatrataman or uvra\nsamvegin). For these, the goal is imminent; for others, it is time-bound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.23\u2014 eeshvarapranidhanad\nva</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Or, the citta may be\ncontrolled by profound meditation upon God and total surrender to Him.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To contemplate on God,\nto give up one's self to Him, is to bring everything face to face with God.\nPranidhana is the giving up of everything - one's ego, all good and virtuous\nactions, pains and pleasures, joys and sorrows, elations and depressions to the\nUniversal Soul. By giving up the aspirer's ego is obliterated, and the grace of\nthe Lord pours down upon him like torrential rain. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Devotion toward God, solely motivated by the\nsincere, loving desire to please God, by following the laws of the universe ,\nrather than the hope of divine reward or the fear of divine punishment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bhagavata Purana\nteaches nine primary forms of bhakti, as explained by Prahlada:&nbsp; (1) \u015brava\u1e47a (\"listening\" to the\nscriptural stories of Krishna and his companions), (2) k\u012brtana\n(\"praising\"; this usually refers to ecstatic group singing), (3)\nvisnoh smara\u1e47a (\"remembering\" or fixing the mind on Vishnu), (4)\np\u0101da-sevana (rendering service), (5) arcana (worshiping an image), (6) vandana\n(paying homage), (7) d\u0101sya (servitude), (8) s\u0101khya (friendship), and (9)\n\u0101tma-nivedana (complete surrender of the self). (From Bhagavata Purana,\n7.5.23-24.) The profound worship based on the high ideals of philosophy and\nspirituality, prompted by divine love. The Bhagavad Gita stresses that love and\ninnocent pure intentions are the most powerful motive forces in a devotee's\nspiritual life. Through prayer, worship and ritual he surrenders himself to\nGod, channelling and transmuting his emotions into unconditional love or\ndevotion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.24\u2014</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">kleshakarmavipakashayairaparamrishtah\npurushavishesh eeshvarah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">God is the Supreme\nBeing, totally liberated from conflicts, unaffected by afflictions, actions and\nuntouched by cause and effect.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God is an exceptional,\nunequalled Entity (purusa), who is eternally free from afflictions and unmoved\nby actions and their reactions, or by their residual. &nbsp;&nbsp;Isvara is the Supreme Soul, the Lord of all\nand master of everything. He is unswayed by klesas (afflictions), insensible to\nthe fruits of actions, abiding undisturbed in His own Being. He is\neverlastingly free and always supreme. &nbsp;&nbsp;Human\nbeings experience twinge before attaining emancipation, but God is always\nunmoved by pain and pleasure, sorrow and joy, melancholy and elation. God is\never free, but man has to wash off all his subliminal impressions before\nactualising freedom. &nbsp;There is a\ndisparity between purusa (individual soul) and purusa visesa (Universal Soul).\nAs God is discretely dissimilar from the individual soul, He is called Isvara. According\nto the Vedas, Isvara is the Creator of the universe. Seeing that the universe is\nharmonious, it must be the manifestation of one will.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.25 - - tatra\nniratishayan sarvajntvabijam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;In God, the seed of omniscience is\nunsurpassed.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Knowledge is only a\ngerm in man, but you will have to think of infinite knowledge around it, so\nthat the very nature of your constitution shows us that there is unlimited knowledge,\nand the Yogis call that unlimited knowledge God.&nbsp; In Him rests the unparalleled, unmatchable\nsource of all knowledge. He is the core of omniscience, omnipresence and\nomnipotence. In God abides all creation. He is eternal and one. He is Himself\nthe seed of all knowledge, the seed of omniscience, while the yogi achieves\ninfinite knowledge, but not the seed of that knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.26 - - sa poorvesham\napi guruh kalenanavachchhedat</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">God is the first,\nforemost and absolute guru, unconditioned by time.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although the capacity to\nknow is inside us, it must be called out, and that calling out of knowledge can\nonly be got, a Yogi maintains, through another knowledge. Dead, insentient\nmatter, never calls out knowledge. God is the Teacher of all teachers, because these\nteachers, however great they may have been\u2014gods or angels\u2014were all bound and\nlimited by time, and God is not limited by time.. The very fact thatman has a\nlittle knowledge, shows that God has unlimited knowledge. There is something in\nman which evolves out of him; all knowledge is in man, but certain environments\nare necessary to call it out. &nbsp;This\nspiritual Purusa, the Supreme Spirit, is the first and foremost teacher,\nneither bound nor conditioned by place, space or time. He is all and all is He.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.27 - - Tasya vacakah\npranavah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">He is represented by\nthe sacred syllable aum, called pranava.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BrahmAn is represented\nin OM. OM is a sanctified King mantra- called pranava, which signifies\neulogising the divine and accomplishment of divinity. The sign of OM is the\nsign of Hinduism. OM is the first and foremost of all mantras. Mantra is the\nsound body of consciousness. OM is considered as the sound of Cosmic Energy and\ncontains all the sounds in itself. &nbsp;As\nper the Vedas OM is the sound of light. The impersonal essence and source of\nall being is known as hiranya garbha (golden womb). It is also known as\nBrahman, who is inside each heart. . The spiritual efficacy of Om is heard, not\nby the ears but by the heart . OM surcharges the innermost being of man with\nvibrations of the highest reality. The human ear can discern only a very narrow\nband between 20 Hz to 20000 Hz. The rest in inaudible. This is why NO cosmic\nsound can be heard by the human ear. These cosmic sounds were heard by rishis\nin their spiritual trances which broadened their sense spectrums. However our\nbrain can register the vibrations. Diviners use OM resonance to find water in\narid areas. the spiritual efficacy of OM is NOT on the gross sound, but on the\nsubtle sound which is heard by the heart and uttered by the mind. Uttering of\nOm is identifying oneself with the cosmic resonance the efficacy of the mantric\npower of Om emanates not only from its sound vibrations, but also from the\ninner attitude of the speaker-- his spiritual purity and his freedom from\nworldliness. &nbsp;The earth vibrates at 7.83\nHz and so does OM. The primordal vibrations of atoms and molecules is thus\nrepresented by OM .Chanting OM produces a sonorous vibration like the buzz of a\nmighty transformer. The vibrations produce scalar waves which calms the mind. The\nMMMM humming boosts the production of magic molecule Nitric oxide in the body. Chanting\nOM stimulated your Vagus nerve which releases anti-ageing neuro-trasnsmitters..\nIt helps regenerate your organs and cells by activating stem cells. &nbsp;This was known to Indians and documented 7000\nyears ago. Every mantra starts and ends with OM. OM opens up quantum tunneling,\nwhere the wormholes do NOT have a restriction of speed of light. Chanting OM\nraises your vibration to a higher consciousness, and it clears the channel for\nintuition. Resonances of earth, ie, 7.83, 14, 20, 26, 33, 39 and 45 Hertz of earth.\n7.83 hz being the strongest of all, OM or Schumann frequency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.28 - - tajjapastadarthabhavanam</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The mantra aum is to be\nrepeated constantly, with feeling, realising its full significance.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Constant, venerating\nrepetition of the pranava aum, with reflection on its meaning and the feeling\nit arouses, helps the seer to reach the highest state in yoga. Efficacy of OM\nis in the unheard longitudinal wave ( 7.83 hertz ) which affects the heart\nchakra.&nbsp; Words, meaning and feeling are\ninterwoven. The mantra aim\nis considered the Sabda Brahman (Word of God, or Universal Sound) to be known\nwith the organs of perception and action, mind, intelligence and consciousness.&nbsp; OM is derived from the Sri Yantra with a\nnumerical value of 108.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sri yantra is holographic, a\nshiva-shakti representation ,&nbsp; in that\nevery bit of it contains all of it.&nbsp; Sri\nYantra is the pictoral representation of OM.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, &nbsp;All Hindu rudraksha malas contain 108 beads.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"OM\nis this imperishable Word.&nbsp;&nbsp; OM is the\nuniverse, and this is the exposition OM.&nbsp;\nThe past, present and the future, all that was, all that is, all that\nwill be is OM.&nbsp; Likewise all else that\nmay exist&nbsp; beyond the bounds of time,\nthat, too, is OM.\"&nbsp; ( Verse 1-\nMandulya Upanishad 5000 BC ). How many of you have ever bothered to examine a\nbeehive.&nbsp; Can you believe that the\nperfect hexagon is created by OM ( 7.83 hertz harmonic )&nbsp; \u2014 just a SHABDA BRAHMAN vibration emitted by\nthe bees. Shabda Brahman ( sound ) is a great morphogenetic organizing force\nwithout which no matter can be formed.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a Shiva\u2019s damaru\nis vibrated, it produces dissimilar sounds which are fused together by\nresonance to create one sound.&nbsp; Modern\nscience calls this BINAURAL beats.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sound thus produced\nsymbolizes Nada, the cosmic sound of AUM of 7.83 hertz&nbsp; which can be heard during deep\nmeditation.&nbsp;&nbsp; According to Hindu\nscriptures, Nada is the source of creation. The human range is on average from\n20 to 20,000 Hz. If 300 Hz is played in one ear and 306 hz is played in the\nother ear via stereo headphones the binaural frequency will be 6 hertz . &nbsp;7.83 Hz This is Schumann\u2019s resonance frequency\nor earth\u2019s heart beat or frequency of Hindu king mantra OM frequency - a sound\nwhich cannot be heard by the ears( unless it is a harmonic ) but can be heard\nby the heart.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the primordial throb of the universe.&nbsp; It is the sound form of Atma (Consciousness).\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;ms mincho&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2028</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">- Maitri Upanishad 5000\nBC.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM\nsurcharges the innermost being of man with vibrations of the highest reality.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nearth vibrates at 7.83 Hz and so does OM. OM is the first\nmantra in the 4 Vedas and the 108 Upanishads. OM is the first mantra and is the\nsound body of consciousness.&nbsp; OM contains\nall the sounds in itself. OM is the four states of consciousness, as per\nPatanjali Yoga:----.OM is the waking state or jagrat. Beta brain wave. &nbsp;OM is the dreaming state or svapna.&nbsp; REM sleep state. OM is the deep sleep state\nor sushupti. (dream-less deep sleep state , the delta brain wave). Om is the\ntranscendental state or turiya. (beyond all the states) , the fourth has been\ncalled nirvana.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Four stages:&nbsp; consciousness plus thinking is waking,\nconsciousness minus thinking is turiya, unconsciousness plus thinking is\ndreaming, unconsciousness minus thinking is sleep.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cOm\nityetadaksharam idam sarvam, tasyopavyakhyanam bhutam bhavat bhavishyaditi\nsarvam omkara eva.\u201d-&nbsp; Mandukya&nbsp; Upanishad -5000 BC.. \u201cThe Imperishable is OM,\nand it is 'all this'.&nbsp;&nbsp; All this,\nwhatever is visible, whatever is cognisable, whatever can come within the\npurview of sense-perception, inference or verbal testimony, whatever can be\ncomprehended under the single term, creation all this is OM.\u201d. A cosmic\ncreative vibration (called sphota or explosion) arises between Shiva and Shakti\ncalled Nada. This Nada then gets consolidated into Shabda Brahman\n(differentiated sound energy), the universal cosmic resonance, symbolized by\nOM.&nbsp;&nbsp; From this arises cosmic\nintelligence that is responsible for the creation.&nbsp; The Taithiriya Upanishad says that \"with\nOM, Brahma begins creation.\"&nbsp;&nbsp; It\nmeans the whole creation comes out of sound.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">unheard cosmic\nsounds, the symphony of Shabda-Brahman, was heard by the 12 stranded Vedic\nMaharishis in their spiritual trances and is enshrined in the Upanishads as the\nsyllable.&nbsp; OM is the quintessence, the\nseed-syllable of the universe.&nbsp; Mantra is\nthe sound-body of consciousness.&nbsp;&nbsp; Our\n7000 year old Vedas say that matter is created from vibrations.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If\nevery sound on this cosmos and planet earth were simultaneously recorded, there\nwould be only one single sound OM.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every second 200\nlightening strikes occur somewhere on earth in order to keep re establishing\nelectrical balance between the earth and the ionosphere.&nbsp; These lightening strikes energize the 'flute'\nand vibrate the resonating cavity.&nbsp; The\n'flute' vibrates waves that bounce off the ionosphere and then off the earth,\nback and forth. The resulting 'song' incorporates information from the\nionosphere which reflects the universe and information about everything that\noccurs on earth.&nbsp; Usually this 'music' is\ndescribed in terms of its beat or frequency.&nbsp;\nThe beat frequency is called the Schumann Resonance of 7.83 Hz ( OM ) .</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nspiritual efficacy of OM is based not on the gross sound, but on the subtle\nsound, which is heard, not by the ears but by the heart, which is uttered not\nby the mouth but by the mind.&nbsp; OM is the\nquintessence, the seed-syllable (bija mantra) of the universe, the universal\nforce of the all-embracing consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.29 - - tatah\npratyakchetanadhigamopyantarayabhavashch</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Meditation on God with\nthe repetition of aum removes obstacles to the mastery of the inner self.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first manifestation\nof this repetition and thinking of OM will be that the introspective power will\nbe manifested more and more, and all the mental and physical obstacles will\nbegin to vanish. The repetition of the pranava mantra with feeling and\nunderstanding of its meaning leads to the discovery of the Self, and helps\nremove hindrances to Self-Realisation. &nbsp;When\nexperience, the instruments of experience and the object experienced are\ninterwoven, the soul manifests itself without the interference of any\nhindrances. &nbsp;Constant, venerating\nrepetition of the pranava aum, with reflection on its meaning and the feeling\nit evokes, helps the seer to reach the highest state in yoga. You must know\nthat these thought were picked off the aakasha by seers .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1.30\u2014vyadhistyanasanshayapramadalasyaviratibhrantidar\nshanalabdhabhoomikatvanavasthitatvani chittavikshepastentarayah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Disease, inertia,\ndoubt, lack of enthusiasm, laziness, sensuality, mind-wandering, missing the\npoint. &nbsp;falling away from the state when\nobtained&nbsp; - these distractions of the\nmind are the obstacles.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This sutra delineates\nthe nine obstacles or deterrents, which hinders progress and deflects the\naspirer's consciousness. &nbsp;Unhealthy persons\ncannot be Yogis. Mental laziness makes us lose all lively interest in the\nsubject, without which there will neither be the will nor the energy to\npractice. Doubts will arise in the mind about the truth of the science, however\nstrong one\u2019s intellectual conviction may be, until certain peculiar psychic experiences\ncome, as hearing, or seeing, at a distance, etc. These glimpses strengthen the\nmind and make the student persevere. Falling away when attained. Some says or\nweeks when you are practising the mind will be calm and easily concentrated,\nand you will find yourself progressing fast. All of a sudden the progress will\nstop one day, and you will find yourself, as it were, stranded. Persevere. All\nprogress proceeds by rise and fall.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.31\u2014</span> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">duhkhadaurmanasyanggamejayatvashvasaprashvaa&nbsp; vikshepasahabhuvah</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sorrow, despair,\nunsteadiness of the body and irregular breathing further distracts the citta.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are four more\ncauses of distraction - sorrow, despair or evil disposition, tremble of the\nbody and irregular or laboured breathing ( &nbsp;hyperventilation taught by fake gurus ). &nbsp;These cause further distractions which excites\nthe mind and consciousness. These hindrances are of three kinds -\nself-inflicted (adhyatmika), imbalances of elements in the body (adhibhautika)\nand problems arising from fate, e.g. genetic defects (adhidaivika). They need\nto be fought and curbed through yogic disciplines. Concentration will bring\nperfect repose to mind and body every time it is practised. When the practice\nhas been misdirected, or not enough controlled, these disturbances come.\nRepetition of Om and self-surrender to the Lord will strengthen the mind, and\nbring fresh energy. The nervous shakings will come to almost everyone. Do not\nmind them at all, but keep on practising. Practice will cure them, and make the\nseat firm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; Gargi, the daughter of sage Vachaknu in the lineage\nof sage Garga (800-500 BCE. She had even awakened her Kundalini (indwelling\nspiritual energy). , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Kapi\u1e63\u1e6dhala-Ka\u1e6dha\nsa\u1e43hita-- of the southern Punjab and Bahika<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nwhite invader gave bull that Lord Rama\u2019s clan follows the Shukla Yajurveda\nbranch\u2014to DRIVE A WEDGE between Krishna/ Rama followers..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nVajasaneyi Samhita ( Shulka Yajurveda \u2013white ) has forty chapters or adhyayas,\ncontaining the formulas used with the following rituals:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">1.-2.:\nNew and Full Moon sacrifices<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">3.:\nAgnihotra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">4.-8.:\nSomayajna<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">9.-10.:\nVajapeya and Rajasuya, two modifications of the Soma sacrifice<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">11.-18.:\nconstruction of altars and hearths, especially the Agnicayana<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">19.-21.:\nSautramani, a ritual originally counteracting the effects of excessive\nSoma-drinking<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">22.-25.:\nAshvamedha ( poison injected with queens having sex with a dead horse\u2019s phallus\n)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">40.:\nthe final adhyaya is the famous Isha Upanishad.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nShukla Yajurveda has two branches: Vajasaneyi Madhyandiniya &amp; Vajasaneyi\nKanva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Vajasaneyi\nMadhyandiniya is originally of Mithila and Vajasaneyi Kanva is of originally\nKosala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot;
