font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html?showComment=1468572009492#c227478122381274838\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 15, 2016 at 2:10 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_21MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi pb,<br />\n<br />\nPandharpur festival Ashadhi Ekadashi is a festival created by Jew Rothschild using Chitpavan Jews for his FAKE and backdated gods Vittala, Vithobha, Panduranga<br />\n<br />\nThe main Pandharpur Warkari Yatra starts from the Sant Tukaram Temple at Dehu.<br />\n<br />\nTukaram is a FAKE and backdated creation of Jew Rothschild. Pandharpur Yatra takes place twice in a year one during Ashadhi Ekadasi (June - July) and another during Kartik Ekadasi (October -November).<br />\n<br />\nTukaram was touted as a saint who introduced Emperor Shivaji to RamDASA ...<br />\n<br />\nALL POEMS OF TUKARAM ARE COOKED UP BY CHITPAVAN JEWS NAY BRAHMINS<br />\n<br />\nThousands of 'warkaris', walk all the way from Alandi to Pandharpur while singing the devotional songs,'Bhajans, of Pandurang (Vithoba).<br />\n<br />\nThis is called as 'waari' which is a 21 days trek and culminates on the Ashadhi Ekadashi day at Pandharpur.<br />\n<br />\nTHESE ARE THE SAME PEOPLE WHO IMPALE THE EMPTY KALASH KUMBHAM UPSIDE DOWN<br />\n<br />\nAPCO MODI PROPAGATES THIS ON HIS WEBSITE\u2014THAT IS THE TYPE OF HINDU &nbsp;APCO MODI IS !! &nbsp;HE LOVES HINDUS BEFORE ELECTIONS !!!!<br />\n<br />\nCapt vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_22b+seed2JnD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_22b+seed2JnD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/SLAN44MRcNo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/SLAN44MRcNo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4000 years ago, in Adhyasa\nBhashya, Adi Shankaracharya pens down some of the finest philosophical though\nof Sanatana Dharma.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word Avidya is\nmentioned in Upanishads . Vidya is effective discrimination and avidya is the\nabsence of it. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Sankaracharya writes\nthat states wisdom (vidya) can eliminate ignorance (avidya); but the ignorance\nit eliminates is not real, because it has no existence of its own. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the veil is removed the Universe\n(Brahman) will reveal of its own accord.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankara explains, that&nbsp; darkness has no existence of its own; it is\nmerely the absence of light.&nbsp;&nbsp; Darkness\nand light can neither coexist nor share their functions or nature.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He writes in his\nprologue , that Upanishads provides the Knowledge(vidya) that will eliminate\ndarkness , ignorance(avidya) , which is in the nature of \u201creality transfer\u201d\n(adhyasa). &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankaracharya writes\nthat Adhyasa, &nbsp;is not an intellectual\nconstruct (kalpana_viseha) but a matter of experience (anubhava).&nbsp; Sankara says we do it all the time. Superimposition\nis the favourite theme of the Vedanta philosophy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adhyasa consists in mistaking one thing and\nits attributes for another; superimposing one level of reality over other. An\nindividual experiences the world through his senses, mind and other ways of\nperception.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His experience of the world may be tainted by the defect in his\nsenses or other constraints, internal or external. Nevertheless, that person\ncreates his own set of impressions and experiences and he accepts those\nsubjective experiences as real.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jiva is under\nself-hypnotism. He must dehypnotise himself by meditation to liberate himself. Adhyasa\nliterally means 'superimposition' in the sense of mistaken ascription or\nimputation to something of an essential nature or attribute not belonging to\nit. It is an apparent presentation of the attributes of one thing in another\nthing.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Sankara, Adhyasa is the apparent presentation in the form\nof remembrance to consciousness something previously observed in some other\nthing. This is illusory knowledge. Adhyasa, Bhranti, Adhyaropa, Kalpana are\nsynonymous terms.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shankara regards\npersonal and intuitive experience (anubhava) as independent and convincing\nevidence.&nbsp; &nbsp;Sankara says that individual\u2019s experience\ncannot be disputed, because the experience he went through was real to him;\nthough that may not be real from the absolute point of view. Sankara makes a\ndistinction between the absolute view and the relative view of things.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a serious mistake to superimpose on the\nsubject, i.e., Atman whose nature is Intelligence, the object whose nature is\ninsentiency and vice-versa to superimpose the subject and the attributes of the\nsubject on the object.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The subject is Atman or the Supreme Self whose nature is\nabsolute consciousness. The object includes whatever of a non-intelligent\nnature, viz., body sense, mind, Prana and the objects of the senses, i.e., the\nmanifested phenomenal universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What a &nbsp;person does is, he imposes his transactional\nexperience (relative or dual) over the transcendental (absolute) and accepts the\nformer as real. That subjective experience need not be proved or disproved\n.However, the confusion it created can be removed by wisdom&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(vidya).According\nto Sankara the world we experience is not absolutely real but it is not false\neither. The real is that which cannot be negated and that which is beyond&nbsp; contradiction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shankara writes that Brahman\nor Truth is associated with certain illusory power called Maya or Avidya to\nwhich this appearance of the phenomenal universe is due.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Avidya is beginningless but it terminates in\nthe aspirant when Brahma Jnana dawns. So Avidya is Anadi-santam. This illusory\npower cannot be called 'Being' (Sat) for 'Being' is only Brahman; nor can it be\ncalled 'Non-being' (Asat) in the strict sense, for it somehow produces the\nappearance of this world.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as a magician produces many things, so also\nBrahman projects the appearance of the sense-universe by means of the illusory\npower, Maya. The individual soul blindly identifies himself with the adjuncts\nor vehicles (Upadhis), viz., the body, senses, Prana, mind, Buddhi, etc., the\nfictitious offering of Avidya.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instead of recognising himself to be pure\nBrahman, he calls himself a man or Jiva. The Avidya acts as a veil and hides\nhis true nature. He is unable to look through and beyond the veil (Avidya). The\nbody, senses, mind, etc., are superimposed on the pure self on account of the\nforce of ignorance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through the identification with the body, mind and senses,\nhe imagines that he is the doer and enjoyer. The soul which in reality is pure\nall-pervading intelligence, non-active and infinite, thus becomes limited in\nextent as it were, limited in knowledge and power.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through his actions with\nselfish-motives, he burdens himself with merit and demerit. Maya cannot be\nadequately described. It is a mystery beyond our understanding. It is\ninscrutable or indefinable (Anirvachaniya).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahman is not affected a bit by\nthe illusion, just as a juggler is not affected by the illusion he produces.\nJust as a writer of a drama projects his own thoughts when he writes down the\nscenes in various acts, so also Brahman has projected this universe by mere\nwilling. This theory or doctrine of Sankara is known as Vivarta Vada or Maya\nVada or Anirvachaniya Khyati Vada.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Shankaracharya &nbsp;explains that vyavaharika (relative) and\npara_marthika (absolute) both are real. However, the relative reality is\n\u201climited\u201d in the sense it is biologically or mechanically determined and it is\nnot beyond contradictions. The absolute on the other hand is infinite\n(everlasting and unitary (meaning utter lack of plurality)).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The aim of Vedantic Sadhana is to destroy\nentirely the erroneous idea, 'I am the body' and to substitute the idea, 'I am\nBrahman.' When you get knowledge of the Self, this erroneous idea, 'I am the\nbody' is annihilated and you get liberation or Mukti.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Srutis emphatically\ndeclare: 'Rite Jnananna Mukti - there is no liberation without knowledge of the\nSelf.' 'The heart's knot is broken; all doubts are cleared, all Karmas are\nburnt when one realises the Self.' by knowing the Self, one passes beyond\ndeath; there is no other way.'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shankara points out\nthat the two dimensions \u2013 Vyavaharika and Paramarthika- are two levels of\nexperiential variations. It does not mean they are two orders of reality. They\nare only two perspectives. Whatever that is there is REAL and is not affected\nby our views</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The Self in the vyavaharika context is\nsaririka (embodied self); it encounters the world. However, the Self in reality\nis not saririka; it is absolute, asaririka and is infinite. The infinite Self,\nperceived as the limited self (jiva) is what Sankara calls as adhyasa</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dichotomy between\nbeing an individual-in-the-world (jiva) and being originally a pure,\ntranscendental consciousness (atman) is taken by Sankara as merely superficial.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It is due to avidya that the individual\nfails to see the nexus between Being and the world.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That nexus indicates the\noneness underlying the subject-object, inner-outer, Man-Nature distinctions.\nAll that is required is to remove the error and the universe will shine on its\nown accord.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The analogy given in\nthe text is that of a pond that is clear and undisturbed .One can see the\nbottom of the pond through its still water. When, however, pebbles are thrown\ninto the pond, the water in it is disturbed and the bottom of the pond becomes\nno longer visible. That bottom however is there all the time and it remains\nunchanged, no matter whether the surface water is disturbed or not. The water in\nthe pond is the transactional world. The bottom of the pond is the\ntranscendental reality. The disturbance created is avidya<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Sankara says, the purpose of Upanishads is to\nremove adhyasa or avidya; and once it is removed, Brahman will shine of its\naccord, for it is the only reality. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Man does not differ\nfrom animals in the matter of cognition. Empirical knowledge is no knowledge at\nall from the stand-point of knowledge of Brahman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An enquiry into Brahman\nthrough the study of Brahma-Sutras is absolutely necessary. Then only, you can\nfree yourself from the wrong notion, 'I am the body' which is the cause of all\nevil and attain thereby the knowledge of the absolute unity of the Self.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This knowledge of the\nSelf is not mere theoretical or intellectual knowledge. It is actual\nrealisation through constant meditation. It is direct intuitional knowledge\ngained by coming in direct contact with Brahman. Avidya is nescience or\nignorance. Superimposition is Avidya. Avidya or false knowledge is destroyed\nwhen true knowledge of the Self dawns.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Shankaracharya explains\nthat, when such acts are performed by a person without desire for the fruits of\nhis actions, by recognizing the reality that there is neither a\n\"doer\" nor an \u201cobject\u201d, then that instills in him the desire for\nBrahma-vidya, which takes him closer to vidya.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Shankaracharya ushered\nin a new way of looking at our world, at our experience in/with it, by\nintroducing the relative and absolute view of the Universe. When he talked\nabout the infinite and time less nature of the Universe, it was not in the\nsense of endless duration, but in the sense of completeness, requiring neither\na before nor an after.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When he referred to Unity of self he was not talking of\nputting two things together, but he used the term to mean utter absence of all\nplurality in the real Self. The western world had to wait until the beginning\nof twentieth century to arrive at those amazing concepts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Shankaracharya gave\ncredence to an individual\u2019s subjective experience. He placed personal\nexperience and intuition above all the other means of cognition. He said a\nperson\u2019s experience could not be disputed. He declared, \u201cIntuition is not\nopposed to intellect. Reality is experience. Realizing the Supreme Being is\nwithin ones experience.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He recognized the\nunderlying oneness and the infinite nature of the universe. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He asserted, \u201cI am not\nthe mind or the intellect not the ego. I am the blissful form of the Brahman.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Shankaracharya redefined\nthe relation between the Man, World and the Universe. He said they were One.\nDuality, he said, was an error in perception.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shankara valued reason,\nencourages spirit of enquiry, gives credence to subjective experience and\ntherefore to freedom of ones thought and expression. He suggests intellect is\nnot opposed to intuition. He asks us to take the small ego out of the equation\nin our day-to-day activities of life. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He implores us to\nrecognize the essential unity of all beings and their oneness with the infinite\nspace-time continuum. He explained, the Universe is the manifestation of the\nSupreme Being.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4000 years ago when the\nwhite man was clubbing down animals and eating raw meat, and doing grunt grunt\nfor language in damp caves , Adi Shankaracharua pondered about the source,\nnature, foundation, scope, validity and limits of human knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swami Vivekananda aptly\ndescribed Sankara\u2019s Advaita as the fairest flower of philosophy that any\ncountry in any age has produced or can produce<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BrahmAn is a FIELD that\ncannot be picked up by the 5 human senses.&nbsp;\nThe soul (atma ) is a tiny piece of this mighty all pervasive field , whose\nfrequency has been lowered deliberately \u2013to allow it to evolve by own experience\non own time table.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day after moksha the soul with same highest frequency as\nthe mother field ( brahmAn ) will merge back . This is&nbsp; a continuous feedback loop\u2014there is NO\nsuperstition in this, if you are intelligent<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Adi Shankaracharya was\nthis planet\u2019s FIRST metaphysicist and the LAST Maharishi.&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Metaphysics&nbsp; means \u201cwhat comes after physics\u201d.&nbsp; Its object is to determine the real nature of\nthings\u2014to determine the meaning, structure, and principles of whatever is\ninsofar as it is-- with reality as a whole. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a call to\nrecognize the existence and overwhelming importance of a set of higher\nrealities that ordinary men could not deduce. Metaphysics is the science of\nultimate reality , as opposed to appearance or the contrast between appearance\nand reality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Metaphysician is a sort\nof super scientist, unlimited in his curiosity and gifted with a capacity for\nputting together other people's findings with a skill and imagination that none\nof them individually commands.&nbsp; He can\nrefute by debate, through a method for systematic evaluation of\ndefinitions.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In appreciation of\ncomplexity of the Sanatana Dharama philosophy, T S Eliot wrote that the great\nphilosophers of India \"make the greatest European philosophers look like\nschoolboys \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthur Schopenhauer\nused Indian philosophy to improve upon Kantian thought.&nbsp; In the preface to his book The World As Will\nAnd Idea,&nbsp; Schopenhauer writes that one\nwho \"has also received and assimilated the sacred primitive Indian\nwisdom,&nbsp; then he is the best of all\nprepared to hear what I have to say to him\".&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta has told 7000\nyears ago that brahmAn ( morphogenetic consciousness field )&nbsp; is the fundamental entity from which\neverything else has come. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Darwin and his monkey\ngang may NOT agree.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consciousness shapes\nour material world.&nbsp; DNA about which\nDarwin had zilch idea , is a transceiver of information, some from the space\ntime dimension and the other form the quantum world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tvasta , the double\nhelix coiled serpents which cannot be destroyed- is mentioned in Rig Veda of\n5000 BC , ( DNA ) as that which gives rise to all life in living creatures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient 7000 year\nold Vedanta and quantum physics approach the subject from widely divergent\npoints of view and use vastly different language to treat it.&nbsp; Yet they can reconcile without diminishing\nthe importance or subtlety of either.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scientific Vedanta\nfactoring in the morphogenetic consciousness field or brahmAn is indeed the\nlast frontier .&nbsp; None of the quantum\nscientists have categorized Vedanta as a religious work.&nbsp; They have perused and found that it is a\nsubtle mathematical or scientific analysis.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om Isha vasyam idam\nsarvam, yat kincha jagatyam jagat'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"All this-\nwhatever exists in this changing universe, is pervaded by consciousness\"--Isa\nUpanishad<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta and Quantum\nMechanics describe the same subject\u2014ultimate reality\u2014from opposite points of\nview and perspective.&nbsp; Vedanta examines\nevidence, asserts hypotheses, quotes established authorities both pro and con its\nthesis, and closely reasons its way to a well-substantiated conclusion.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta has told 7000\nyears ago that matter is not condensed substance but a diffused form of\nenergy\u2014and this is what Einstein who was proficient in Vedanta too seconded.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Advaita Vedanta, the\nonly reality is Brahman, the Oneness. All else that exists is surface reality\nof the world around us. Beyond this surface reality lies the true Absolute\nReality, and that is Brahman. Brahman is the only reality of this world and all\nothers have only relative reality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern science accepted\nconsciousness only after it got shell shocked by the results of the quantum\ndouble slit experiment..&nbsp; Vedanta has\nalways spoken about the importance of the conscious observer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advaita is that state\nof non-duality where there is complete cessation of thoughts such as \"I am\nan individual\", \"the objects that are seen / perceived are different\nfrom me\", so on and so forth. In this state, there is no misery or delusion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Tatra ko moha:\nka: shoka:\"-- \"Where is delusion or misery for the one who has\nrealized this non-dual state?\"--- Ishavasya Upanishad<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Upanishadic\ntimes, men were not spoken of as good or bad. Instead, they were recognized\ninto two types - the learned and the ignorant.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per Advaita philosophy is\nthat, when you are on the correct path, knowledge which correlates and\ncorroborates with your study comes from within you. That is the real proof that\nyou are on the right track.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When creation occurs,\nthe universe the essence of which was always within Brahman evolves itself and\nissues out of the Brahman with name and form, this is what is called creation.\nBrahman creates the world just as a spider creates it's webs out of itself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedas contain the\nmeaning of consciousness. A visible attribute of consciousness is an energetic\nfield that governs the shaping of organisms. Morphogenesis is a scientific term\nto explain this very shaping of tissues, organs, and entire organisms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IDIOTS CONTROLLED BY\nJEW ROTHSCHILD WILL WRITE THAT VEDAS ARE USELESS BOOKS OR FIT ONLY TO BE BURNT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankara describes the\nnature of Brahman as such: \u201cThat which permeates all, which nothing transcends\nand which, like the universal space around us, fills everything completely from\nwithin and without, that Supreme nondual Brahman - that thou art.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Indian religious\nand philosophical traditions, all knowledge is traced back to the Gods and to\nthe Mahrishis with 12 strand DNA and king sized pineal glands&nbsp; who \"saw\" the Vedas. The ancient\nVedas tell us that the basis of all creation is the all pervading&nbsp; morphogenetic consciousness field. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fields of conscousness\nare called M fields \u2013morphogenetic.&nbsp; Just\nlike electromagnetic and gravitational fields.&nbsp;\nAll life forms are connected by \"morphic fields\" or strong\nintertwined energetic connections. Our separation from each other is an optical\nillusion of consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Without and\nwithin all beings the unmoving and also the moving; because of Its subtlety,\nunknowable; and near and far away is That( brahmAn )\". --- Bhagavad Gita,\nCh.13,Verses 15<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consciousness is the\ncreative force of the entire universe. The entire universe is in fact a single\nliving conscious organism with complete awareness of itself.&nbsp; Not only is consciousness responsible for the\nphysical universe and its elements-- it is the universe.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The field of consciousness contains\ninformation about everything that has happened since the dawn of time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upanishads, which form\nthe principal source material for Advaita Vedanta.enables us to realize the\nnature of ourselves and reality-- to recognize that we are perfect and\ncomplete. Advaita is a system that states that all is the Self.&nbsp; That which is me, that which is you. That\nwhich is the world, that which is in the world, that which is transcendent of\nthe world\u2013all is the Self. . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahman is at best\ndescribed as that infinite, omnipresent, omnipotent, incorporeal, impersonal,\ntranscendent reality that is the divine ground of all Being. Brahman is also\nbeyond the senses. It is the basis of the material world, which in turn is its\nillusionary transformation.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Adi\nShankara, Maya is the complex illusionary power of Brahman which causes the\nBrahman to be seen as the material world of separate forms.&nbsp; It has two main functions \u2014 one is to\n\"hide\" Brahman from ordinary human perception, and the other is to\npresent the material world in its stead. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya is also said to be\nindescribable, though it may be said that all sense data entering ones\nawareness via the five senses are Maya, since the fundamental reality\nunderlying sensory perception is completely hidden. Maya is neither completely\nreal nor completely unreal and hence indescribable. Its shelter is Brahman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahman is actually\nindescribable but Brahman itself is untouched by the illusion of Maya, just\nlike a magician is not tricked by his own magic. . When Maya is removed, there\nexists ultimately no difference between the Jiva-Atman and the Brahman. Such a\nstate of bliss when achieved while living is called Jivan mukti\u2014he liberated\nsoul.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">First of all,\nunderstanding Advaita requires you to let go of all that you know or believe to\nbe true...Just let go and make your mind blank. Awareness of our true nature\nmelts away each layer of Maya. Advaita Vedanta can be the spiritual path for\nboth the scientist and the spiritual person, so that the two need not be\nmutually exclusive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The central position of\nthe Advaita Vedanta tradition is that in reality there is no difference between\nconsciousness and the universe, no real distinction between the individual, the\nentire universe and God, Brahman. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advaita ( non-dual),&nbsp; declares that the universe is a manifestation\nof one nondifferentiated reality, expressed in Sanskrit as Brahman,&nbsp; neuter in gender it literally means \u201cgrowth\u201d,\n\"development\"or the \u201cSupreme transcendent and immanent Reality or the\nOne Godhead.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karmajam budhiyuktha hi\nbhalam thyakthwa maneeshina:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">janmabandhanavinirmuktha:\npadam gachandhyanamayam&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those intelligent\npeople, who think about the truth, who perform their duty or endeavor with\nskill, and with the evenness of mind with regard to success or failure (yogis),\nbecome totally freed from the restraints or shackles from birth onwards, and\nsurely reaches the state of no sorrow.-- [Bhagavad Gita, Chapter 2, verse 51]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most people seek\nexternal happiness from external objects, while the truth is that eternal bliss\nis within oneself and the search must be made within to attain this supreme\nbliss.&nbsp; All the pleasures that are\nderived from the external objects are trifles compared to that eternal bliss\nwhich is the Supreme.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The concept of Advaita\nphilosophy is to helps to attain liberation, the nature of which is eternal\nbliss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Freedom from having to\ngo through the experiencing of \u2018sorrow or happiness\u2019 is to be free of\n\u2018bondage.\u2019 That is liberation right in this life or Jivanmukti.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jivanmukti is the name\nfor staying unperturbed, whatever may be the circumstances (= results of\nactions done now or in the past), like an unflickering and steady flame from a\nlamp which is in a place where there is no breeze.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cause for birth is\nthe Karma load (stock of the results of actions performed) of the individual\nsoul. As long as action is there, Karma is accumulated and that will lead to\nbirth, which in turn will result in death. The cycle goes on. So the only way\nto completely avoid misery is to get out of this cycle of births and deaths.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Maya is removed,\nthe truth of \"Brahma Satyam Jagan Mithya Jivo Brahmaiva Na Aparah\" is\nrealized Brahman (the Absolute) is alone real; this world is unreal; the Jiva\nor the individual soul is non-different from Brahman Such a state of bliss when\nachieved while living is called Jivanmukta-the liberated soul..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All sense data entering\nones awareness via the five senses are Maya.&nbsp;\nMaya is neither completely real nor completely unreal, hence\nindescribable.&nbsp; Maya is temporary and is\ntranscended with \"true knowledge\", or perception of the more\nfundamental reality which permeates Maya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya has two main\nfunctions:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To \"hide\"\nBrahman from ordinary human perception,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To present the material\nworld in its (Brahmam) place.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The world is both\nunreal and real. but something can't be both true and false at the same time;\nhence Adi Shankara has classified the world as indescribable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Sankara says that\nthe world is not real (true), it is an illusion. Adi Sankara gives the following\nreasoning: Whatever thing remains eternal is true, and whatever is non-eternal\nis untrue. Since the world is created and destroyed, it is not real (true).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Truth is the thing which is unchanging. Since the world is changing, it is not\nreal (false). Whatever is independent of space and time is real (true), and\nwhatever has space and time in itself is not real (false). Just as one sees\ndreams in sleep, he sees a kind of super-dream when he is waking. The world is\ncompared to this conscious dream.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">na jayathe mriyathe va\nkathachith nayam bhuthua bhavitha va na bhuya:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ajo nithya:\nshashwathohayam purano na hanyathe hanyamane shareere&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That Supreme Soul or\nParamathma or Iswara was never ever born, nor does It die. And since It is now,\nit does not mean that It will not be. That Soul is unborn, is always, forever,\nand ancient also. As the (human) body is killed, It is not killed. Bhagawat\nGita&nbsp; [Chapter 2, verse 20]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Yatha pinde tatha\nbrahmande, yatha brahmande tatha pinde\"--\"As is the individual, so is\nthe universe, as is the universe, so is the individual.\"&nbsp; --Yajur Veda 5000 BC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An atom can be a wave\nor a particle depending on the observer\u2019s perspective.&nbsp; An atom is pure energy held together by a\nintelligent force.&nbsp; The conscious\nintelligent field lies in the empty space in between the electrons. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">99.9999% of every atom\nis empty space.&nbsp; What we perceive as\nphysical dense matter is actually 99.99 % empty space - large electron fields\nwith very little matter in the center.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We\nlive in a universe created of \"objects\" that are actually 99.9999%\nspace.&nbsp; The electrons, protons and\nneutrons are only a small part of the atom.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nIt is the space between them that is, ironically, the \u201csubstance.\u201d&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Within the\nelectromagnetic force of the atom is the key to everything:&nbsp; creation, transmutation . . -limitless power.\nThis intelligent field decides why a electron should remain in a particular\norbit. :&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electrons can change position instantly without taking time. They\nsuddenly appear in another orbit of higher or lower energy or distance from the\nnucleus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One indivisible\nwholeness of consciousness is the source of all multiplicity of Creation, and\nthat this one unbounded ocean of consciousness is our own consciousness.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Purushyo'yam loka\nsannidah\" . \"Man is a miniature universe\" --(Charaka Samhita IV)\n4200 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consciousness ( Brahman\n) is the only element in creation that knows itself.&nbsp; By being in constant interaction with itself,\nconsciousness knows everything about itself.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Prajn\u0101nam\nbrahma\u201d-- \"Brahman is knowledge\".&nbsp;\nBrahman knows everything.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without factoring in\nconsciousness there can be NO Theory of Every Thing (TOE) and Grand Unification\nTheory (GUT).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When science meets the\nconsciousness field of Vedanta written 7000 years ago, the last frontier can be\nbreached. The morphogenetic field or BrahmAn of Vedanta, has a self organizing\nelectro magnetic nature.&nbsp; This is a\nmerged grand Akashik field of several morphic fields of different nature by\nresonant coupling.&nbsp; This inductive field\nhas consciousness and self initiating nature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This non-linear field\nis holographic and holds information of not only past history by even every\nthought , emotion and feeling held in the right hand subconscious lobe of your\nbrain. This explains the power of prayer and intention. The whole cosmos is\ninterconnected in this field and speed is NOT restricted to speed of light.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God has given us 5\nsenses of narrow bandwidth, so that we do NOT have an information overload\nbreakdown.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The quantum world\ncannot be observed by our 5 senses, and they do NOT follow the cause and effect\nlaws of classical physics. We live in a time obstructed world using 5 senses --\nand also a timeless realm in the quantum dimension, where what you see is NOT\nwhat you get.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That Vedanta is\navailable in the \u201csoap is civilization\u201d Christian West primarily through\nreligious interpreters in pagan saffron robes has prejudiced their evaluation\nof its relevance to scientific concerns.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Science, in its most\nadvanced stage, is closer to Vedanta than ever before. The intuition of Indian\nmystics led them to understand the multidimensional reality and of space-time\ncontinuum which is the basis of the modern theory of relativity.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Akasha \u2013the morphogenetic consciousness field\n, as per Vedanta is the source of everything that exists, and in which the memory\nof the cosmos is encoded.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The brahmAn\n(morphogenetic field) is the reason why a partially formed biological structure\n(the 'morphogentic germ\") gets attached to the morphogentic field of a\nspecies, which then guides the growth of the rest of the form.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The DNA is a\ntransceiver for the BrahmAn or the morphogenetic consciousness field. Genetic\nengineering goes against the laws of the morphogenetic field and indeed the\nuniverse. Eating genetically modified foods is detrimental in DNA upgradation.\nConsciousness differentiates, just like DNA differentiates .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The brain and DNA is\ngoverned by the laws of quantum physics rather than the laws of biology or\nneurophysiology.&nbsp; Scalar waves ( made\nfamous by Nikola Tesla ) is the point of fundamental intersection where matter\nand consciousness influence each other .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedas in its\nunchanged unabridged format in Sanskrit verses , have guided the Indian\u2019s\nreligious direction for ages and will continue to do so till our sun goes\nsupernova. . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sanskrit word for\nphilosophy is darshan or 'seeing', which implies that Sanatana Dharma is is\ngrounded firmly on human consciousness and perception. Vedas introduced\nConsciousness , the most valuable thing on this planet , to Western\nphilosophical thought.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advaita calls our\nessential self, which is beyond body and mind, the Atman. And it teaches that\nthis Atman is Brahman, which is non-dual.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The teaching of Advaita\nis a proven methodology for discovering the nature of your Self and that of the\nworld. And the realization of the fundamental truth that is presented reduces\nall other considerations to complete insignificance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advaita Vedanta\nsuggests that this nondual state of mind can be realized personally, in\nexperience, aided by certain contemplative practices such as meditation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nothing exists separate\nfrom the One God, because God is present everywhere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cBrahma Satyam Jagan\nMithya Jivo Brahmaiva Na Aparah\u2014Brahman (the Absolute) is alone real; this\nworld is unreal; and the Jiva or the individual soul is non-different from\nBrahman.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advaita is the only\nphilosophy that helps us to be free of \u2018bondage\u2019 right in this life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0909\u0924\u094d\u0924\u093f\u0937\u094d\u0920</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091c\u093e\u0917\u094d\u0930\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u093e\u092a\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u0930\u093e\u0928\u094d\u0928\u093f\u092c\u094b\u0927\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
