, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0926\u0941\u0930\u0924\u094d\u092f\u092f\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0926\u0941\u0930\u094d\u0917\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0925\u0938\u094d\u0924\u0924\u094d\u0915\u0935\u092f\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u0926\u0928\u094d\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n|| (uttiShTha jAgrata prApya varAn_nibodhata | kShurasya dhArA nihitA duratyayA\npathas_tat_ -avayo vadanti || ) - <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Rise, awaken,\nseek the wise and realize. The path is difficult to cross like the sharpened\nedge of the razor (knife), so say the wise.\" (<b>1.3.14 ) Katha Upanishads\n5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Advaita form of\nHinduism looks at God , as brahmAn-- the intelligent morphogenetic\nconsciousness field , the akasha&nbsp; or&nbsp; the space between the whizzing electrons in\nan atom \u2013 on a micro scale .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On a macro scale\nbrahmAn is the zero point field cosmos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matter exists because\nof this intelligent force which holds the spiraling electrons in its\norbit--&nbsp; for if it drops or rises one\nsingle orbit the matter changes into something totally different.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankara uses the term \u201c\nsuperimposition\u201d as an analogy for the way in which the object comes to be in\nthe consciousness of the subject and also the way that the consciousness of the\nsubject 'covers' the inert object.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Sanatana Dharma is incomplete without\nsuperimposing <span style=\"color: blue;\">DVAITA </span>template ( trinity- dance of opposites Brahma- Shiva\ncontrolled by a mediator Vishnu&nbsp; ) and\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">SAMKHYA</span> template&nbsp; ( Purusha/ Prakriti )\non <span style=\"color: blue;\">ADVAITA</span> base . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">It takes some\nintelligence to understand the concept and is NOT meant for shallow minds. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">This SUPERIMPOSITION has never been written (\nleave alone understood ) about since the last of the maharishis Adi Shankaracharya\ndied 4000 years before.</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BLAH BLAH superimposing\nthe qualities of one thing (anyadharmAdhyAsah) on another (anyatra) BLAH BLAH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BLAH BLAH a confusion\nof our faculty to discriminate (tat vivekAgraha-nibandhano bhrama iti) BLAH\nBLAH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BLAH BLAH superimposing\n2 things and their attributes that are of opposite nature (tasyaiva vipareeta\ndharmatwa-kalpanAm Achakshate iti) BLAH BLAH</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><b>Many\ngenerations of over-interpretation by half wits have befogged amazing truths of\nSanatana Dharma.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thatha kim Thatha Kim,\nThatha kim Thatha kim. 2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shadangadhi vedo Mukhe\nsasra vidhya ,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kavithwadhi gadhyam ,\nsupadhyam karothi,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; Ajit Vadakayil<br />\nDecember 29, 2017 at 5:18 AM<br />\n<br />\nBEFORE THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA--<br />\n<br />\nFULL MOON DAY ( POORNIMA ) AND THREE DAYS FOLLOWING IT..<br />\n<br />\nAND ..<br />\n<br />\nNEW MOON DAY ( AMAVASYA ) -- AND THREE DAYS FOLLOWING IT..<br />\n<br />\nWERE HOLIDAYS --FOR FASTING ..<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/10/amavasya-poornima-ekadashi-fasting.html<br />\n<br />\nSIX FIXED HOLIDAYS IN A MONTH\u2026<br />\n<br />\nIF YOU DO THIS TODAY IN MODERN TIMES--AND EAT ORGANIC FOOD , YOU WILL NOT GET CANCER..<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE EVIL WHITE INVADER-- BASTARD-- CAME TO INDIA-- HE MADE US WORSE THAN MONKEYS BY MAKING US FAST ON WRONG MEANINGLESS DATES ..<br />\n<br />\nBY 1947 JEW ROTHSCHILD CREATED HUNDREDS OF FAKE MUTTS IN INDIA. \u2026 HE MADE THE PONTIFFS OF THE 4 ORIGINAL MUTTS CRYPTO JEWS WITH PALE EYES --STOPPING THE 4000 YEAR OLD TRADITION OK KERALA NAMBOODIRIS HEADING THE 4 ORIGINAL MUTTS ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE POST ABOVE IS THE REPEAT THE MOST IMPORTANT FOR 1.1 BILLION HINDUS ON THIS PLANET..<br />\n<br />\nSPRING TIDES ARE STRONGEST THREE DAYS-- REPEAT ---THREE DAYS AFTER FULL MOON AND NEW MOON..<br />\n<br />\nTides are long-period waves that roll around the planet as the ocean is \"pulled\" back and forth by the gravitational pull of the moon and the sun as these bodies interact with the Earth in their monthly and yearly orbits\u2026<br />\n<br />\nDuring full or new moons\u2014which occur when the Earth, sun, and moon are nearly in alignment\u2014average tidal ranges are slightly larger. ..This occurs twice each month. ..<br />\n<br />\nThe moon appears new (dark) when it is directly between the Earth and the sun. The moon appears full when the Earth is between the moon and the sun. In both cases, the gravitational pull of the sun is \"added\" to the gravitational pull of the moon on Earth, causing the oceans to bulge a bit more than usual. This means that high tides are a little higher and low tides are a little lower than average.<br />\n<br />\nSpring tides, has nothing to do with the season of spring. Rather, the term is derived from the concept of the tide \"springing forth.\" ..<br />\n<br />\nSpring tides occur twice each lunar month all year long, without regard to the season\u2026.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://tides.mobilegeographics.com/calendar/month/547.html<br />\n<br />\nIN THE LINK ABOVE YOU CAN SEE THAT FULL MOON IS ON 3RD DEC 2017..<br />\n<br />\nTHREE DAYS LATER THE DATE IS 6TH DEC..<br />\n<br />\nTHE HIGH TIDE ( SPRING ) IS 12.5 METRES --THE HIGHEST..<br />\n<br />\nJEW ROTHSCHILD TOOK AWAY INDIANS TO WORK AS INDENTURED LABOUR.. HE CUT THEM OFF CULTURALLY FROM INDIA BY INTRODUCING FAKE FESTIVALS AT FAKE DATES ..<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/indentured-coolie-slavery-reinvented.html<br />\n<br />\nIF CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL WAS NOT BORN ON THIS PLANET..-- HINDUS WOULD HAVE NEVER EVER KNOW ABOUT THIS HUMONGOUS DECEIT\u2026 THIS IS WHY I STARTED THIS BLOGSITE ..<br />\n<br />\nHUMAN BODY AND BRAIN IS FULL OF WATER --AND SPRING TIDES AFFECT US..<br />\n<br />\nWater covers 70 percent of Earth\u2019s surface, makes up 66% of the human body. Brain is 83% water, blood-92%, kidneys - 82%, liver-69% , muscles-75%, bones-28%...<br />\n<br />\nIn my language Malayalam and in Sanskrit Kapha, Pitta and Vata means the same. Kapha is mucous , Pitta is bile and Vata means vayu or fart ( flatulence ). ..<br />\n<br />\nWHEN YOU FAST YOU BALANCE THE TRI DOSHAS..<br />\n<br />\nMost Hindus observe fast on Purnima and Amavasya. ..<br />\n<br />\nPeople who fast SERIOUSLY continue till the third day when the water pull/ push in human cells is highest . ..<br />\n<br />\nThese three days Hindus fast or take light veggie food rich in Magnesium\u2026<br />\n<br />\nFasting is done to reduce the acidic content in our system and to slow down the metabolic rates\u2026 This restores the body and mind balance. ..Meditation helps in centering your body, mind and soul\u2026<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2\u2014</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_141BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; When the body is not cleansing properly, this process is impaired and instead you wake up tired and lethargic . There is a higher sodium content in the cell, therefore a higher hydrogen (acidifying) content, and as water follows sodium in the body, the water content of the cell starts to swell. ..<br />\n<br />\nSo the cell is under pressure from high acidity \u2013 so it pulls in more calcium, which displaces more magnesium causing an imbalance\u2026<br />\n<br />\nThe moon-pull is much gentler than the sun-push. Only if conditions are right within the body can the moon pull the sodium back across the cell membrane, thus making way for the Magnesium to exert a gentle push with the potassium, so that they go back to their rightful position, which is inside the cell\u2026<br />\n<br />\nWhat is lymph? Ayurveda knew it 6000 years ago, while modern science knew about it just 60 years back\u2026<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/yoga-and-ayurvedic-massage-for-draining.html<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/01/lymph-nodes-vs-endocrine-exocrine.html<br />\n<br />\n6200 YEAR OLD Ayurveda was the first to write about AUTOPHAGY.. literally SELF EATING -- it\u2019s the body\u2019s system of cleaning house: Your cells create membranes that hunt out scraps of dead, diseased, or worn-out cells; gobble them up; strip them for parts; and use the resulting molecules for energy or to make new cell parts.<br />\n<br />\nAutophagy makes us more efficient machines to get rid of faulty parts, stop cancerous growths, and stop metabolic dysfunction like obesity and diabetes.. the process plays a hand in controlling inflammation and immunity.<br />\n<br />\nTHE MOST IMPORTANT EFFECT IS THAT THE BRAIN GETS SHARPENED AND THE AGEING PROCESS SLOWS DOWN<br />\n<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=10jNZleNH9w<br />\n<br />\nFROM NOW ON HINDUS WILL CREATE THEIR OWN DESTINY--WE DONT CARE FOR THE WHITE MEN WHO FOOLED US USING AGENTS LIKE GANDHI AND BR AMBEDKAR\u2026<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_139MN\" kind=\"m\"></span></div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_141b+seedCKDdD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span>\n<div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; Head of a lower caste woman named Yellamma was attached to Renuka\u2019s body. Thus a lower caste woman achieved the higher status of being a Brahmin\u2019s wife.<br />\n<br />\nFollowing the tradition a number of young girls started dedicating themselves to the FAKE goddess YELLAMMA \u2013and they became prostitutes after first menses<br />\n<br />\nThe white invader injected poison that in Vedic times Devadasis were divided into seven categories.<br />\n<br />\nThey are known as Dutta, Hruta, Bikrita, Bhrutya, Alankara and Gopika or Rudraganika \u2014 depending on the sexual deviancy branch they were experts in oral / anal / morbid fetish etc.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_141b+seedCKDdD\" kind=\"d\"><span id=\"bc_0_149b+seedBt2D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_141b+seedCKDdD\" kind=\"d\"><span id=\"bc_0_149b+seedBt2D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></span></div>\n</div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_141b+seedCKDdD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_141b+seedCKDdD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS IS IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 50 , BELOW</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_16.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_16.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kGP1RzkDyt0/V4e91OBhm9I/AAAAAAABLCI/VVaqt2k88cU2o0M40oKBvWWSHA_yUfiywCLcB/s1600/2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kGP1RzkDyt0/V4e91OBhm9I/AAAAAAABLCI/VVaqt2k88cU2o0M40oKBvWWSHA_yUfiywCLcB/s400/2.jpg\" width=\"180\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">O\u1e41 Bh\u016br Bhuva~Swah', Tat savitur varenyam,\nBhargo devasya dh\u012bmahi, Dhiyo yo nah prachoday\u0101t</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Let us meditate on that excellent glory of\nthe divine Light (quasar ). May he inspire our thoughts, stimulate our\nunderstandings.\u2013 <b>Rig Veda 3.62.10 5000 BC</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">The 24 words of the Gayatri Mantra have a\nspecial relationship with 24 mudras known as GAYATRI MUDRAS.&nbsp;&nbsp; They have different names and formations. </span></b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-SnqQFQnCMLk/V4SXLuL1TjI/AAAAAAABK8Q/U2OGbf-oSxwF3MFyBm_MRc0YxypY6H1kQCLcB/s1600/xcxslide_2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: lime;\">The importance of Mudras is also clear from\nthe grim qualifier to these:</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Etaa Mudraa na jaanaati, Gaayatri nishphalaa\nbhaveta<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">To him who does not know Mudras, Gayatri\nbecomes ineffectual.</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FzxlWFVwtQg/V4SCleja8tI/AAAAAAABK7w/je_seiPmCSUh_M0681fyCrr4H7bs2gFEACLcB/s1600/nadisX1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FzxlWFVwtQg/V4SCleja8tI/AAAAAAABK7w/je_seiPmCSUh_M0681fyCrr4H7bs2gFEACLcB/s640/nadisX1.jpg\" width=\"609\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VDbrmG7HOD0/V4SDfHDRsiI/AAAAAAABK78/5iPDHTtcIMcjxzSsGpOP524i_uukY0-VACLcB/s1600/CCimages.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VDbrmG7HOD0/V4SDfHDRsiI/AAAAAAABK78/5iPDHTtcIMcjxzSsGpOP524i_uukY0-VACLcB/s400/CCimages.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gayatri mantra is\nfound in Rig Veda Samhita.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nadis are channels\nthrough which, &nbsp;the energies of the\nphysical body, the subtle body and the causal body flow. &nbsp;&nbsp;Nadis connect at special points of intensity\ncalled nadichakras.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Kundalini yoga, the\nmost important nadis are three-- &nbsp;ida,\npingala, and sushumna . Ida lies to the left of the spine, whereas pingala is\nto the right side of the spine, mirroring the ida. Sushumna &nbsp;runs along the spinal cord in the center,\nthrough the seven chakras. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under the\ncorrect conditions the energy of kundalini is said to uncoil and enter sushumna\nthrough the brahma dwara or gate of Brahma at the base of the spine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 72,000 nadis among\nthem, the three just mentioned are the three most vital.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\" The na\u1e0dis penetrate the\nbody from the soles of the feet to the crown of the head.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In them is prana, the\nbreath of life and in that life abides \u0100tman, which is the abode of Shakti,\ncreatrix of the animate and inanimate worlds.\" </span><b style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Varaha Upanishad 54/5)\n5000 BC</b><br />\n<b style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/YQLbbDHdOMw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/YQLbbDHdOMw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">The 4<sup>th</sup> and last part of the Vedas are\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b>UPANISHADS</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Knowledge of supreme\nbeing is the subject matter of Upanishads. The supreme being is referred as\nBramhan ( morphogenetic consciousness field ) in Upanishads .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads\nexplain that jivatma(individual soul) is like a river that has to join\nparamatma (supreme soul/god)...so individual soul is 'part' of supreme soul.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-13ExUoqZga0/V4YBm0bdV2I/AAAAAAABK9g/P6OgWM00I4AEsAxNbir053CEakwqMXzNACLcB/s1600/iNNmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"398\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-13ExUoqZga0/V4YBm0bdV2I/AAAAAAABK9g/P6OgWM00I4AEsAxNbir053CEakwqMXzNACLcB/s400/iNNmages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c484181626692889870\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-x42EDtcw1Os/V4TOAKvOXtI/AAAAAAABK8k/Vf4SPRmggJ8r7A_dU5VurSOV0vxkSOW8QCLcB/s1600/dXelhggi6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-x42EDtcw1Os/V4TOAKvOXtI/AAAAAAABK8k/Vf4SPRmggJ8r7A_dU5VurSOV0vxkSOW8QCLcB/s1600/dXelhggi6.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nTHERE ARE 27 NAKSHATRAS . &nbsp;THESE THINGS WERE RECORDED IN 5000 BC , MUCH BEFORE STONEHENGE WAS BUILT.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"background-color: white; color: #252525; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-top: 0.5em;\">\nThe 27 Nakshatras cover 13\u00b020\u2019 of the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecliptic\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Ecliptic\">ecliptic</a>&nbsp;each.&nbsp;</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: white; color: #252525; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-top: 0.5em;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: white; color: #252525; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-top: 0.5em;\">\nEach Nakshatra is also divided into quarters or&nbsp;<i>padas</i>&nbsp;of 3\u00b020\u2019, and the below table lists the appropriate starting sound to name the child.&nbsp;</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: white; color: #252525; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-top: 0.5em;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: white; font-family: sans-serif; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-top: 0.5em;\">\n<span style=\"color: #252525; font-size: 14px;\">The 27 nakshatras, each with 4 padas, give </span><span style=\"color: red;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\">108 </span><span style=\"font-size: large;\">( NUMERICAL EQUIVALENT OF OM )</span><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\">&nbsp;</span></b></span><span style=\"color: #252525; font-size: 14px;\">, which is the number of beads in a japa mala, indicating all the elements (ansh) of Vishnu:</span></div>\n<table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"\" cellspacing=\"2\" class=\"wikitable\" style=\"background-color: #f9f9f9; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-NkF2aIG5E2M/V4TPzd6-ssI/AAAAAAABK80/qDbW3KCK6JsdBMJnbf_S0KmoMYzRG2JWQCLcB/s1600/STDDAR-CHARRAN.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"584\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-NkF2aIG5E2M/V4TPzd6-ssI/AAAAAAABK80/qDbW3KCK6JsdBMJnbf_S0KmoMYzRG2JWQCLcB/s640/STDDAR-CHARRAN.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">54 devas and asuras had\nchurned for the amrit or holy nectar. &nbsp; &nbsp;All mantras are repeated 108 times. All\nprayer beads count up to 108. &nbsp;There are 108 upanishads. Nataraja's cosmic dance\nhas 108 Bharatanatyam poses. &nbsp; 12 rashis and 9 navagrahas multiply to 108. &nbsp; Sun's\ndiameter is 108 times that of the earth.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;The distance between the Earth and Sun is 108 times the diameter of the\nSun . &nbsp; The distance between earth and moon is 108 times the diameter of the\nmoon.. &nbsp;&nbsp; Ayurveda and Kalari talks about\n108 marmas. &nbsp;&nbsp; The 108 th and heaviest\nelement in the periodic table is Hassium ( 108 protons ) . &nbsp; The rest are too\nshort lived. &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;In Sri Yantra divine\ngeomentry containing TOE , the 3 lines intersect at 54 points ( number of Sanskrit/\nMalayalam &nbsp;alphabets ) with Shiva and Shakti\nqualities making the magic number 108..</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<table align=\"center\" cellpadding=\"\" cellspacing=\"2\" class=\"wikitable\" style=\"background-color: #f9f9f9; padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\"><a class=\"image\" href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Scorpius_constellation_map.png\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\"><img alt=\"Scorpius constellation map.png\" data-file-height=\"2559\" data-file-width=\"2559\" height=\"100\" kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Scorpius_constellation_map.png/100px-Scorpius_constellation_map.png\" srcset=\"//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Scorpius_constellation_map.png/150px-Scorpius_constellation_map.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Scorpius_constellation_map.png/200px-Scorpius_constellation_map.png 2x\" style=\"border: none; vertical-align: middle;\" width=\"100\" /></a></td></tr>\n<tr><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\">20; 18</td><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\"><b><a class=\"mw-redirect\" href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Purva_Ashadha\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Purva Ashadha\">Purva Ashadha</a></b><br />\n\"first of the&nbsp;<i>a\u1e63\u0101\u1e0dh\u0101</i>\",&nbsp;<i>a\u1e63\u0101\u1e0dh\u0101</i>&nbsp;\"the invincible one\" being the name of a constellation</td><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NhsvYdOBZjQ/V4YA8SCodhI/AAAAAAABK9U/4aCPYv1I8rs9o-i8CGXuU9YbdNObI6HMACLcB/s640/a7b050f08f13a90e963fd04d2e009568fa0.jpg\" width=\"482\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PURE AWARENESS DESTROYS\nEGO NOT BY COMPRESSING IT TO ZERO - BUT BY EXPANDING IT TO INFINITY.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BRAHMAN IS THE SHORTEST DISTANCE FROM ZERO TO\nINFINITY<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern physics and\nmathematics prove that time is an illusion of our limited consciousness. In\nreality, there is only infinite potentiality and within that, from our point of\nview, there is the probability that certain groups of energy, quanta, will be\nin relation to other groups of quanta. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This means that\neverything and every relationship possible exists. And only if every\npossibility of all relationships exist, can free will be possible. There are\nvarious levels reached so far by human consciousness and these levels are what\nyogis call the states of Samadhi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Specific sadhanas and asanas\nwhich concentrate ever greater packets of consciousness allow jumps into\ngreater and greater states.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most people, units of\nself consciousness, are not connected. They are either fading away or living in\ntheir own purgatories. Unless you have had the experience of Awareness and\nremember it in this moment of time or this place within consciousness, you are\nnot of the Way.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a pure individuated\npoint of consciousness, as a result of the wave particle nature of energy, our\nconsciousness permeate everything and extend to infinity. As individuated\nConsciousness ( atman ) we are the same as Consciousness field ( brahmAn ) and\ncreate in exactly the same manner with exactly the some rules, concepts and\nprinciples. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We have a free will and\nwe are free to choose what we wish to create. There are no obligation on us in\nany way what so ever. Nor are there any limits or barriers on what we can or\ncannot create.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We are free in every\nway. The only issue we will face is that we are playing a role in a larger\norchestration. That is we have elected to play consciously or nonconsciously at\nsome level of our being.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-533Vi556byo/V4YKuUme3hI/AAAAAAABK94/DNzCCRZfFe49RsWzdxa5aCMqmFCJQIfvQCLcB/s1600/imacccges.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-533Vi556byo/V4YKuUme3hI/AAAAAAABK94/DNzCCRZfFe49RsWzdxa5aCMqmFCJQIfvQCLcB/s400/imacccges.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Getting back- <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All extant Upanishads\nare traditional classified under one of the 4 Vedas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the bloodless\nsacrificial religion is to be practiced in the householder stage, when one\nmoves to the forest dweller stage one is supposed to meditate on the symbolism\nand spiritual value of the sacrifices.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the samnyaasin stage one's life\n(worldly life with all its attachments) itself is said to be the sacrifice. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads do not\nrepresent systematic philosophy. The purpose of the Upanishads is not mere\nintellectual satisfaction, but a practical solution to the ultimate problems of\nlife. The teaching of the Upanishads can be best understood under the following\nthree categories :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>the Self or essence of\nman - Atman<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>the Self or essence of\nthe world - Brahman</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>the relation between\nAtman and Brahman</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the 7000\nyear old Upanishads when knowledge of one's Self (Atman) is acquired, knowledge\nof the essence (Self) of the world (Brahman) as well as the relationship\nbetween Atman and Brahman is known.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads say that\nit is due to our ignorance (avidya) that we're not aware of the true nature of\nourselves. When ignorance is removed with right knowledge, the Self shines\nforth in its true nature. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acquisition of\nspiritual knowledge is the supreme purpose of human existence as per\nVedanta.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human beings are superior to\nother forms of life only because they can sufficiently discriminate between the\nreal and the unreal, between the ephemeral and the eternal, between darkness\nand light.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humans pass the mirror and\ncolour test which only a couple of mamals can pass ( like elephants, dolphins,\nbonobos ) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A man who does not\nstrive to make good of this opportunity and remains lost in materialism\nhas&nbsp; committed spiritual suicide. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2nRtRKEO49E/V4ZAGEyk6VI/AAAAAAABLAI/HMg4D4pMK3UlMYT86gdbl3lSgAGkupMLgCLcB/s1600/bohr_upaniscchad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"404\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2nRtRKEO49E/V4ZAGEyk6VI/AAAAAAABLAI/HMg4D4pMK3UlMYT86gdbl3lSgAGkupMLgCLcB/s640/bohr_upaniscchad.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 3rd verse of\nIshavasya Upanishad therefore declares:--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"The immutable\nsoul is the real nature of man, and not his mortal frame.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Because the soul\nendures from one life to the next,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>whereas the body\nchanges every moment and perishes with death.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>But the materialistic\npeople, enveloped with ignorance, vanity or pride,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>deny the very existence\nof the soul.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>They say- 'Only that\nexists which can be perceived with the senses.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There is nothing\nbeyond, there is no yonder world after death.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Verily, man is but an\nagglomeration of the elements,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>born of the lust of his\nparents.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>We are born with our\nphysical birth, and cease to exist after our death.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Indeed, there is no\nconnection between actions and their fruits.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There no vice or\nvirtue. So eat, drink and be merry.'<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Denying their own true\nessence,</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>these deluded men have\nkilled their own souls in this very life.\"</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7089197252726171925\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_117M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/08173368436479307173\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Anurag Shukla</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_12.html?showComment=1468404073082#c7089197252726171925\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 13, 2016 at 3:31 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_117MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSaw an interesting live cast by Rajiv Malhotra in which he interviews teenage children who are are disciples of Nityananda displaying various powers of a) Reading text with eyes closed b) Scanning the body of person in front and finding out any trouble spots c) Seeing places and things which are far away. We from this ancient lad of Bharat have read and heard about such stuff, so we should not be astounded. But what is astounding is how this knowledge that would have been common place in our country is now so rare. What the so called modern scientists are trying to find out was already found and developed to a supreme level in our land by the Maharishis, nay even by their low-level followers. Here is the FB link of the video. text-decoration: none;\">July 13, 2016 at 3:50 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_116MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi as,<br />\n<br />\nsorry TAMIL AGAMA has nothing to with it.<br />\n<br />\nin my previous post part 47 -i had written-<br />\n<br />\n\" Modern quantum science will have to fall back on Samayama on nadi techniques - like using mind as a laser beam, super telescope/ microscope teleportation and levitation \"<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHITE INVADER STOLE OUR ARANYAKAS<br />\n<br />\nTODAY ASK ANY HINDU --<br />\n<br />\nWHAT IS ARANYAKA ?<br />\n<br />\nHE WILL LOOK AT YOU AS IF YOUR ARE CRAZY.<br />\n<br />\nARANYAKAS WAS THE THIRD PART OF VEDAS-- WHILE UPANISHADS ( VENDANTA ) WAS THE 4TH AND LAST PART OF VEDAS<br />\n<br />\nARANYAKAS DEALT WITH THE SUPER POWERS OF MIND AND BODY .<br />\n<br />\nANCIENT MAHARISHIS WROTE DOWN 7000 YEARS AGO THE DIAMETERS AND DISTANCES OF ALL PLANETS FROM EARTH<br />\n<br />\nHOW?<br />\n<br />\nTHEY BYPASSSED CERTAIN NADIS.<br />\n<br />\n6 PLANETS ARE THERE IS ASTROLOGY --PENNED DOWN 7000 YEARS AGO<br />\n<br />\nURANUS / NEPTUNE AND PLUTO WERE NOT USED --AS THEY REMAIN IN A SINGLE RASHI FOR TOO LONG , AND ARE TOO FAR AWAY TO AFFECT HUMANS--<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHITE MAN CRIED IN GLEE-- HEE HEE HEEE -- INDIANS DID NOT KNOW ABOUT URANUS NEPTUNE AND PLUTO<br />\n<br />\nSORRY, WE HAVE NAMES FOR THEM- SHWETA/ SHYAMA/ TEEVRA --<br />\n<br />\nEVEN I HAVE A NAVA GRAHA ( 9 PLANET ) RING.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZtLkzg8bFgA</span><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_117b+seedGNsgD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_117b+seedGNsgD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ZtLkzg8bFgA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZtLkzg8bFgA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">WHITE CHILDREN COME TO INDIA TO LEARN THIS. &nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/rC7xZmLcOeY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/rC7xZmLcOeY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Right knowledge is\nobtained with the practice of faith, purity, introversion and meditation. &nbsp;Recourse to spirituality does not mean that\none can forget his worldly duties during grihasta stage . &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote the 2nd\nverse of the Ishavasya Upanishad:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"Seek not the\nTruth by abandoning this world<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Or by renouncing all\nyour bounden duties.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>This is indeed not the\npath of salvation.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Rather, desire ye to\nlive a full life of a hundred years,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Actively engaged in the\nselfless perfromance<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>of your duties and\nenjoined actions at all times.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Verily, this is the\nonly way enjoined for man's salvation,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>And not the opposite.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>All actions bear fruit-\ngood or bad.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>And these fruits taint\nhis soul, causing him to be reborn!<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>But the fruits of\nactions- good or otherwise, don't taint that wise man,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>who performs his duties\nselflessly, as an offering to God,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Just as a lotus leaf is\nnot tainted by water, even though touching it.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>But he, who through\nignorance, shirks away from his duties,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Merely deludes himself\nby thinking- 'I am performing any action!'</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Aye! no man can desist\nfrom action for even a single moment.\"</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the 7000\nyear old Upanishads when knowledge of one's Self (Atman) is acquired, knowledge\nof the essence (Self) of the world (Brahman) as well as the relationship\nbetween Atman and Brahman is known.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads say that\nit is due to our ignorance (avidya) that we're not aware of the true nature of\nourselves. When ignorance is removed with right knowledge, the Self shines\nforth in its true nature. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acquisition of\nspiritual knowledge is the supreme purpose of human existence as per\nVedanta.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human beings are superior to\nother forms of life only because they can sufficiently discriminate between the\nreal and the unreal, between the ephemeral and the eternal, between darkness\nand light.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humans pass the mirror and\ncolour test which only a couple of mamals can pass ( like elephants, dolphins,\nbonobos ) <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A man who does not\nstrive to make good of this opportunity and remains lost in materialism\nhas&nbsp; committed spiritual suicide. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 3rd verse of\nIshavasya Upanishad therefore declares:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"<i>The immutable\nsoul is the real nature of man, and not his mortal frame.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Because the soul\nendures from one life to the next,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>whereas the body\nchanges every moment and perishes with death.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>But the materialistic\npeople, enveloped with ignorance, vanity or pride,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>deny the very existence\nof the soul.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>They say- 'Only that\nexists which can be perceived with the senses.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There is nothing\nbeyond, there is no yonder world after death.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Verily, man is but an\nagglomeration of the elements,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>born of the lust of his\nparents.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>We are born with our\nphysical birth, and cease to exist after our death.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Indeed, there is no\nconnection between actions and their fruits.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There no vice or\nvirtue. So eat, drink and be merry.'<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Denying their own true\nessence, <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</i></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>these deluded men have\nkilled their own souls in this very life</i>.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads say that\nthat Brahman is the origin and the end of the world ( alpha and omega ). &nbsp;It is the material cause of the world and the\nworld is a manifestation of Brahman. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahman made the world\nout of itself. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brahmasukta of\nAtharveda (Paippalada Shakha) states<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"(It is) The\nSupreme Being (Who) first spread out the mighty powers collected in Him<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>(It is) The Supreme\nBeing (Who) first spread out the heavenly lights everywhere<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Verily, The Supreme\nBeing was born as first Lord of all that exists<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Who, then is fit to be\nthis Supreme Being's rival</i>\" <b>VIII.9.1 <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"<i>These Heaven and\nEarth are Supreme Being,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The seven currents are\nThe Supreme Being<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>All the Adityas are\nSupreme Being</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>(Verily) All the divine\nbeings contemplate upon the Supreme Being.\"</i> <b>VIII.9.2</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Chaandogya\nUpanishad it is said :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"In the beginning the\nworld was just Being, one only, without a second.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Then it thought to\nitself : \"Would that I were many. Let me procreate myself</i>\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All this is verily\nBrahman. Brahman is that from which everything proceeds, that in which\neverything breathes and that in which everything is finally dissolved.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads are\nfirm that all such evolution is only in the level of name and form and the\noriginal nature of reality is never lost. &nbsp;&nbsp;All the stages of evolution are but\nmanifestations of Brahman, which is the soul of all matter and life\n(sarvabhutaantaraatmaa).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It pervades all phenomena and is the inner controller\n(antaryaamin) of all. &nbsp;&nbsp;\"For respect\nof him fire burns, for respect &nbsp;of him\nthe sun shines and for respect of him the winds, the clouds and death perform\ntheir office\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In its very opening\nverse, the Ishavasya Upanishad reminds us that Brahman is the essence of\nexistence:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"All sentinent and\ninsentinent objects in this ever changing Universe are ephermal and pass away\nwith time.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>But the Lord Who is\nimmanent in everything, and controls it in multifarious ways, is Eternal and\nImperishable.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Seek to realize this\nEternal Truth and do not get entangled in this world.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Enjoy the bounties of\nNature, but with a sense of reunuciation.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Do not hanker too much\nafter riches and do not get obsessed with them.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>To whom does all this\nbelong? Certainly not to any man,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>for we do not bring\nanything with us, nor do we take anything along.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>But He, the Underlying\nReality, owns all this, and we are mere guardians of His Divine riches.\"</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the whole world is\nthe manifestation of Brahman, even the Atman must be Brahman too. The\nMahaavaakyas or the great statements of the Upanishads proclaim : \"Tat\ntvam asi - you are that\" and \"Aham Brahmaasmi - I'm Brahman\". <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both identify Brahman\nto one's own self (Atman). But what's the exact nature of their relationship? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Are they one and the\nsame? The Advaita school of Vedanta takes this stand and gives forth a full\nfledged non-dualistic Absolutism. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But if the Atman is\neternal and unchanging, what about the changes experienced in the world?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Advaita Vedaanta, the changes in the world are unreal (mithya) and\nan illusion (maya).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Are Brahman and Atman\ntotally different? This cannot be, for it is explicitly taught in the\nUpanishads that Brahman is the material cause of the world and the world is the\nmanifestation of Brahman.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Dvaita school\nof Vedanta tells us how the TRINITY operates and causes the dance between\nopposites . &nbsp;Samkhya school of Vedanta\ntells us how Purisha and Pragati creates.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the whole world is\nthe manifestation of Brahman, even the Atman must be Brahman too. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mahaavaakyas or the\ngreat statements of the Upanishads proclaim : \"Tat tvam asi - you are\nthat\" and \"Aham Brahmaasmi - I'm Brahman\". <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
