, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\u201cMananaat trayate iti mantra\u1e25\u201d. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This means \u201cA Mantra is\nsomething which protects us from thinking ( mind chatter )\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reciting Mantras in\nSanskrit and repeating them takes people&nbsp;\ninto a trancelike state and to a much higher level of&nbsp; spiritual awareness. They have a direct\neffect on the mind and on the central nervous system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This causes either a\nsoothing feeling or a powerful one, depending on the Mantra, tone and the speed\nat which it is recited. There are Mantras that can relieve people of physical\npain almost instantaneously. The faith in Mantras add to the power&nbsp; that we can derive out of them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gayatri Mantra\nfinds a mention even in the Vibhuti Yoga of the Bhagavad Gita \u2013 Chapter 10:35<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092c\u0943\u0939\u0924\u094d\u0938\u093e\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0925\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u093e\u092e\u094d\u0928\u093e\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0917\u093e\u092f\u0924\u094d\u0930\u0940</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091b\u0928\u094d\u0926\u0938\u093e\u092e\u0939\u092e\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u200c\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u093e\u0938\u093e\u0928\u093e\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u093e\u0930\u094d\u0917\u0936\u0940\u0930\u094d\u0937\u094b\u093d\u0939\u092e\u0943\u0924\u0942\u0928\u093e\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u0941\u0938\u0941\u092e\u093e\u0915\u0930\u0903\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">35</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Transliteration:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">brhat-saama tathaa\nsaamnaam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">gaayatri chandasaamaham<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">maasaanaam maarga\nsheershoh \u2018ham<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">mrtunaam kusumaakarah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meaning:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of the Vedic hymns I am\nthe Brihat Saama, of the metres I am the Gaayatri, of months I am Maargashirsha\n(The 9th lunar month corresponding to November and December), of seasons I am\nspring.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most common metre\nis the \u2018Anushtup Chanda\u2019 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0928\u0941\u0937\u094d\u091f\u0941\u092a\u094d\u091b\u0928\u094d\u0926\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> . Verses composed in\nthe Anushtup Chanda are quatrains. Each stanza has four lines consisting of 8\nsyllables each. Every quatrain in Anushtup Chanda has 32 syllables.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The entire\nValmiki Ramayana&nbsp; and the Mahabharata\nare&nbsp; composed in Anusthup Chanda.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term Chanda means\n\"pleasing, alluring, lovely, delightful, charming\", and is based on\nthe root chad which means \"to seem good, feel pleasant, esteemed to please,\nsomething that nourishes, gratifies, is celebrated\". The term also refers\nto \"any metrical part of the Vedas or other composition\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brahmanas layer of\nVedic literature, contain a complete expression of the Chandas. Panini's\ntreatise on Sanskrit grammar distinguishes Chandas as verses that compose the\nVedas, and Bhasya to be the speech language used for learned discourse and\nscholastic discussion of the Vedas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A syllable (Akshara),\nin Sanskrit prosody, is a vowel with one or more consonants, or a vowel without\nany. The short syllable is one with short (hrasva) vowels, which are a (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\ni (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0907</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\nu (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0909</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\n\u1e5b (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)\nand \u1e37 (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090c</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">).\nThe long syllable is defined as one with long (dirgha) vowels, which are \u0101 (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0906</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\n\u012b (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0908</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\n\u016b (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\n\u1e5d (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0960</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\ne (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\nai (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0910</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\no (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0913</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)\nand au (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0914</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A stanza (p\u0101da) is\ndefined in Sanskrit prosody as a group of four verses, also called as four\nquarters.&nbsp; Indian prosody studies\ndeveloped two types of stanzas. Vritta stanza are those that are crafted with\nprecise number syllables, while Jati stanza are those that are designed based\non syllabic instants (morae, matra).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vritta stanza are\nfurther recognized in three forms, with Samavritta where the four quarters are\nsimilar in its embedded mathematical pattern, Ardhasamavritta where alternate\nverses keep similar syllabic structure, and Vishamavritta where all four\nquarters are different.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A regular Vritta is\ndefined as that where the total number of syllables in each verse is less than\nor equal to 26 syllables, while irregulars contain more. When syllabic instants\n(matra) is the foundation of the Sanskrit prosody, a short syllable is counted\nas one instant, and a long syllable is counted as two instants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The metres found in\nclassical Sanskrit poetry are sometimes alternatively classified into three\nkinds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Syllabic verse (ak\u1e63arav\u1e5btta\nor aksharavritta): meters depend on the number of syllables in a verse, with\nrelative freedom in the distribution of light and heavy syllables. This style\nis derived from older Vedic forms, and found in the great epics, the\nMahabharata and the Ramayana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Syllabo-quantitative\nverse (var\u1e47av\u1e5btta or varnavritta): meters depend on syllable count, but the\nlight-heavy patterns are fixed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quantitative verse\n(m\u0101tr\u0101v\u1e5btta or matravritta): meters depend on duration, where each verse-line\nhas a fixed number of morae, usually grouped in sets of four.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In most of Sanskrit\npoetry the primary determinant of a meter is the number of syllables in a unit\nof verse, called the p\u0101da (\"foot\" or \"quarter\"). Meters of\nthe same length are distinguished by the pattern of laghu (\"light\")\nand guru (\"heavy\") syllables in the p\u0101da.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rules distinguishing\nlaghu and guru syllables are the same as those for non-metric prose, and these\nare specified in Vedic Shiksha texts that study the principles and structure of\nsound, such as the Pratisakhyas. Some of the significant rules are:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A syllable is laghu\nonly if its vowel is hrasva (\"short\") and followed by at most one\nconsonant before another vowel is encountered.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A syllable with an\nanusvara ('\u1e43') or a visarga ('\u1e25') is always guru.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All other syllables are\nguru, either because the vowel is d\u012brgha (\"long\"), or because the\nhrasva vowel is followed by a consonant cluster.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hrasva vowels are\nthe short monophthongs: 'a', 'i', 'u', '\u1e5b' and '\u1e37'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All other vowels are\ndirgha: '\u0101', '\u012b', '\u016b', '\u1e5d', 'e', 'ai', 'o' and 'au'. (Note that,\nmorphologically, the last four vowels are actually the diphthongs 'ai', '\u0101i',\n'au' and '\u0101u', as the rules of sandhi in Sanskrit make clear.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gangadasa Pandita\nstates that the last syllable in each p\u0101da may be considered guru, but a guru\nat the end of a p\u0101da is never counted as laghu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For measurement by\nm\u0101tr\u0101 (morae), laghu syllables count as one unit, and guru syllables as two\nunits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ga\u1e47a (Sanskrit,\n\"group\") is the technical term for the pattern of light and heavy\nsyllables in a sequence of three. It is used in treatises on Sanskrit prosody\nto describe meters, according to a method first propounded in Pingala's\nchandahsutra. Pingala organizes the meters using two units:[35]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">l: a \"light\"\nsyllable (L), called laghu<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">g: a \"heavy\"\nsyllable (H), called guru<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pingala's method\ndescribed any meter as a sequence of ga\u1e47as, or triplets of syllables\n(trisyllabic feet), plus the excess, if any, as single units. There being eight\npossible patterns of light and heavy syllables in a sequence of three, Pingala\nassociated a letter, allowing the meter to be described compactly as an\nacronym.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Greek and Latin prosodies\nare lifted blatantly from Sanskrit prosody.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The attempt to identify\nthe most pleasing sounds and perfect compositions led ancient Indian scholars\nto study permutations and combinatorial methods of enumerating musical meters.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Pingala Sutras includes a discussion of binary system rules to calculate\npermutations of Vedic meters. Pingala, and more particularly the classical\nSanskrit prosody period scholars, developed the art of Matrameru, which is the\nfield of counting sequences such as 0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8 and so on <b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">(Fibonacci\nnumbers)</b>, in their prosody studies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><b>FIBONACCI WAS A THIEF - I HEREBY TRASH HIM&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/perfect-six-pack-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/perfect-six-pack-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</span></a><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-40D9I-w1Zx4/V4aIeSQ9EkI/AAAAAAABLBQ/Hq0yeDVdZsQtsaUc4dWFwWmJsHgk6bkwQCLcB/s1600/72726df91.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-40D9I-w1Zx4/V4aIeSQ9EkI/AAAAAAABLBQ/Hq0yeDVdZsQtsaUc4dWFwWmJsHgk6bkwQCLcB/s400/72726df91.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Fibonacci sequence\nappears in ANCIENT Vedic &nbsp;mathematics, and\nin connection with Sanskrit prosody. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Sanskrit oral\ntradition, there was much emphasis on how long (L) syllables mix with the short\n(S), and counting the different patterns of L and S within a given fixed length\nresults in the Fibonacci numbers;&nbsp;&nbsp; the\nnumber of patterns that are m short syllables long is the Fibonacci number Fm +\n1.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any pattern of duration\nn can be formed by adding a short syllable to a pattern of duration n \u2212 1, or a\nlong syllable to a pattern of duration n \u2212 2; &nbsp;the number of patterns of duration n is the\nsum of the two previous numbers in the sequence. &nbsp;Algorithms were given for ranking and\noutranking these patterns (e.g. finding the kth pattern of duration n)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit vowel sounds\ncan be long (L) or short (S), and Virahanka's analysis, which came to be known\nas m\u0101tr\u0101-v\u1e5btta, wishes to compute how many metres (m\u0101tr\u0101s) of a given overall\nlength can be composed of these syllables.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the long syllable is twice as\nlong as the short, the solutions are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1 mora: S (1 pattern)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2 morae: SS; L (2)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3 morae: SSS, SL; LS\n(3)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4 morae: SSSS, SSL,\nSLS; LSS, LL (5)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5 morae: SSSSS, SSSL,\nSSLS, SLSS, SLL; LSSS, LSL, LLS (8)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6 morae: SSSSSS, SSSSL,\nSSSLS, SSLSS, SLSSS, LSSSS, SSLL, SLSL, SLLS, LSSL, LSLS, LLSS, LLL (13)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7 morae: SSSSSSS,\nSSSSSL, SSSSLS, SSSLSS, SSLSSS, SLSSSS, LSSSSS, SSSLL, SSLSL, SLSSL, LSSSL,\nSSLLS, SLSLS, LSSLS, SLLSS, LSLSS, LLSSS, SLLL, LSLL, LLSL, LLLS (21)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A pattern of length n\ncan be formed by adding S to a pattern of length n\u22121, or L to a pattern of\nlength n\u22122; and the prosodicists showed that the number of patterns of length n\nis the sum of the two previous numbers in the sequence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-HltwpMtzybE/V4aSBBezdOI/AAAAAAABLBw/hCc4lrXCyR8Eay2HmlHLZEZhkJWS8RC9QCLcB/s1600/Pascal_FibonacSSci.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-HltwpMtzybE/V4aSBBezdOI/AAAAAAABLBw/hCc4lrXCyR8Eay2HmlHLZEZhkJWS8RC9QCLcB/s1600/Pascal_FibonacSSci.png\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first five rows of\nthe Pascal's triangle, also called the Halayudha's triangle.&nbsp; Halayudha discusses this and more in his\nSanskrit prosody bhasya on Pingala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The &nbsp;Hal\u0101yudha's commentary on Pingala Sutras,\ndeveloped meruprast\u0101ra, which mirrors the Pascal's triangle in the west, and\nnow also called as the Halayudha's triangle in books on mathematics.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ratnakarashanti's\nChandoratnakara describes algorithms to enumerate binomial combinations of\nmeters through pratyaya. For a given class (length), the six pratyaya were:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">prast\u0101ra, the\n\"table of arrangement\": a procedure for enumerating (arranging in a\ntable) all metres of the given length,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">na\u1e63\u1e6da: a procedure for\nfinding a metre given its position in the table (without constructing the whole\ntable),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">uddi\u1e63\u1e6da: a procedure\nfor finding the position in the table of a given metre (without constructing\nthe whole table),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">laghukriy\u0101 or\nlagakriy\u0101: calculation of the number of metres in the table containing a given\nnumber of laghu (or guru) syllables,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">sa\u1e43khy\u0101: calculation of\nthe total number of metres in the table,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">adhvan: calculation of\nthe space needed to write down the prast\u0101ra table of a given class (length).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some authors also\nconsidered, for a given metre, (A) the number of guru syllables, (B) the number\nof laghu syllables, (C) the total number of syllables, and (D) the total number\nof m\u0101tras, giving expressions for each of these in terms of any two of the\nother three. (The basic relations being that C=A+B and D=2A+B.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-zJ7yWEDT4IQ/V4aHFfTFsVI/AAAAAAABLBI/D85C7PyJRsgtDTxJRAk3UadkB4sN3pBuQCLcB/s1600/250px-PascalTriangleAnimategd2.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-zJ7yWEDT4IQ/V4aHFfTFsVI/AAAAAAABLBI/D85C7PyJRsgtDTxJRAk3UadkB4sN3pBuQCLcB/s1600/250px-PascalTriangleAnimategd2.gif\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6066308035232767963\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_39M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/12/ie-irodov-tribute-to-russian-professor.html?showComment=1468485410878#c6066308035232767963\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 14, 2016 at 2:06 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_39MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nI NOW TRASH ITALIAN THIEF FIBONACCI ! HIS SERIES IS NOTHING BUT THE VEDIC SERIES WRITTEN DOWN AT LEAST 6500 YEARS EARLIER !!<br />\n<br />\nHERE IS THE THE LIST OF MAHA MERUS WHO FOOLED THE WORLD , WHOM I HAVE TRASHED INTO THE GARBAGE BIN OF THE PLANET.<br />\n<br />\nGARBAGE BUCKET LIST:<br />\n<br />\n1) BERTRAND RUSSEL<br />\n2) ROMILA THAPAR<br />\n3) IRFAN HABIB<br />\n4) NOAM CHOMSKY<br />\n5) RAMCHANDRA GUHA<br />\n6) SHELDON POLLOCK<br />\n7) SIGMUND FREUD<br />\n8) GEORG WILHELM HEGEL<br />\n9) AMARTYA SEN<br />\n10) WENDY DONIGER<br />\n11) FREIDRICH WILHELM NIETZSCHE<br />\n12) IMMANUEL KANT<br />\n13 ) BARUCH SPINOZA<br />\n14) ALBERT EINSTEIN<br />\n15) ISAAC NEWTON<br />\n16) GUGLEILMO MARCONI<br />\n17) CHARLES DARWIN<br />\n18) KARL MARX<br />\n19) MAX WEBER<br />\n20) THOMAS ALVA EDISON<br />\n21) FIBONACCI<br />\n<br />\nNOTE: MENTAL MIDGETS LIKE ROMILA THAPAR , INFAN HABIB , RAMACHANDRA GUHA, SHELDON POLLOCK, WENDY DONIGER MUST BE THANKFUL THAT THEY ARE INCLUDED AMONG A LIST OF CEREBRAL GIANTS<br />\n<br />\n#########################<br />\n<br />\nHERE ARE PEOPLE WHO MADE A DENT IN THE UNIVERSE\u2014 THEY GET THE \"VADAKAYIL PRIZE\". THIS IS NOT A VESTED \u201cNOBEL PRIZE \u201c<br />\n<br />\n1) NIKOLA TESLA<br />\n2) DIMITRI MENDELEYEEV<br />\n3) IE IRODOV<br />\n4) ARYABHATTA<br />\n5) SRINIVASAN RAMANUJAN<br />\n6) CHANAKYA<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n.</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanting of Mantras\nregularly brings about great clarity in the mind. It makes us feel stronger and\nconfident and gives us the feeling of being in tune with Nature.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our subconscious mind\ncontrols all involuntary actions in our body such as our heart beat, breathing\nrate, digestive system, etc. The chanting of powerful Mantras energises our\nsubconscious mind. This ensures that&nbsp; all\nsystems function well and good health is maintained. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It also systematically realises one by\none,&nbsp; the dreams and aspirations of the\nperson chanting them with devotion and total faith. Regular chanting of Mantras\nensures peace of mind and the unexplainably amazing feeling of being one with\nNature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">SWARA PROTECTION:</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is an advanced\nmethod of protection. It protects not only words of Vedas but also tone of\nChanting. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedas are chanted in\nlevel of pitch. They are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">i)Uddata = Pronounced\nin Normal pitch. Syllables aren't marked for it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ii)Anudatta =\nPronounced in Lower pitch. Syllables are marked by sign \"_\" below it.\nSyllables bearing such signs are chanted with lower pitch.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">iii)Swarita =\nPronounced in Higher pitch. Syllables are marked with longer ' sign above it.\nThey are chanted with higher pitch.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">iv) Dirgha swarita = It\nis Swarita pronounced for longer time period. Represented by longer '' sign\nabove syllable. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For eg. Here is an\nexample of Swara marks:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rig-Gayatri<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A single mantra has\nvarious signs in various places thus giving a specific tone to it. Thus Swara\nprotection protects even tone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara is a note in the\noctave. The seven basic swaras of the scale are named shadja, rishabh, gandhar,\nmadhyam, pancham, dhaivat and nishad, and are shortened to Sa, &nbsp;Re, Ga, Ma, Pa, Dha, and Ni .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the general sense\nsvara means tone, and applies to chanting and singing. The basic swaras of\nVedic chanting are udatta, anudatta and svarita. The musical octave is said to\nhave evolved from the elaborate and elongated chants of Sama Veda, based on\nthese basic swaras.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Siksha is the subject that deals with phonetics and\npronunciation. Naradiya Siksha elaborately discusses the nature of swaras, both\nVedic chants and the octave.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">MUDRA PROTECTION :</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To protect even the\ntone more precisely, Mudras ie. position of specific position of hands and\nheads are moved.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ud\u0101tta - right hand to\nshoulder <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">anud\u0101tta - hand to knee\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">svarita - hand moved to\n45 degree angle to the body <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ud\u0101tta - head up <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">anud\u0101tta - head down <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">svarita - head turned\nslightly to the side<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ud\u0101tta - palm turned up\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">anud\u0101tta - palm down <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">svarita- hand moved\nhorizontaly to the right <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ud\u0101tta - thumb on index\nfinger <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">anud\u0101tta - thumb on\nlittle finger <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">svarita - thumb on ring\nfinger<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this way an advanced\nVeda reader can immediately recognize mistake in pronounciation just by looking\nthe chanters hand position.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PATHA PROTECTION:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is an advanced\nmethod applied for protection of Vedas. It includes method of recitation of\nVedas by repitition of syllables and words. There are various Patha methods\nlike 'Vakya', 'Krama', 'Pada', 'Jata', 'Ghana' etc.. Among them Ghana is the\nmost advanced method. In Ghana recitation single syllable is recited 13 times.\nThe pattern is<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1-2, 2-1, 1-2-3, 3-2-1,\n1-2-3 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2-3, 3-2, 2-3-4, 4-3-2,\n2-3-4</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3-4, 4-3, 3-4-5, 5-4-3,\n3-4-5</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.....\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For eg. Gayatri mantra\nis chanted in Ghana Path in this way:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot;
